story:
I am an Indian woman 50 ,a successful Businesswoman, a kind Humanitarian and  A Passionate Mountaineer who at 46 summitted  Mount Kilimanjaro 19341 feet the highest mountain in Africa.  Have already scaled Mount Elbrus 18500feet , the highest in Europe, Mount Vinson 16000 feet in Antarctica and Mount Aconcagoa 22847feet in South America.  I aim to attempt Mount Everest in 2017. Since I started climbing so late, I am doubly energized to fulfill my dreams. I am currently connected with a NGO for women of the underpriveliged society who do not have the funds to either pursue their education or enhance their status through skill training. 

 I have always been passionate about what I do in my life. My campaign aims to :

  • Raise Funds for women to make them economically independent
  • Inspire women to pursue their dreams 
  • Instill a sense of hope that age is not a barrier to success
  • Mind is a powerful tool to get anywhere
  • It is extremely important for me to see women rise high and I am ready to help them reach their goals. I would request you to contribute to this worthy cause to assist them to reach the pinnacle of their lives. I have always preached what I have practiced and climbing Everest will be my ultimate challenge.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise US 70,000 for:

  • Skill training and education of  1000 women in 3 different states of India. Punjab, Jammu and kashmir and Haryana this year. costs related to education, workshops, teachers, and need based training equivalent to US 200 per candidate. This will be done via fees, interview preperation, Group discussions, resume building and job hunting.
  • For every contributor of US50 Donation, you receive a cap from Impact women power
  • For each contributor of US 100 donation, you receive a autographed full blown picture copy from Sangeeta
  • For each contributor of US 200 donation, you get a chance to attend her event for mountains
  • For Donations over US1000, you get a chance to meet her for tea
The funds gathered herewill be first used to empower the women and then later for Everest needs. 
 EVEREST CLIMB 2017
Climbing Everest is not for the meek or the fainthearted. It takes years of experience and numerous climbs and months of strenous training to be able to attempt Everest. It adds up to  years of preperation before the climb and working out at high alttudes. The costs and risks are heavy.  Do support where you can.
Rough costs of climbing Everest
Logistics (guide) $20,000 – $80,000 
Climbing Fees $16,650 – $21,650

Supplies/Gear $12,000


........................................................................................

Risks & Challenges


This Campaign is a valuable tool to help out those that cannot afford it via my cause to raise the bar for women. Theres nothing that a woman cannot achieve given a chance. lets give women a chance to do well. A educated and self sufficient woman will raise intelligent kids and kids are the future to our society.
I am of the firm belief that by risking my life to climb EVEREST, I am showing mental prowess for any woman to succeed. Age is not a barrier except for your self and your inherent belief. 
Let me also elaborate on the last 4 years since my climbing began. I have faced numerous hurdles in training especially since I got injured in my right knee, tearing my ACL completely in Denali 2014. I have been able to overcome my feeling that I can still climb after I took regular sessions with physiotherapy and challenged myself to climb Mount Aconcagoa in early 2015. I plan to attempt Denali once again in 2016.
Everest is of course another story. The physical training goes a long way and after that is exhausted it is only the mental strength that takes you to the top. I hope to inspire women to not stop until they have achieved their goals. Its very easy to give up and takes a lot of persistence to keep going. This campaign will direct women to keep going.

I will also go through plenty of challenges to keep going and need your support in helping out.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help me promote this by sharing my campaign on social media and where ever you can mention.

story:
Free PC Repair & Free I.T. Services – Help us make it happen

Who Are We?

SphereNix was first established back in 2006 as an I.T. solution provider for profit (SphereNix, Inc.). We wanted to provide technical solutions to small businesses focusing on Cloud Services and On-site Help Desk. Some of the services we offered when we first launched were but not limited to:

  • Web Hosting
  • Email Services
  • On-site Technical Support
  • Remote Technical Support

At the time, the industry was booming with these requirements but the cost of data centers and the rise of gas prices were starting to cut into our profits. Cost became an issue and clients were closing down their businesses. Our business suffered financially and we had to eventually dissolve our company.

After a few years of planning, we (SphereNix, Corp) changed our business model. We wanted to offer the same services but expand our audience. We also wanted to do something meaningful that people could value. Our idea of having such a business meant that we would be giving back to our community and assisting individuals, schools, and small businesses. This is when we decided to go non-profit and established our non-profit organization in January of 2015.

SphereNix is a non-profit organization that focuses on assisting individuals, schools, and small businesses with their computing needs. We provide a wide range of technical support and services at no cost in the City of Oviedo and its neighboring counties for those who live close by but also offer remote support and services for those that are not in Central Florida. We believe that individuals, schools, and small startup businesses should be able to focus on what matters most by eliminating the costly hours of technical support. Our services are offered at no cost to you. Our organization appreciates any contribution to support our vision of providing these services at no cost to everyone. All proceeds are used to help sustain this organization and provide donations to numerous charities and qualifying individual causes, such as medical fundraisers, educational scholarships, and more.

Vision / Mission

Our vision / mission is to provide a wide range of technical services to schools, individuals, small businesses, and other non-profit organizations. We believe that schools should focus on providing a solid education to students while compensating teachers for their extremely big role in teaching. SphereNix hopes that by schools leveraging our services, they can focus on improving their curriculum and provide a more competitive salary to teachers and faculty. We believe that this will improve the quality of the educational system. We have the same vision for individuals, small businesses, and non-profit organizations. 

Individuals should be comfortable purchasing a computer for their household and not worry about the expense of computer repair. We want to take that burden away from families so they can focus on more important things such as encouraging themselves and children to get more involved with computers, allocating budgets where needed most, and providing a better education for their children. Small businesses are the seed of solid communities. SphereNix believes that by supporting small businesses with their technical needs at no cost, businesses can focus on growing and expanding upon their business model to create more jobs within their communities. The I.T. expense involved in any company should be reallocated to creating jobs for the community. 

Non-profit organizations, like us, are the roots to possibilities. It is for this reason that we fully support other non-profit organizations with technical services. Non-profit organizations should always focus on their goals and causes. SphereNix is here to facilitate any technical challenges so that your organization can help solve real world problems that you dedicate yourselves to.

Donations

SphereNix​ works strictly on donations for all services and solutions we provide.

In order to make this vision a reality, we need funding for equipment and overhead costs. Overhead costs include but are not limited to: rental location, utilities and other bills, employee salaries, tools and equipment, etc.  Right now our resources are very limited. We have the manpower to make this possible but not all the tools that we need. 

Your donations will make this vision possible. We would be able to purchase the equipment we need and pay the overhead costs to keep this organization going. No donation is too small.

The Team

Our team comprises nine individuals with diverse talents. We are college graduates with years of experience in the technical field. Our team consist of graduates holding degrees and numerous certifications in but not limited to Finance, Business Management, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems Management, Information Technology, System and Network Administration, and Information Security.

Some of the Team Members – when we first got our location


Goal

Our ultimate goal is to offer this service beyond the City of Orlando and the State of Florida. We would like to offer this service across the nation and eventually expand globally. We feel that everyone should focus on the important things that matter most to them while leaving the technical work to us. Together, we can truly make a difference.

Services

If we meet our goal of $200,000, we’ll be able to offer the following services at no cost:

  • PC Repair
  • Remote Technical Support
  • Windows Desktop Support
  • Linux Desktop Support
  • OS X Desktop Support
  • Android Support on Mobile Devices
  • iOS Support on Mobile Devices
  • Data Recovery and Migration
  • Virus Cleanup
  • How-to Videos & Documentation

Some of the tools made available that allow us to provide support to you are but not limited to:

  • Knowledgebase / Wiki Page
  • Ticketing System
  • Technical Conference Tools for Troubleshooting
  • Forums
  • Q&A Topic Discussions

If we meet or exceed a goal of $750,000, we’ll be able to staff members full time, hire more individuals, and offer the following additional services:

  • System and Network Monitoring
  • System and Network Administration
  • Repairs of Shipped Hardware
  • Web Design
  • Application / Software Development
  • Web Hosting and Email Services

Life After Campaign / Goal

What happens after the campaign is met?

  • The funding from our campaign will help us purchase the hardware and software we need to open up for business. The funding will also assist us in doing wholesale buy-ins for computing parts in order to repair the hardware that comes in for service. All profits obtained from the sale of any product goes towards supporting our mission and sustaining this organization. 
If your goal isn't met, what happens next?
  • Any funding we receive will assist us in many ways. We won't stop with our mission even if our goal isn't met. However, depending on the amount of funding received, only limited services will be offered until the appropriate funding can be allocated for future services.

How Else Can You Help?

Money isn't the only thing we need. Sure, it'll definitely help us purchase the items needed to offer the services we'd like to offer. However, we are open to accepting equipment as donations. We are in dire need of three new servers, network switches, workstations, two 1080p televisions for our ticketing queue and network monitoring, computer monitors, and more. Whatever you can do to help us is always appreciated!

Most importantly, spread the word!!! We don't only cater to our local community. We are looking forward to providing remote support as well. Share our campaign with as many people as  you can. 

Thank You!!!

Thank you in advance for allowing us the opportunity to serve you. We believe in our mission and we will move forward with our vision.

Keep checking SphereNix, Corp for more info and updates on our progress or follow us on:

Twitter
Google+
LinkedIn
Facebook

Build Progress

story:
BeautieSocial is a beauty + lifestyle blog that rewards its members with real products. 

We’re bringing a new style of blogging to the web by merging beauty blogging and beauty sample bags into one fun site. We want to share stories, faves, dislikes and so much more with our readers while offering them a chance to collect points, which they can redeem for some really cool beauty products. 

There is no subscription service with BeautieSocial. You read, interact, collect points, and then spend when you want. With 3 levels of beauty sample bags to save up and redeem for, there is an awesome bag for all users.

We are big fans of sample bags & boxes like ipsy, Birchbox, Glossybox and countless others. How can you not like a sweet surprise in the mail?! If you could get those surprises for free by interacting with a blog and their posts, wouldn't you want to join?




We are 2 girls from Palm Springs, California who love makeup, coffee, shopping, Star Wars and [most importantly] blogging. We are both makeup artists and individual hobby bloggers for about 3 years each.

Even though we are similar in many ways, we lead quite different lives.

By day, Linda is a marketing manager and graphic designer who wears extremely minimal makeup. Sleep rocks! But by night, she is a blogger raising fur children with her husband and sports winged eyeliner for every. single. occasion.

Elizabeth is the mother of 2 rambunctious boys and girlfriend to the crankiest, yet sweetest man on the planet. When she’s able to control her addiction for messy buns & PJs, she becomes a boss freelance makeup artist and writes editorial pieces for her beauty blog.

But most importantly, we are friends inside and outside of blogging.

Your contribution will help fund BeautieSocial and allow us to bring our vision to life. We are asking for funds to help produce and finish our website this year. We have been working on this idea for over a year and need financial assistance to complete important key areas of our business. 

Our initial goal of $2250 will go entirely into creating our blog, from business supplies and requirements to website development. This money will also help fund the first batch of mailings to our readers, as well as blog promotions and those way-too-common unforeseeable expenses. 

This project really means so much to both of us. We love blogging and beauty, and we know with our experience and knowledge in the beauty community, we can turn this into a successful website. We want to share our passion and know-how with the world. 

 So far, we have funded everything ourselves. Our great relationships with past sponsors from our own personal blogs is how we plan to create the first round of rewards. But we need your help to get off the ground.




There is over a year of thought, money, time and learning invested into this new venture. We want to hit our goal and go full-swing into this blog. 

The only challenge we foresee is our timeline if we don’t reach our full goal. The date of our launch party and organizing the sponsors for the gifts may be slightly delayed since we have to wait longer to gather additional resources. 

Throughout this campaign, we’ll keep you up-to-date on our progress.


SHARE SHARE SHARE! If you are unable to support us with a monetary contribution, please spread the word about BeautieSocial. Sign up for early access at beautiesocial.com, then share this campaign with family and friends on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. 

How will your blog earn money?
We plan to take the traditional route of blogging income. We are in talks with sponsors for future sponsored blog and social media posts, blog ads, and affiliate marketing.
As our blog grows, we will expand our ways to earn income, such as sponsored videos.

Can anyone join?
Anyone in the US of legal age can join BeautieSocial. We are looking forward to growing in other countries, too!

How long will it take to get my reward? 
Once the campaign ends, we’ll start working on our blog and the rewards immediately. We’ll also send you a form to get more information in order to fulfill your perk. We’ll keep you updated throughout the entire process. 

What will you do if you surpass your campaign goal? 
Wouldn’t that be incredible?! If we happen to surpass our goal, we’ll put that money toward our blog - no ifs, ands or buts about it. 

What is the estimated launch date? 
We’re planning a soft launch in August for beta testing. During the beta phase, we’ll work tirelessly to get all the kinks out and produce awesome blog content. Our beauty bag rewards will launch around October-November, which is the same time we are planning to host our launch party in Southern California. Party on, Garth! {Did I just show my age?} 

What happens if your campaign goal is not reached? 
Although that would be a MAJOR bummer, we will still persevere on. It will take us a little longer to get BeautieSocial off the ground, but it WILL get off the ground.

Where can I learn more?
If you want to chat with us, you can reach us through the contact button at the top of the campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Mommy Oasis is a world class recharging facility to provide working moms with 45-60 min twice a week to switch from "work" to "mommy" mode. Working moms are provided with 8 hours of recharging time per month to transition for a modest monthly membership cost. Mommy Oasis is laser focused on providing moms with world class amenities, service, and worry free childcare to provide an unparalleled recharging experience.

What We Need 

This business model and business plan is new so we will use the funds to:

* Purchase Furniture for our West Hills CA Location

*Purchase the remaining electronics

*Complete construction on our beautiful 1127 sq ft location

The Impact

The working mom landscape has changed tremendously over the 20 years and mommy burnout is real. We are here to help assist in stopping this in California this year, but expanding to 12 major cities over the next 5 years. The end result is happier working moms! This dedicated recharging time will positively impact marriages, children, and ultimately the world!

Short Summary Mommy Oasis is a world class recharging facility to provide working moms with 45-60 min twice a week to switch from "work" to "mommy" mode. Working moms are provided with 8 hours of recharging time per month to transition for a modest monthly membership cost. Mommy Oasis is laser focused on providing moms with world class amenities, service, and worry free childcare to provide an unparalleled recharging experience.   What We Need  This business model and business plan is new so we will use the funds to:
* Purchase Furniture for our West Hills CA Location
*Purchase the remaining electronics
*Complete construction on our beautiful 1127 sq ft location
The Impact
 The working mom landscape has changed tremendously over the 20 years and mommy burnout is real. We are here to help assist in stopping this in California this year, but expanding to 12 major cities over the next 5 years. The end result is happier working moms! This dedicated recharging time will positively impact marriages, children, and ultimately the world!

story:
The On the Edge Women In Business CLUB is a 24-hour interactive-ecosystem web club platform.  It is a CLUB as a service, established by Business On the Edge, Incorporated a Silicon Valley/Bay Area company.   WATCH OUR VIDEO 

On the Edge Women In Business CLUB Founder - Margaret Jackson Small Business Coach and Silicon Valley/Bay Area Radio Show Host on AM 1220 KDOW Radio and AM 1100 KFAX .  "My heart is sensitive toward the business and professional success of women throughout our world. I was compelled to do something that would give women access to a community, to business and professional resources 24/7, and platforms that I have the power and authority to share.  We are the Women Titans of the 21st century as we stand together, we win together through our business club support system.  It is our CLUB, your CLUB, and my CLUB"  
                                                        WATCH  OUR VIDEO

Why we launched a Small Business WIB CLUB?  Women small business owners have lacked a consistent accessibility to much-needed business development resources and tools that would benefit their business and professional growth at an affordable cost, no cost, or very low cost on a day-to-day basis. The goal was to design an online/offline ecosystem of business resources, network activities & events, and advertising, marketing & branding, exposure, opportunities for women that own small businesses.  

The network center below is the current CLUB connection ecosystem of resources for club member access.  Each member receives a member number, login, and password providing them access to the entire CLUB's business resources & tools, direct networking opportunities, and building friendships with other professional women that face the same small business day-to-day challenges.  We are solving small business day-to-day challenges by keeping the CLUB website relevant.  

The On the Edge Women In Business CLUB is a model that provides online resources and activities for members-only through the club website portal.  The CLUB member benefits include but not limited to CLUB member discounts on event tickets, vendor booths, and opens the door to opportunities to, possibly, becoming presenters, radio guests, podcast presenters for additional reach and exposure. 

 CLUB Features include...  WATCH OUR VIDEO


When you become a member and are active using the above ecosystem you will begin to achieve new results for your business thereby developing your own ecosystem that provides support to your business and career.  If you want to improve your bottom-line join the club.    


                     

Access the CLUB resources anytime during the day or night.  Become a Local Chapter and enjoy local interaction and networking with women in your area (Board approval required).  

WATCH OUR VIDEO   - JOIN THE CLUB      

CLUB Member Jackie Welch - TIRO Life Coaching and a Predictive Index Consultant Radio Show Guest:  AM 1220 KDOW Money 2.0 Business On the Edge with Margaret Jackson (Silicon Valley/Bay Area - Includes worldwide streaming)   
What We Need? WATCH OUR VIDEO

1000 Women In Small Business in 40 Days Nationwide

We need your help to make this a Nationwide CLUB that allows us to support the many women that desire to realize small business sustainability and career growth. 

You're never alone as an On the Edge Women In Business CLUB member.  Together we can build an army of small business Women Titans!  

  • We need to grow the On the Edge Women In Business CLUB to 1000 women in small business within the next 40 days NationWIDE.    
  • We need to establish CLUB Chapters around the U.S. starting with the top 5 markets in the U.S. San Francisco, Chicago, Dallas, Los Angeles, and New York in that order.  We are in San Francisco/Bay Area and are currently building professional bridges into Chicago and Dallas.
  • We need to provide FREE monthly Online Lunch & Learn webinar platform that can be taught by CLUB members and open to the public.  Pre-registrations for CLUB members.       
  • We need to establish compliance and legal protocols within our student/college memberships to start accepting memberships for students 13-21 years.
  • We need to attract Chapter requests to establish CLUB Chapters & Presidents in On the Edge Women In Business CLUB  around the country and provide modest Chapter stipend support. 

Kelly Ann's Day Spa is our 1st Official On the Edge Women In Business CLUB Chapter located in Pleasant Hill, California.  CLUB Headquarters is in San Jose, CA Silicon Valley/Bay Area.     

What You Get?  Perk Up! DID YOU WATCH THE VIDEO?

Our perks will be bundled so, you can pick the perk that PERKS you up.  See perks descriptions for bundle details.  If we reach our funding level we will reach out to you to offer a post-campaign perk for the This Girl Is On Fire! Women On the RiSe Small Business Women Expo & Summit 2016.
  • Featured Perk 1000 Women Member Perk - $70 Contribution
  • CLUB Membership Special - $10 Contribution 
  • Men "We Believe In You!" $25 Contribution 
  • JUMP for Greatness! - $50 Contribution
Get a 2-Day Hotel certificate can be used within 12 months of certificate activation and at hotels throughout the U.S. and Canada with participating hotels (these are nice hotels wink-wink sneak away from work and treat yourself to some you time - 2 guests

The On the Edge WIB CLUB Impact

Your contribution and support of this CLUB will allow us to help more women small business owners, career women, and our young ladies across this Nation to aspire to grow their businesses, boost their careers, and advance in their education.  

  • It will allow us to reach out to companies that have products for small businesses and work with them to extend discounts/preferred rates to our CLUB members. The more women in the CLUB the greater we are able to advocate for getting additional support that you need.  
  • We impact by working to maintain up-to-date with relevant business solutions through our Small Business Concierge.    
  • We want to impact and diminish the 10%-12% small business nationwide closure rate stated by the Small Business Administration through our support of women in small business.  

  • We impact the NEXT generation of young ladies through our This Girl Is On Fire! Small Business Women Expo & Summit that gives away student scholarships in the areas of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics (S.T.E.A.M.)      
  • We impact and invest in today's women in small business and professional women with business training seminars/webinars such as Power Women Power Secret, Financial Education Services Credit Restoration and Business Credit, TIRO's Time Management, The Anatomy of a Business Plan, Small Business Compliance Training, Women Titans of the 21st Century, Family Matters, Work-Life Balance, Investments, Securities, and Insurances. 

                                     

                 Small Busines Concierge CLUB Member Shopping page, just launched in April 2016!  

 

Small Business Testimonials   WATCH OUR VIDEO
  • What a blessing and answer to prayer is the Women In Business club! Margaret Jackson has not only taught me the foundations for building a healthy and viable business but has walked me thru the process step by step.  Her coaching and guidance as well as challenging me to do what it takes to see my vision come to life has led me to a place of seeing my potential on another level.  Margaret has paved a way for female business owners to have a platform and share their entrepreneurial dreams and see them come to fruition –step by step.  Thank You Margaret Jackson! Elizabeth Stewart, President and CEO Kingdom Family Resources
  • Read More Testimonials 


Risks & Challenges
Our biggest risk and challenge is not meeting out 1000 membership goal.  If we cannot reach our expansion membership goal it will limit our ability to support women in small business and our next generation around the Nation.  Our target goal is not the finish line.  It is the beginning market, for us  to reach 10,000+ women within 3-5 years nationally and expand globally.  We began in Silicon Valley as a guide for us to examine our CLUB model.  It works for women in small business; if they work the CLUB and take full advantage of the resources.      
If we can reach this goal it gives Business On the Edge Incorporated, and the On the Edge Women In Business CLUB a voice of leverage to advocate on behalf of the small business women of America and around the world. 
  • Reaching 1000 women members means we can reach more small business entrepreneurs, and make a global impact with affordable resources, customizable solutions, and online connection available every single day 24/7. 
  

ABOUT THE CLUB FOUNDER

The President and Founder Margaret Jackson is Silicon Valley's Top Small Business Radio Show Host & Coach and Motivational Speaker. AM 1220 KDOW Money 2.0 Business On the Edge with Margaret Jackson is the flagship show.  She has broadcast more than 500 show episodes over the last five years.  Show guests have included Wells Fargo, Intuit, Mobilewize Global, Ernst & Young, College Money Pros,KRON 4/AM 1220 KDOW Rob Black & Your Money (Investments), Hastest Solutions Inc., CH Reynolds, Opportunity Finance Network, Bay Area political figures, colleges/universities, and most importantly small business owners to name a few. Money 2.0 Business On the Edge is entering its sixth season on-air in San Francisco/Bay Are/Silicon Valley the 4th largest radio market in the Nation.  

The newest show launched last summer on the KDOW sister station expanding the business show on AM 1100 KFAX faith-based platform Faith & Business On the Edge with Margaret Jackson to provide support for Women of Faith and balancing their business operations, careers, and goals by bridging the gap between their faith and business.  

                                 
 

Business Coach Margaret Jackson is a Certified Silicon Valley Small Business Development Center (SBDC) advisor.  The Coach works with small businesses providing infrastructure and foundation support, business planning, and access to capital for small business owners.  SBDC is a FREE resource for small businesses with locations throughout the Nation.  

Business Coach Margaret Jackson is a freelance writer for the San Jose Women's Business Examiner.  An online publication providing how-to articles, profile articles, and business commentary for today's business woman.    

                              

                                          Other Ways You Can Help

      Please SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN AND VIDEO
  • Please help us get the word out and make this CLUB great!  Our goal is to register 1000 new members in 40 days!
  • We would love to exceed our 1000 member goal.  BRING in a  small business woman by using our share tools.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Thank you for your support! Dial into my show on AM 1220 KDOW Money 2.0 Business On the Edge Friday Nights Prime Time 6p-7p PST and tell me why you supported this campaign and plug your business starting February 11, 2016.  1-800-516-1220 LISTEN LIVE  Callers first come, first serve.

story:
modelR is a marketplace for 3D designs which integrates a 3D printing system to make it easy for non technical users to be able to benefit from this amazing technology.

modelR has been thought to protect the designers and help the users. How? Well, the user just selects a design, drags it to the printing bar, pays for it (unless is a free item category) and the printing system does all the work. In this process the client never gets the original .stl file. Therefore the item can only be printed once. If the client wishes to print it more times, they will have to pay an extra print again; unless again is a free item category.  

To make this possible in modelR there will be two types of subscriptions: The users and the designers.

                               

The designer will have to pay an annual fee of 10 euros to be able to upload designs. Anytime the designer uploads a design, he/she will need to put a price per print and the designer will get the 70% of that sale price. The designer can also decide not to charge anything for their design as we are committed to providing free items. There will be always free items available in the store.

                                

The user doesn’t have to pay an annual fee, just needs to register on the website, surf, chose a design and print it.  


                    


         

“The Hybrid 3D Design Marketplace and 3D Printing Software Platform”    

Last November modelR was selected among thousands of projects to attend the Web Summit in Dublin, one of the biggest technology conferences in the planet. More than 30000 people  from all over the world. 

We are proud to say that our project had a warm welcome and many people showed interested in cooperating with us.

We had the chance to see other 3D printing related start-ups, to learn from them and the most important, to confirm that this field is growing rapidly.  



Currently the complexity of the software available to use a 3D printer makes it less appealing for a common user. Adding to that the fact that designers can not profit from their work and creativity. 

modelR simplifies the process to 3D print an object in few easy steps to bring this technology to everyone and makes it in a way that protects the designer, as the files are never downloaded from our servers.


                 

                   







      

                     



With modelR we will be giving to everyone, in a easy and intuitive way, the chance to use and enjoy the endless possibilities of a 3D printer. We will provide a 3D objects repository, designed by the best designers and, on the other hand, a repository of preset settings of the commercial 3D printers as well as its consumables.

In order to standardize modelR, and subsequently 3D printing, with need to count on the support of the 3D printer manufacturers as well as consumables manufacturers.

We have achieved a lot with very limited resources and we are very proud of that. We now come to a point where we need a final push to finalize and release. The funds we are requesting will be invested as follows:                        

             

                           


Even if we are unable to reach the target, the funds raised will still be invested in the project in the order  as shown in the chart above and the perks will be delivered as long as modelR becomes a tangible reality. 



3D printing world is the future now. The endless possibilities of this amazing technology will blow your imagination.

There is though a lot of work to do before we can consider this industry mature. And the main problems is the lack of standardization which keeps 3D printing out of reach of most of people. In order to overcome this obstacles we created ThinkR.

ThinkR is a company established by young entrepreneurs with a common vision: to develop a 3D printing system so intuitive that it will democratize the use of 3D printers and that can be utilized as the standard due to its potency, diversity of designs and its usability.

                                                                 
                                     "Our goal is democratization of 3D printing." 



                                                            http://www.thinkr.eu
                                                                                or                                                                                                                                                 contact@thinkr.eu

Picture

story:
Hello, 

My name is Joel Parra and I am a current college student in Boston, MA. Since I was a little kid I was born a leader who always wanted to work to achieve their goal. I began working at the age of 11 as a newspaper boy and was able to become a manager of a frozen yogurt shop at 17! I worked for a wedding planning company in Boston this past year and now I want to live out my dream of being an entrepreneur and opening up my own event planning business. Although I am young and a student this is the best time to start up my own company because I do not have the responsibilities an adult with a degree has. I also have a million and one resources as a college student to use such as my professors, the career center, my advisors, and professionals who will be helping me throughout the process and perfecting my business plan so that by the time I graduate in May 2019 I can have a fully functioning business and begin making a profit. 

Now this takes up a lot of hard work and money. Start up this type of business is not as expensive as many others but I do still have many costs and most of the money I make at my current job goes towards paying my student loans. 

The reason for the total funding goal of $1,500 is because I must pay for the following costs: 

- Website copywriting and design and ownership

- Trip to NYC for a certification course (To occur April 7th-10th)

- Advertising through magazines to create a client base

- Fees and taxes to be paid to start up a company

- Keeping up with Facebook ads and Instagram

- Other costs needed to start up a business


With this money I will be able to start my company and create the business I've dreamed of having. I may be young but I have ambitions and although people may say I cannot do it, I know that with your help I can. ALSO: a percentage of this money will be donated to a charity because while I am trying to create a company there are responsibilities of caring for our world and even though I am not making a profit yet I still want to start my contributions now. Please share this and help me reach my goal!! You're all amazing:)

story:
With an amazing skate park coming to town it only makes sense to have an awesome shop to match it and I'm the only guy in town for the job. I've dedicated my entire life to skateboarding. It's not just a hobby or a fun way to blow off steam anymore. It grew beyond that long ago and has since become a way of life for myself and my friends. We eat, sleep, and breathe skateboarding. It's all we think of 24 hours a day, 7 days a week and we want to make Lexington's youth just as passionate about it. If you spend all of your spare time focused on skateboarding you don't have time to get into trouble and I'm living proof of that. I've been given many opportunities to mess my life up but because of skateboarding I was always too busy to bother.

I've been skateboarding for as long as I can remember and I realize how cliche that sounds but it's the truth. I honestly can't remember a time before skateboarding and it wasn't long after I discovered it that I realized I wanted to one day run my own skate shop. Everything about my life seems to draw me closer and closer to my passion. I want to run a successful business and this one has the potential to be something great but there's more to it than just that. Skateboarding saved me. It kept me out of trouble and gives me a reason to wake up every morning. I want to share my passion for skateboarding with a broader audience and that's why I started my YouTube channel (SkateSpeech) but it's still not enough. The digital connection with my subscribers is fantastic and I love interacting with them, giving them advice, and listening to their stories, but I crave something deeper and even more meaningful. I need real human interaction. I need to be able to see the way my advice affects people in real time. I want to help young skaters by providing them with a positive place to hang out, meet up with their friends, learn about skateboarding news and history, and buy quality skateboarding products from real skateboarders that respect their lifestyle.

With a skate park built by Team Pain coming to Lexington next year  there's no doubt in my mind that if I don't open up my shop soon someone else will open up their idea of a skate shop. I can't bear to think of what some suburban soccer mom looking for an afternoon job would bring to town so it's vital that I make this happen. I've made connections throughout my lengthy skateboarding and YouTubing careers that will allow for me to do great things for our community as a whole, not just the skateboarding community. There are several charitable organizations such as A.Skate an organization that uses skateboarding to help children with Autism that I'd like to work with as well as contests and demonstrations at the skate park when it opens. We fought for years to get this park built and the city has finally listened to us but free parks don't generate revenue. Skate shops on the other hand... do generate taxable income. For those that aren't aware Team Pain builds some of the best parks in the country and simply having one of their parks in your city makes it an instant road trip destination for skaters statewide, not just in our little city. It doesn't make sense to have such an amazing park without an equally awesome shop to keep the skaters on board.

That's where you come in. I jumped into this project feet first with a solid plan and plenty of money two years ago but things fell apart at the finish line. All I lack at this point is the inventory. I have literally everything else I need to open the doors tomorrow but because of some bad investments my money dried up and I got behind financially. Now I'm stuck in a lease and paying $400 a month on top of my personal bills and expenses and that makes it difficult to save enough money to buy what I need for the shop. I was hit and run literally days before selling the car to pay for my inventory. That left me with a totaled car that insurance wouldn't cover because highway patrol refused to follow up on the information I gave them AND a severe concussion. I lost all hope and quickly descended into a deep depression which was only worsened by a stressful living situation and roommates that could never pay their bills. The last straw was when I was unexpectedly fired from my job for standing up to a workplace bully in a respectful way. They claimed that I quit and because of that I wasn't able to collect unemployment. I searched for a job for 6 months scraping together what little money I could working odd jobs to get by and with the help from some amazing friends and my loving family I was able to get through it all without being homeless or missing too many meals, although many of them were just noodles. All the while I was uploading videos to YouTube in an effort to grow my audience because I knew this day was going to come eventually. I've got a good job now and I'm making decent money but I've dug my hole too deep and I can't afford to keep digging it deeper. I have a $500 loan to pay off which will come out of my tax money and then I'm officially back in the green, but with nothing to show for it because I've been paying $400 a month for the lease for 2 years and haven't made a penny yet. I can't afford to give up the location because it's perfect for what I'm doing. The size is right. The lease is right. The location is PERFECT. With $4,000 I could get my utilities turned on and stock the shop with enough product to get the ball rolling. This may be my last chance to make this happen. I'm getting discouraged after putting as much effort into this as I have. I know it will work because I have people contacting me about it on a regular basis. The kids want a shop and right now I'm letting them down which is breaking my heart. If you have the means to help get a small business up and running I urge you to contribute. If you can't contribute financially PLEASE take the time to share my campaign anywhere you think interested parties may be exposed to it. You can also check out my YouTube channel (SkateSpeech). Simply watching the videos helps me tremendously because I'm a YouTube partner (which means I make money off of the ads on my videos) and all of that money is going towards the shop as well.

Whether or not I meet the goal of $4,000 every penny will be going towards the shop. It's my main focus and I wont let anything stand in the way of getting it open. If I get more than $4,000 in contributions I'll simply buy more inventory or use the money to help me pay the lease. It's all going into my business account and 100% of it will be used to help me achieve my dream.

I haven't set up any perks yet but I do welcome you to suggest some to me. I'm just not feeling very creative after telling my story.


Feel free to provide feedback and help me make this campaign more effective.

story:
Hello, internet!

My name is Jordan Hanson, I'm 28, a trans* woman living in Kansas City, and I'm here to talk to you about trans.report. I started with the idea to build a community site dedicated to amplifying the voices of trans*/gender non-conforming folk who'd like to share their stories. But then I got to thinking -- why stop at building only a digital community?

I wonder about the businesses I patronize in Kansas City all the time: Do they have any transgender employees? If so, do they treat them well? What benefits are available to trans* folks in the Kansas City area? If they don't have any transgender employees, why not? Is it a problem of perspective? Are they discriminatory?

These kinds of questions are often difficult to report when it's limited to a single dinner reservation or otherwise. Perhaps because it was a bad experience, perhaps your server was having a bad night -- but in general, people want to do business with businesses that share their values and ideas.

While all of our efforts start here in Kansas City, consider what can happen with some time, attention, and the ability to expand further. Transgender/gender non-conforming folks deserve the opportunity to research businesses and things with the openness and transparency that the might look up a restaurant or research any other experience. Beyond functioning as a news site with commentary and stories, my goal has always been to find a functional way to give back to my community.


In order to get everything in motion, these are the costs we're currently facing:

1. Getting registered. (Estimated Cost: $50) Part of your donation will go toward registering trans.report as a non-profit entity in Missouri. 

2. Reserving exhibit space at KC Pride 2016. (Estimated Cost: $325) Another part of your donation will pay for the booth registration costs, electricity, and admission for our workers at the booth (KC pride fees listed here). These costs go towards registration ($50), nonprofit exhibit space ($200), and electrical service ($75).

3. Web hosting. (Estimated Cost: ~$200) While our website is up and running (www.trans.report), it costs more to pay someone else to host our domain/contact email than if we ran everything ourselves. We have some of the pieces already, but in order to get everything up and running we'll need to order the rest of the server bits.

4. Merchandise/Collateral. (Estimated Cost: $425+) Signs! Banners! Shirts! Stickers! Glitter-speckled rainbows are a thing at Pride festivals all over the country for a reason. Visibility is the key ingredient to presenting a lasting message. With 90% of the brain's messaging being visual stimulus, we can process more with a good visual representation of who we are and what we want to do. Branded collateral (signs, banners, etc) will allow us to do just that. 

The ability to offer some kind of tangible merchandise at our exhibit allows us the opportunity to raise funding for our future efforts while also raising awareness about our goals and ambitions to give back to the transgender/gender non-conforming communities.

Ideally, we'd like to offer a range of products, including t-shirts, magnets, stickers -- the sky's the limit, really. The only thing that holds us back is funding. Exactly what we'll be able to offer, however, depends on the success of our fundraising.


Every donation will be credited on a thank-you page at our website, as well as featured at KC Pride. Know someone in the transgender/gender non-conforming community? Make a donation in their honor, if you'd prefer.
For donations $25 and above, we'll highlight your contribution on our social media accounts in addition to featuring your name in the 'Thank You' page at our website. Know someone in the transgender/gender non-conforming community? Make your donation in their honor!

For donations $50 or above, we'll also send you a copy of our t-shirt, created just for trans.report at KC Pride 2016. Not in Kansas City? We'll ship it to you, no problem.

Check out the shirt design!


For donations of $150 or above, we'll meet with you in person and do a feature piece on the website to highlight our donors for their generous contribution towards a happier, safer, friendlier Kansas City for the transgender/gender non-conforming community. You'll also get all the other perks as listed above.


As anyone coming out in the transgender community can tell you, locating trans-friendly local resources is a challenge many face. These resources exist, but they're often scattered and disorganized; this leaves many in our community feeling like they have very few paths forward for support, or left to trust the anecdotal evidence of people they might randomly meet online. I think we can do better. Consider:

  • 28% of transgender individuals report harassment when accessing health resources.
  • 19% of transgender individuals report being refused care based on their gender identity.
  • 50% of transgender individuals report having to teach their providers how to provide them with adequate care

Your donation can help save lives. Scientific research demonstrates that having access to life-affirming care and support dramatically increases the overall health and wellbeing of transgender/gender non-confirming individuals.


I am blessed with a very skilled network of trans* positive individuals in the Kansas City community to whom I'll look for guidance, expertise, and advice in making sure we are able to accomplish our goals in a timely manner.
I'll be honest -- I've never run a nonprofit before. This is intimidating, but I'm not afraid of learning new skills and tricks to make this venture a success. I'm also personally vested in the success of this initiative, because I remember how alienating it felt to scrape around for resources on the internet on my own.


Can't donate? Your help will still contribute to our success:

Share this page and our website (www.trans.report) to help us get the word out!

Remember, this campaign is first -- and foremost -- focused on raising awareness and increasing the visibility of the local transgender/gender non-conforming community.

story:
Ryde Arena is a non-profit, community run ice rink on the Isle of Wight. After being taken over in April 2015, we have been striving to improve our facility for both regular users from across the country and for visitors to our Island.

We are hosts to many different events including Christmas Day Skating, SNAP Discos, Quizzes, Galas, Ice Hockey matches, and many more!

Since becoming community run we have been slowly making improvements to make our facility better for everyone, now we need to get the big fix out of the way and repair our roof.

By donating to our cause you are helping to keep Englands only community run ice rink going and available for everyone to enjoy.


We need to raise £40,000 in order to repair the roof of our building as it currently in a very bad state and causes numerous leaks throughout the building.

By doing this you will be assisting the Isle Of Wight community in keeping one of their most treasured facilities running.

If we are unable to reach our goal of £40,000 we will use any funds that we have raised on either fixing our bathroom facilities or being put together with other donation methods to fix the roof at a later date.

 

It's a major priority for any community to keep their facilities available to the public and on the Isle Of Wight the facilities need all the support they can get, by donating you will be helping to keep one of our beloved leisure activities going on the Isle Of Wight.


Since becoming Ryde Arena back in April we have had to overcome many different obstacles including getting new skates, replacing our ice pad, organising our bar area, fixing problems within our café, and many more. Now the time has come to start our repairs on the largest problem for our facility which is the roof, of which is slowly falling away and in dire need of fixing. 


If you would like to help our cause but are unable to donate any money there are other ways you can help; popping into the rink for a good time skating or food and drink will always help to give us a good indication that you are supporting your local community and the leisure facilities it provides.

You can also share our campaign on facebook or twitter to help our cause and get people interested.

story:
Macrobiotics saved my life...

I used to have lots of inexplicable symptoms of excess and tiredness. The food I was eating was making me ill, but nobody in my family would question it, so I grew up getting more and more sick.
One day, a lady in my hometown started her own business teaching macrobiotics. I tried the food and it all had something I could not quite put my finger on, but I kept going to her classes and consultations, and getting better.
One day I started volunteering. A year later I was volunteering at the International Macrobiotic School, in Devon, UK. And at the end of 2012 I would join their First Year.
In a nutshell, macrobiotics has taught me to have a bigger perspective of life.
I want to keep the ball rolling, pass it on, carry on the good work...and Swansea, Wales, UK, as the city that has seen me growing as a person for the last four years, is the chosen one!
 I want to:
  • Offer macrobiotic food so that people can TASTE and TRY it for themselves; EXPERIENCE the insights they are ready to receive.

  • Promote healthy lifestyles, through food, emotional work and bodywork. I would like to contribute and make a difference in the way people relate to each other, to food, and to their lives.

  • Teach and pass on the skills, as well as coaching to help people realise what "makes their heart sing".


How is this going to happen?

I have been working on my business plan, with the help of the Prince's Trust mentor of South Wales, and I need start-up funding to...

  • Secure a venue for long enough to set up properly (ideally a year, but six months is OK, I have to begin somewhere!)
  • Buy kitchen equipment: stainless steel "healthy-and-safe" non-porous surfaces, two sinks, gas cooker (with gas bottles if I have to!), large pots and pans...
  • Stocking up the dry-stores (whole-grains, beans, seaweed, seeds, umeboshi, sea salt, miso, tamari, etc.)
  • Promote the place and create a huge warm-up event to gather momentum.

The Impact

This is what will happen with the funds:
  • Gluten-Free, Vegan and Gut-Friendly foods and cooking demonstrations, as well as organising workshops and allowing the space to be full of nourishment.

  • People with restricted diet will be able to eat out without feeling left out, or missing out, or having to shuffle and combine side-dishes.

  • Macrobiotic food will be known as simple but effective, not restrictive but flexible, adaptable and aiming to balance people's conditions in a creative way.

  • Food will be cooked using yin and yang balance, as well as minding the proportion of protein, carbohydrates, minerals, vitamins and oils that are needed in a balanced diet...but without the excess of meateggsdairysugarflouretc.

Risks & Challenges

The budget is planned for a year of activity (that is the financial forecast and the expenses for the rent), which means:

  • A year of healthy eating possibilities can change more than no year of healthy eating possibilities.
  • A seed would be planted, and when people are ready they would be able to take it further.
  • If it does not work as planned, I will go back to my other jobs and will always thank all of you for the generosity to make this vision come to life even for a short period.
  • It only takes one interaction to change someone's life...even if the worst comes to the worst, I get carried away and I start giving lots of food for free to people that are ill and funds only last for a year...it will still be worth it!

How Could You Help?

Money is not everything, awareness is also useful. Please, feel free to spread the word amongst your vegan/gluten-free/sugar-free/macrobiotic/inexplicably-ill friends ;)

Visit the website: www.macrovioletics.co.uk

Join the SugarFreeForCharity challenge (Get 10 days of Sugar-Free Coaching on your Inbox and donate to your favourite charity (or the one that is suggested) what you would have otherwise spent on sugary treats!)

Will Macrobiotics save your life too?

Thanks from the bottom of my heart.


Violeta

BScBiology, PGCE, Macrobiotic Cook and Health Coach

More on Macrobiotics...

www.macroschool.co.uk

www.concordinstitute.com

www.macrobiotics.co.uk
story_txt:
Macrobiotics saved my life...
I used to have lots of inexplicable symptoms of excess and tiredness. The food I was eating was making me ill, but nobody in my family would question it, so I grew up getting more and more sick.
One day, a lady in my hometown started her own business teaching macrobiotics. I tried the food and it all had something I could not quite put my finger on, but I kept going to her classes and consultations, and getting better.
One day I started volunteering. A year later I was volunteering at the International Macrobiotic School, in Devon, UK. And at the end of 2012 I would join their First Year.
In a nutshell, macrobiotics has taught me to have a bigger perspective of life.
I want to keep the ball rolling, pass it on, carry on the good work...and Swansea, Wales, UK, as the city that has seen me growing as a person for the last four years, is the chosen one!
 I want to:  Offer macrobiotic food so that people can TASTE and TRY it for themselves; EXPERIENCE the insights they are ready to receive.
 Promote healthy lifestyles, through food, emotional work and bodywork. I would like to contribute and make a difference in the way people relate to each other, to food, and to their lives.
 Teach and pass on the skills, as well as coaching to help people realise what "makes their heart sing".     How is this going to happen? I have been working on my business plan, with the help of the Prince's Trust mentor of South Wales, and I need start-up funding to...

Macrobiotic food will be known as simple but effective, not restrictive but flexible, adaptable and aiming to balance people's conditions in a creative way.

Food will be cooked using yin and yang balance, as well as minding the proportion of protein, carbohydrates, minerals, vitamins and oils that are needed in a balanced diet...but without the excess of meateggsdairysugarflouretc.    Risks & Challenges  The budget is planned for a year of activity (that is the financial forecast and the expenses for the rent), which means:  A year of healthy eating possibilities can change more than no year of healthy eating possibilities. A seed would be planted, and when people are ready they would be able to take it further.
If it does not work as planned, I will go back to my other jobs and will always thank all of you for the generosity to make this vision come to life even for a short period.
It only takes one interaction to change someone's life...even if the worst comes to the worst, I get carried away and I start giving lots of food for free to people that are ill and funds only last for a year...it will still be worth it!    How Could You Help? Money is not everything, awareness is also useful. Please, feel free to spread the word amongst your vegan/gluten-free/sugar-free/macrobiotic/inexplicably-ill friends ;)

story:
Help Us Trade Conflict For Coffee

Good Grounds Coffee Co buys cherries from farmers and processes them into specialty coffee to sell in North America, creating stable income for farmers who used to fight in rebel groups and armies.

Each container we process provides $36,000 of income to farmers, and each dollar you contribute will be reinvested and multiplied - creating profit and income for Congolese men and women who have chosen peace, year after year.


Our mission: to transform the lives of former Congolese rebels by giving them the option to lay down their guns and grow coffee

your love for coffee + social enterprise = peace in Congo

Impact: without this income, many coffee farmers who have given up their guns to grow coffee will struggle to provide for their families.

Who is Good Grounds?

Good Grounds is a for-profit company that partners with existing cooperatives by financing, marketing and exporting specialty coffee in East Africa. Good Grounds is based in Rwanda, with operations in Eastern DRC (Congo) and North America. Our team consists of two Americans, a Brit and a Canadian with extensive business experience on the ground in East Africa.  

What are we trying to do?

Our vision is to transform the lives of former Congolese rebels by giving them the option to lay down their guns. In Congo employment is scarce, so men join rebel groups to provide for their families. Good Grounds brings lasting change in both the short and long run by providing cooperatives with cash to process cherries and export beans to roasters and consumers in North America. We also guarantee the purchase of all the coffee we pre-finance, eliminating risk for smallholder farmers. 

What is the risk? 

To ensure that we bear the most risk, Good Grounds is personally pre-financing the first container of coffee from Idjwi Island. However, in the interest of long-term sustainability, we’re looking to raise the pre-financing of our second container of coffee through this Indiegogo campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the link to this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Email and Instagram
  • Pre-order Idwji Specialty Coffee (green or roasted) online or via email: ml@goodgrounds.coffee
Find out more or buy our coffee at: www.goodgrounds.coffee

story:
Résumé du Projet

Le PROJET FELIX est un organisme communautaire à but non lucratif qui offre des services à des jeunes adultes présentant des limitations fonctionnelles d'origine diverses (incapacités intellectuelles, trouble du spectre de l'autisme ou autres particularités). 

Tout au long de l'année, nous effectuerons de bonnes actions afin d'aider notre communauté. En août 2017, nous aimerions effectuer un échange culturel en vue de pratiquer ces mêmes actions dans un pays étranger. Il s'agit d'une expérience enrichissante que certains participants du Projet Félix auraient la chance de vivre.

Nous aimerions briser les préjugés actuels en lien avec ce type de clientèle en mettant de l'avant leurs nombreuses capacités et habiletés. Les 18 membres du Projet Félix ont  des objectifs à accomplir et souhaitent particulièrement réaliser un grand rêve. Nous souhaitons prouver à la population que les difficultés vécues par cette clientèle ne limitent pas l'accomplissement de ce projet.

Notre objectif

Tous les mois, nous travaillerons afin d'accomplir de bonnes actions auprès d'un public cible. De plus,  nous réaliserons une vidéo expliquant tout le processus. Ces vidéos seront publiées sur la chaîne Youtube de Florennce99 qui est d'ailleurs,  éducatrice au sein du Projet Félix : https://www.youtube.com/florennce99 .

Pour réaliser ces bonnes actions, nous souhaitons nous associer à des entreprises afin de recevoir des dons en échange d'une visibilité positive sur notre chaîne Youtube ainsi que sur notre page Facebook.

Nous avons décidé de créer une levée de fonds afin d'inciter les gens à donner pour notre cause. Ce serait un honneur pour nous d'avoir le support de tous pour ce projet qui nous tient grandement à coeur . 

Répercussions souhaitées

Ce type de projet présente énormément de répercussions positives ! Tout d'abord,  passer une semaine dans un pays étranger, aiderait les participants à développer leur autonomie ainsi que leur ouverture sur le monde.  Ils vivraient notamment, une expérience enrichissante auprès d’une équipe à laquelle ils développent un sentiment d’appartenance. Il s’agit ici de réaliser un rêve pour eux également.

Du point de vue de la société, nous souhaitons, tel que mentionné précédemment, briser les stéréotypes, les préjugés auxquels cette clientèle fait face tous les jours. Nous désirons mettre de l’avant leurs forces, leurs qualités et leur joie de vivre.

Risques & Difficultés

S’exposer sur les médias sociaux comporte toujours sa part de risques . Toutefois, nous visons à projeter une image positive teintée d’acceptation de soi et des autres.

Le projet Félix nécessite près de 35 000$ pour sa réalisation. Nous voulons réussir à amasser cette somme en vue de récompenser ses participants et leur prouver que les efforts déployés ont toujours un apport positif, que ce soit au niveau de leur sentiment de bien-être qu’au niveau de l’accomplissement d’un objectif précis.

Autres moyens de nous aider

Nous invitons la population à partager nos vidéos sur les réseaux sociaux en vue de s’assurer d'une visibilité de tous.

Pour ce faire, il est possible de :

  • S'abonner à la chaîne Youtube de Florence pour ne pas manquer les nouvelles vidéos : https://www.youtube.com/user/Florennce99

  • Aimer la page Facebook du Projet Félix pour suivre le cheminement de ce projet: https://www.facebook.com/Projet-F%C3%A9lix-752996398168121/

story:
A local man from Kent was badly injured in an unprovoked attack by National Front thugs on 30 January, Dover. He spent several nights in hospital and sustained severe injuries. He needed reconstructive surgery, and will now be off work for many months without pay.

Please give generously towards keeping him going while he recovers.

He needed reconstructive surgery, and will now  be off work for many months without pay.Please give generously towards keeping him going while he recovers.

story:
The interior of Eveningstar Cinema has remained unchanged since its opening in 1979. Now with people demanding more from their movie theaters than just a place to sit and watch movies (imagine that!), we have been and will continue making improvements to make the theater experience more enjoyable for you.

So here is out checklist:
 

The first phase was upgrading the projection and sound. Done

 

The second phase was securing a beer & wine license. Done

 

The Third phase was improving the interior. Done

 

The final phase is the seating. To be done

 So we turn to you, our cinephile customers, to create a theater that is more comfortable and enjoyable so that your make your movie-watching experience is as wonderful as possible. 

We want to continue serving you so that you have more options than superhero films or movies that have explosions every three seconds. So help us create the best environment for our type of movies . . . for you!

story:
Concern

As we speak, more than 8 million Syrian children are in immediate need of aid, 2 million of which are refugees. As you continue to read, 1.75 million Syrian children are no longer in schools’ due to the six-yearlong conflict. Having lost their homes, schools, and communities, these people are on the brink of losing hope. Some do not even see a future for themselves. Balandi Inc. saw how many Syrian running away from the conflict were being denied asylum and safety. We have decided to lend a helping hand to the Syrian refugees and we invite you in our journey.

Mission

ENACTUS- BKP Project advocates for the protection of children. We have taken steps to ensure that their basic needs are met and provide them with an alley way to rise to their full potential.

story:
Why a vegan market?

It is important to recognize that veganism is not just a diet. Our society is built on animal exploitation, from clothing and cosmetics to household cleaners. Living vegan thus entails an effort to avoid using animals in all areas of life. The choices we make about the food we eat is an important and impactful place to start.

 

Products and Store Experience

Harvest will only stock quality products that align with the veganism philosophy. 

  • Produce: A small selection of organic produces will be available for quick grabs.
  • Popular Brands: Harvest will be a one stop shop for popular brands such as Daiya, Field Roast, Amy's, So Delicious, Vegan Rob's and more. With so many yummy foods to try, eating plant-based will never be boring!
  • New and Local Brands: Harvest is committed to support new and local businesses. 
  • Cruelty-Free Bath and Beauty: Animal experiments are cruel, unreliable and dangerous. Harvest will shelf a variety of animal-free and cruelty-free products such as toothpaste, deodorant, makeup, sunblock, and much more.  
  • Fair Trade: Products that contain ingredients such as coffee, cocoa, and palm oil are examined for fair trade.

 

What We Need

In order to open the doors in April 2018, Harvest needs funding to get the business rolling. Specifically $100,000. This startup fund will go towards:

  • Store construction
  • Start-up inventory

 

All the benefits without the risks

Support the vegan movement by supporting this campaign! As a thank you for your support, Harvest will return your contribution plus a little extra via a Harvest Reward card. Example, if you are able to contribute $10, you will receive a $15 Harvest Reward card in return. Monthly, limited edition Harvest Vegan box filled with goodies such as snacks, beauty and cleaning products are also available for higher backers. Each box retail value is $100-$200, plus free shipping. 

12 Backing Options:

  1. Contribute $10 = Receive $15 Harvest Reward card
  2. Contribute $20 =  Receive $30 Harvest Reward card
  3. Contribute $50 = Receive $75 Harvest Reward card
  4. Contribute $100 = Receive $150 Harvest Reward card
  5. Contribute $150 = Receive $225 Harvest Reward card
  6. Contribute $200 = Receive $300 Harvest Reward card
  7. Contribute $500 = Receive $750 Harvest Reward card
  8. Contribute $1,000 = Receive $1,500 Harvest Reward card
  9. Contribute $2,500 = Receive $3,000 Harvest Reward card
  10. Contribute $5,000 = Receive $3,000 Harvest Reward card + 3 monthly, limited edition Harvest Vegan Box. 
  11. Contribute $10,000 = Receive $4,000 Harvest Reward card + 6 monthly, limited edition Harvest Vegan Box. 
  12. Contribute $25,000 = Receive $5,000 Harvest Reward card + 12 monthly, limited edition Harvest Vegan Box. 

IMPORTANT!

  • Reward cards will be issued one month prior to Harvest grand opening date.
  • Reward cards will expire 3-12 months after grand opening date. 
  • Grand opening is scheduled for April 2018. Exact date is still TBD.
  • Grand opening date and reward card expiration date will be clearly announced and marked when reward cards are issued.

 

The Impact

With so many benefits and advantages to living a vegan lifestyle, it’s important vegan products are easily available for both vegans and non-vegans. “2,500 gallons of water are needed to produce 1 pound of beef” - Cowspiracy

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand it may be difficult for some to contribute financially, but there are other ways to help. Please share this campaign with family, friends, coworkers, and social media platforms.  https://igg.me/at/harvestveganmarket 

 

THANK YOU

A heartfelt and sincere thank you for your support! Feel free to reach out to Harvest with questions, concerns, or collaboration ideas, info@harvestveganmarket.com.

story:
The Good Deeds Coffeehouse 

The Good Deeds Coffeehouse is a coffeehouse/ truck where 15% of everything you purchase from it goes towards local and worthwhile charities and nonprofit organizations. Isn't it about time Utah had something like this?!?

Hello. My name is Sean Pickell. For a long time I have wanted to do something worthwhile with my life, something that truly impacted others, the community, and  myself in a truly positive way. But like most of you out there  opportunities to do what it takes to really help people and the community can't be found in our day to day lives. I decided to help change that. I decided that not only did I want to be a positive force in my community and selfishly bask in the joy that comes from that, but instead provide those opportunities to the others of us that are having a hard time finding the time and route to become that positive force. 

Please see our video and find out what The Good Deeds Coffeehouse plans to become, the local charities and nonprofit organizations it has currently set up to donate to and what you would receive by helping start up The Good Deeds Coffeehouse. 

If you have a desire to be more actively involved with The Good Deeds Coffeehouse or are wishing to become a barista with us or have an event that you would like for us to host please feel free to call me at 801-613-1867.  You may also message our Facebook page. 

Thank you.
