story:
Introduction

Billboda Ads is a start-up that uses the hundreds of thousands of motorcycle taxis in Uganda (bodabodas) to advertise, creating eye-catching ad opportunities to local and multinational businesses, while also creating a new stream of income for the bodaboda drivers.

We are a team of four Ugandans who met at college at African Business Institute. We all grew up around communities saturated with Bodabodas (Motorcycle Taxis) a renown mode of public transport in East Africa. We want to apply our combined Bodaboda and business experience on Billboda.

The Need

Uganda has over 300,000 motorcycle taxis known as Bodabodas. One third of them are in Kampala- the capital. Statistically, this is the most common mode of public transport. These bodabodas are known to be unsafe. Often, riders lack safety gear and have a reputation of being rowdy on the streets. Amy Follan, a writer with the guardian in 2013 wrote an article referring to them as "silent killers"https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2013/aug/13/uganda-motorbike-deaths-road-safety-boda-bodas . This and other articles tell us what we in Kampala already know: the bodaboda industry is unregulated and most often, drivers lack minimal safety requirements to be on the road.

To some, this is a great problem but for us it is a great opportunity as no business model has tapped into the potential of a huge fleet of these bodabodas out there every day.

We also know that in 2014, a survey of 20 medium and large companies in Uganda show that they spent over $180,000,000 in advertising. Billboards, TV and print medias were the main platforms that were used. This was published by IPSOS an international research organization,http://mobile.monitor.co.ug/Business/Business/struggle-control-markets/2471012-2632740-format-xhtml-2pu6hi/index.html.  

What if some of this money was leveraged to make the streets of Kampala and Uganda safer for all!

Our Solution

Billboda is a bodaboda-based advertising and motorcycle safety training provider that will radically help local businesses get their brand on the streets while making traffic safer for everyone.

Our goal is to mobilize and organize drivers in the capital first, train them in road safety and ensure that they get a riding license. This is aimed at giving them proper driving skills and improving their road etiquette.

We will thereafter equip each rider with safety gear such as a reflector jacket and two helmets, one for the driver and the other for the passenger. This will help to curb the increased traffic deaths and casualties that arise due to lack of safety gear.

Uganda's Bodaboda drivers are also known to be low income earners. We have innovated a way of fitting a Billboda (from Billboard) onto the motorcycle. This will help drivers to make extra money from providing advertising services.

Given the mobility of the Bodabodas, Billboda will be taking company brands even to the remotest places where other modes of advertising fail to reach.

This we know will be successful because many small and medium businesses are starting up and many other want their brand to be known. This is affirmed by the 2015/6 statistics from Approved Index which showed Uganda as the most entrepreneurial country in the world.

Billboda is already in the process of forming advertising contracts with local and multinational businesses. Signage will then be applied to bodabodas and driven in targeted areas shown to be of demographic interest.

Fund

We need your help to raise $45,000 to get our business off the ground with 250 initial Billbodas.

Our Perks

  1. $5- get a Thank you message
  2. $20- get a Big Thank you + Postcard from the team
  3. $50- get a Super Thank you + a photo from a Billboda Driver you made safe
  4. $100- get a Mega Thank you + a Video from a Billboda Community you made safe
  5. $200- get an Enormous Thank you + a Billboda Branded T-shirt + a video from a Billboda Community you made safe
  6. $500- get a Galactic Thank you + 2 Billboda Branded T-shirts + a video from the Billboda Team and a Billboda Community you made safe
  7. $100- get a Bodaboda trip through Kampala's iconic places.

Impact

Every day, the National Referral Hospital, located in the capital, alone receives 50 to 60 bodaboda accident victims, according to Dr. Muhumuza in Mulago. Many of the patients are treated for life-threatening injuries that require extensive surgeries and hospital stays that last for many months. These surgeries and stays, while necessary to preserve life, are expensive. Accident victims often resort to taking out loans to pay their hospital bills.

Worse for drivers, because driving bodabodas are their primary source of income, victims do have to find means to pay back the loans while they recover from their injuries. Some never recover enough to be able to drive again. Not only are individual victims suffering from crippling medical debt, the Department of Health spends over $700,000 each year for their care. This financial burden is passed on to the public.
Billboda has worked to help solve this problem through partnering with local businesses to provide driver’s training and safety gear. Professional driver’s training gives bodaboda operators the cognitive and technical skills to avoid accidents in the first place. This improves traffic for everyone. Despite efforts that significantly reduce the occurrence of accidents, some accidents are not 100% avoidable. In these cases, wearable safety gear such as helmets, gloves, and armored safety clothing, reduce impact on the body and protect drivers against debilitating injuries.
Furthermore, our unique advertising partnership with local businesses, who pay to have their logos and advertisements on the gear and on the bodabodas, essentially pay bodaboda drivers to be safe while building revenue for drivers and for the business owners. The result is one that benefits the community as a whole on many levels: Accidents and injuries are reduced, traffic improves, the financial burden on individuals and the Department of Health is relieved, business owners get their brand on the streets, and bodaboda drivers earn extra income.

We have also identified a metal workshop to carry out our fabrication work for the Billbodas. This workshop has a continuous opportunity to do business with us. We believe that we will be improving their revenue stream significantly. This is important to us because this workshop has a goal of skilling youths especially the disadvantaged ones to enhance the socio-economic wellbeing.

Our Risks

As businesses and the community see the positive difference Billboda makes on the community as a whole, it is very important that we not only set a standard of responsibility and safety, but to maintain it.

One of the risks Billboda must assume is that not all drivers will be compliant with their training and with maintaining their branded safety gear. To reduce the negative impact of having to assume costs from damaged or lost gear, we are working towards partnering with insurance companies to provide coverage at a fair rate to defray cost for replacing gear that has been damaged or stolen, as well as to help protect business owners utilizing our service from financial liability.

Secondly, in order to maintain Billbodas commitment to safety, we must have in place a system by which to withdraw incentives from drivers who are not consistent in following our contractual code of conduct. We see this as a risk because we know that disorderly drivers will not be pleased when these incentives are removed.

Recognizing the potential for disgruntled drivers, and understanding how our business provides for bodaboda driver’s families, we offer a clear step-by-step plan, including extra time with professional driving coaches, so that their incentives to wear our branding and receive extra income can be reinstated with demonstrated improvement.

Ways to help

  1. Make a Financial contribution.
  2. Using the Indiegogo Tools, share with others this campaign.
  3. Offer moral support to the Billboda Team.
  4. Pray for the Billboda Team and the Bodaboda Drivers in Kampala and East Africa

story:
Stroll through any European town and down one of the narrow, quaint streets you’ll find a charming shop filled to the brim with specialty wines and an expert shopkeeper who shares advice as easily as he smiles.  With answers to a few questions you are on your way with the best choice for your occasion, plus an extra bottle or two you just can’t live without.  This experience is no longer reserved for just Paris or Florence…it will be the norm at Oak & Vine, a new wine & spirits boutique, located in Fairlawn Plaza Mall in Topeka, KS.

As the owner of several businesses in Topeka, we are committed to bringing people together at the table, over a meal, with a glass of wine; reconnecting, without our phones; experiencing life the way it used to be. But, with lofty goals, we need a little help in setting a firm foundation and outfitting our cozy space. We would be so grateful if you could invest, not only in Oak & Vine, but also in making our community thrive.  Help us by sharing our news on Facebook or Instagram and making a contribution towards the European wine experience in Topeka!

story:
Hello world,

My name is Kevin and I have an app idea that is going to revolutionize the world.

As we planned our vacation to Colorado, 
I asked myself?
 

Why couldn't I just have an app that can search around my geographical location,

Who is willing to lend me a bicycle at a modest price?

Then the idea grew from just a bicycle to
Who is willing to lend me anything, around me.


Ready for the sales pitch?
Okay here it goes.

Everyone, 
everywhere has everything we would ever need, right next door or a few blocks away.

With this I mean:

Snow Blowers,
Bicycle racks, 
Camping Equipment, 
Golf Clubs, 
Camera lenses 
etc. 

the list goes on and on. Things that we need, but  

1  Aren't ready to invest on, 

2  Simply need it just for an hour or less, or

3. Maybe you just don't have the space to store it once you've bought it.

These reasons essentially pull us away from certain projects we would like to do,


Family camping vacation, how nice would that be a weekend in the mountains
using great equipment?

Housework projects that require expensive one time use tools!

Are you following me here? 

Okay,so here is the idea

Imagine an app that would essentially work like Offer Up or Let-Go, combining the rent-ability of AIRBNB,

Instead of buying the items, our users would be renting their equipment or tools
for a certain time period established by the RENTER and the RENTEE.

For Example

I need a snowblower passed after a 15 inch snowfall, 

I'm lazy in bed and I really would not like to shovel on my day off

On the RAYR MOBILE APP you will search around your radius for a snowblower RENTER

The RENTER and the RENTEE will agree through the RAYR mobile app on how the delivery or pick up will take place.

Then, 
when the RENTEE returns the product or the job is done, the RENTER submits and verifies on the app, that the item was returned successfully.

Both RENTER and RENTEE will rate each other with a 5 star rating system

User ratings and comments will be shown on their visible profiles.

RENTER and RENTEE will make a secured profile by providing details, 

credit card information and a small verification process.

More details will get fine tuned as we go along but,
 

The Impact

My long term goal is to build the crumbling middle class and build communities, 
These are going to be regular people that you see on a daily basis around you, 
neighborhood stores and business locations.

People will essentially use their everyday items to make themselves an additional income. 

Risks & Challenges

With every business venture there is a risk, we all need to take and are willing to take..

Other Ways You Can Help

On the Right hand of the Screen you will see the Perk Section.
If you would like to continuously just bless us with $7 for the duration of the campaign 
We will be gracious. 

But if you'd like to come aboard and see where this Journey takes us,
feel free to purchase any other Perk.

Thank you for your time, have a RAYR day.

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is the best publicity. 
Who knows where your shared feed will reach. 

Thank you.

story:
My name is MaryLu Gidi, self taught Chef, cooking since I was 13 years old. Grew up in a family where helping others is a must. My parents have always been involved with different charities. Since I was little and visited a uncles chocolate factory, where he had some blind employees folding boxes, I dreamed of having a kitchen where I could hire people with different disabilities, to help them earn money and at the same time let them know that being disable is not an obstacle to getting a job.

I need $35k to start the project. I have the place, but I need to buy stoves, freezers, vacuum sealers, fridges, work tables,  pots and pans, and all the equipment needed to produce.

I have been doing it from home, with a limited space so that limits the amount of product and I cannot hire more people. The line that I am producing right now is Middle Eastern Food, and it has been selling quite well, it's time to grow, hire more people and sell it in different grocery shops.

If by any chance I don't get the amount I am wishing for, I will start smaller than planed, hopping on getting more funds and making profit to expand and hire more people as soon as possible.
 
I think that this project has a real social impact. By helping people with disabilities earn money and making them feel accepted and useful. Their quality of life can become much better.
 
One of the risks is having trouble getting the products on the big grocery stores. But there are a lot of local small shops where I can start selling, and I will be looking into finding more small shops in different cities where I could sell too!
 
Every small action count, maybe if you cannot contribute with money, please help me by sharing my project on your social media, share it on facebook, twitter, or whatever platform you use. Indegogo has a lot of sharing tools.

story:
LoveJoy Workshop isn't just a pipe dream. It is a proven and profitable business model. I'm partnering with AR Workshop so I can hit the ground running. They designed a tried and true process for creating personalized home décor that takes out the guess work and guarantees an incredible result.  

This concept fits perfectly with our DIY vibe in the Pacific Northwest. Where we love to gather, share a glass of wine or a pint of microbrew, and create memories together. LoveJoy Workshop is more than just a class, it's an experience! On top of that, you will take home a piece that you can proudly display that will remind you of your workshop. 

This business model combined with my 10 years of design experience and personal style is the perfect recipe for success!  Design is always at the forefront of my heart and I'm passionate about helping women find their inner creativity. 

Here's where you come in: In order to make this workshop a reality, I need your help with funding. We want you to join the party! Together we can make this happen! 

We understand life happens and we all are busy. Our workshop will be a place for friends to reconnect & create.  A place that inspires women (or men) to build timeless pieces and memories they will treasure forever.

I need your help to build out a beautiful space like this and launch LoveJoy Workshop. Here's how the classes will work. . . pick a date on the calendar, select your project, answer a few simple questions, and leave the rest to us.   

On the day of your workshop, all you need to do is show up and be ready to party! 

When you walk through the door, everything will be ready and waiting for you! We provide the tools, materials, and step-by-step instructions to complete your project. Sip your favorite drink, dance to the music,  and let your creativity come to life! By the end of your workshop, you get to take your finished project home! 

LoveJoy Workshop will offer a wide range of DIY projects on various mediums that are stylish and classic while also being on-trend. Some of our projects include Wood Plank Signs, Wood Framed Signs, Pillowcases, Hanging Canvas Signs, Chalk Board Signs, Lazy Susans, and more. Each and every piece will be unique TO YOU!  You get to pick your project, personalize it, and paint it!

Your home should be a reflection of your style and personality. But, it's not always that easy! Sometimes it's hard to find the perfect piece to complete your wall gallery or that perfect pillow to put on your couch. We totally get it! That's why we created a process that is tailor-made so you can create the perfect piece for your home.

Check out just a few examples of projects you can create at LoveJoy Workshop. . .

Our modern rustic + farmhouse style will combine aged woods, linen fabrics, and metal details. Starting with a neutral color palette, and layering in warm wood tones makes our modern rustic look, a timeless design style.  This look is simple and clean and will compliment your current décor style.

Excited about attending a class? Simply, buy a perk or make a donation and I will be one step closer to opening LoveJoy Workshop. 

Turns out, you need some serious cash to launch a new business and that's where I need your help!  Currently, AR Workshop  has launched seven locations that are operating successfully on the East Coast.  Because they've already paved the way, I know what it's going to take to get this party started. 

Here are the major expenses that your money will go towards:

  • License fee from AR Workshop
  • Workshop Space  Lease  
  • Build Out + Decor for Space
  • Tools + Supplies + Business Equipment ( Security, Software, & Hardware)
  • Web Development
  • Furniture
  • Other Licensing (Business, Liquor, etc.)
  • Instructor Training 

AR Workshop has already done the calculations and based on their experience, it looks like I am going to need $50k to get going.  We have lots of trees here in Oregon, but unfortunately, none of them are money trees. So here we are. It would mean the world to me if you could help make this dream a reality by donating to my campaign!

 I've hand selected a few perks that I think you will love, or you can simply make a donation by backing this project. If you don't see a perk you like, just ask and we can create one just for you. Remember, there are a limited number of perks. You are welcome to buy more than one, but they will only be available for a short period of time! New perks will be added, so make sure you check back often! 

If you can't spare any money, there is still a perk in it for you.  Please use the sharing tools provided in Indiegogo and share with your friends. The Indiegogo tools allow me to track who has referred the most traffic and I will provide a free perk to my top 3 cheerleaders! 

Why should you support my dreams? I've been a graphic designer + party stylist for over 10 years. My business Modern Moments Designs has been focused on creating simple, on trend designs. My love for design and pretty things propelled me into designing stylish parties for adults and kids alike. Much of my work has been featured on several blogs including Style Me Pretty, Pottery Barn, Hostess with the Mostess, and Very Rosenberry just to name a few. I'm a wife, mother of 3 boys and a little girl, and an entrepreneur at heart. Cupcakes and donuts are my jam!

Here at LoveJoy Workshop, we are all about the LOVE! I'd LOVE to say a special thank you to everyone who has helped me with my campaign. A special thanks to my husband for always believing in me and encouraging me to chase my dreams. To my best friend, Courtney, of Courtney Jade Photography, who produced this amazing video. To Whitney, of Makeup By Whit, who made me look so pretty in this video and who is also offering one of the perks (stay tuned)! To Maureen, or AR Workshop for supporting me and helping me in any way she can. To my other friends and family who have been loving me and cheering me on. I LOVE YOU! 

It's time to get this Party started. . . Donate today to Join the Fun!
story_txt:
LoveJoy Workshop isn't just a pipe dream. It is a proven and profitable business model. I'm partnering with AR Workshop so I can hit the ground running. They designed a tried and true process for creating personalized home décor that takes out the guess work and guarantees an incredible result.  This concept fits perfectly with our DIY vibe in the Pacific Northwest. Where we love to gather, share a glass of wine or a pint of microbrew, and create memories together. LoveJoy Workshop is more than just a class, it's an experience! On top of that, you will take home a piece that you can proudly display that will remind you of your workshop. This business model combined with my 10 years of design experience and personal style is the perfect recipe for success!  Design is always at the forefront of my heart and I'm passionate about helping women find their inner creativity. Here's where you come in: In order to make this workshop a reality, I need your help with funding. We want you to join the party! Together we can make this happen! We understand life happens and we all are busy. Our workshop will be a place for friends to reconnect & create.  A place that inspires women (or men) to build timeless pieces and memories they will treasure forever.I need your help to build out a beautiful space like this and launch LoveJoy Workshop. Here's how the classes will work. . . pick a date on the calendar, select your project, answer a few simple questions, and leave the rest to us.   On the day of your workshop, all you need to do is show up and be ready to party! When you walk through the door, everything will be ready and waiting for you! We provide the tools, materials, and step-by-step instructions to complete your project. Sip your favorite drink, dance to the music,  and let your creativity come to life! By the end of your workshop, you get to take your finished project home! LoveJoy Workshop will offer a wide range of DIY projects on various mediums that are stylish and classic while also being on-trend. Some of our projects include Wood Plank Signs, Wood Framed Signs, Pillowcases, Hanging Canvas Signs, Chalk Board Signs, Lazy Susans, and more. Each and every piece will be unique TO YOU!  You get to pick your project, personalize it, and paint it!Your home should be a reflection of your style and personality. But, it's not always that easy! Sometimes it's hard to find the perfect piece to complete your wall gallery or that perfect pillow to put on your couch. We totally get it! That's why we created a process that is tailor-made so you can create the perfect piece for your home.Check out just a few examples of projects you can create at LoveJoy Workshop. . .Our modern rustic + farmhouse style will combine aged woods, linen fabrics, and metal details. Starting with a neutral color palette, and layering in warm wood tones makes our modern rustic look, a timeless design style.  This look is simple and clean and will compliment your current décor style.Excited about attending a class? My love for design and pretty things propelled me into designing stylish parties for adults and kids alike. Much of my work has been featured on several blogs including Style Me Pretty, Pottery Barn, Hostess with the Mostess, and Very Rosenberry just to name a few. story:
I want to offer quality lures at a great price.

  • I am an avid fisherman who finds no better happiness than when fishing
  • I want to use the money from designing, making and selling lures to be put aside for a college fund for my son, and as he grows older he can assist in making the lures himself so he is contributing to the fund.
  • I want to create quality lures that work and sell them at a great price so every angler can benefit and enjoy their hobby even more.

Where the money goes

  • I am only looking for $1000 to buy some molds, specialized tools and some basics.
  • If I don't get the full $1000, it will be still be a good start and I will buy less molds and still get the process going

Small business is the heart of the economy and it is my dream to sell a quality product that will be pay for my son's college one day. 

  • Every angler loves seeing their favorite type of lure at a less than expected price.  I want them to experience that every time they go on the website and buy a lure from me.
  • Being an angler I know what works, I know what lures cost. 

The Challenge

A lot of businesses fail because they try to be too big to fast.  My time line has me introducing specific lures at the beginning and 2 additional lures or variations every other month over the first two years

  • Initial release will be 4 soft plastic lures, 3 spinners, 3 spoons
  • After 60 days there will be 1 additional spinner, 1 additional spoon
  • After this we will see what is needed to be launched depending on where are sales are the strongest.

Please share this with your angling friends through the various indiegogo share tools.

 

 

Got an idea or concept for a lure contact us and we will make you an equal partner on every one of those lures sold.

story:
We are a group of cat lovers and rescuers who are bringing our combined skills together to create an awesome way to bring community and adoptable cats together.  

It started with a very long history of cat rescue and the countless hours we would spend with our rescue kitties leaving their comfy foster homes every weekend to go sit in a cage in large scary pet store.  Many of the kitties just couldn’t relax and show people what wonderful pets they could be. 

With the advent of cat cafes popping up around the world, and even in the U.S. in the last couple of years, we knew that the cat café concept would be the solution to improving adoptions for the rescue kitties.  

Here's the Chairman presenting our plan:

"Creating a comfortable place for you humans to relax and enjoy yourself is important, in and of itself, but add the element of helping us homeless cats to find forever homes - and this becomes a very important initiative.  Big words for a little cat - pretty impressive, right? Just think about the significance of saving the lives of cats who are homeless through no fault of their own - like these kitties...."

"...and these saved kitties."

The question comes up - why a cat cafe?  If someone wants to be with a cat, they'll get one.  Not so fast!  As much as people would like to have their very own cat, they often don't.  Their lives are busy.  They're not home enough to have a cat in residence.  BUT!!! People still want to cuddle with a kitty - in a non-committal way.  How about just going to the shelter to visit kitties there - maybe even volunteer?  Well, that's a great idea, but for many people it makes them so sad.  You can volunteer at the shelter but you can also make yourself feel good. It's OK to take care of you.

We can fix that!  Feline Good Social Club looks like a family den - but with adoptable cats.  Voila!!! You can visit and cuddle and play with our kitties as often as you want with no pressure to do any more.  You don't have to be sad and the kitties are happy and relaxed in their big room with all the comforts.  Don't get nervous.  There's still no commitment - UNLESS, you want one!  All of the kitties will be up for adoption.  It's your decision when you're ready for a decision.  Take your time.

Now, you might ask if it's really all that good for the cats - and Gilbey will tell you about that:

"This is me at an adoption event in a crate in a noisy strange place.  If I wasn't here, I would be at Feline Good Social Club where I would feel safe and comfortable.  People could get to see my real personality - it's a doozy.  Plus, when I get adopted my peeps here will go back to the rescue group and get more kitties and that makes more room at the rescue for homeless kitties like I was.  I was lucky and found my forever home, but some cats are so upset at adoption events that it takes them a really long time to catch that forever home."

An important question to answer for any contributor is what will the funds be used for.

Of course, any business that wants to attract people to come and stay a while will require a design to create that ambiance.  We want your experience in the Cat Lounge to be a memorable one.  It needs to be comfortable for the humans and the cats at the same time.  We believe we've created just that perfect balance and you'll love it.  This is where the contributions we receive from you will be spent.  The build out includes permitting, licensing, plans, and construction to comply with the City regulations.  We want Feline Good Social Club to be the best possible experience for everyone.

 

It's pretty fabulous isn't it?!!!

We know that we can't do this alone.  Even though we are self-funding a fair portion of these costs, your contributions will help get us the rest of the way.

PSSSST - don't forget about all of the new cats you'll get to meet and hang out with!

We know that not everyone can afford to make an investment in a large way, but everyone can do something.  You can help us to get the word out about this campaign!  Make some noise!  Share the news far and wide in every way you can.  Indiegogo also has share tools to help you do this.

The bottom line is that every moment we are open, we will be working to save the lives of beautiful but homeless companion cats - and providing people with a respite from their busy stressful lives by relaxing in the company of cats - like these 3 kitties - Beamer, Opie and TuTee.

 

"HEY WAIT!!!  

Did you click the BACK IT button yet?  Don't leave till you do - I'm serious...."

story:
Woodies - Handcrafted RC Cars from São Tomé and Príncipe

Woodies are a product developed through Handcrafted Innovation (Hi!), a social enterprise working closely with a network of craftsmen blending crafts with technology.
 

 

Woodies - beyond a product

Regardless of all the product specs and the fun you can get from driving one,  if you decide to support us, be assured that you'll be supporting something bigger. You'll actually be supporting Handcrafted Innovation to continue pursuing its mission to gain social impact by bridging different realities through innovation.

 

At the core we're on an ambitious journey to gain impact on the local economy, seed entrepreneurship, fight poverty and create jobs, transfer knowledge and promote the country's culture internationally...ufff :)

 

Woodies' specs

Scale: 1/24 = approx. 18 cm - 7 inches.

Materials: Wood, wire and bull's horn.

Disclaimer: These products are handcrafted thus every car will be unique.

At the moment what you see here are working prototypes, with your support we'll be able to develop the final products, that won't be any where far from this. 

Technology: We'll be sourcing the most suitable and available car parts and remote controls for Woodies, thus though there may be some small changes, the specs will remain the same with concerns to scale and overall performance.

We want to be crystal clear with you, so do consider the following: 

On the one hand, we can't provide warranty as we loose it once we blend handcrafts with tech, though we can assure that quality will be continuously assessed and every car will be tested after the craftsmen work on it, and before having it shipped to you.
On the other hand, we think Woodies should be thought of as a collectors' item, because that's what it is: a rather limited and handmade edition of RC cars :)

 

 

 

Our experience

"Woodies" are Hi!'s second product being developed in São Tomé and Príncipe (STP).

We've firstly challenged local craftsmen to develop "Memories from STP"; 8 GB usb keys in wood, bull's horn and coconut that are already on sale.

 

 

 

Craftsmen

Having started with 6 of these skilled craftsmen, we have already reached around 20 of them, through 6 different workshops, including one in a State Prison.

 

 

Social entrepreneurship & beyond: Beyond the short term goal of gaining direct impact on the craftsmen lives from the products sales, Hi! is committed to long term impact through knowledge transfer and social reintegration. For that matter we’re running a training program in STP's Central Prison led by 2 experienced craftsmen.

 

Ataíde tutoring aspiring craftsmen at STP's Central Prison workshop.

 

What do craftsmen say about their work with Hi!?

 

About São Tomé and Príncipe

The second smallest African country with around 190.000 inhabitants, located in the equatorial line, by the Gulf of Guinea. Unknown to many, it's a forward moving paradise everyone should know about.

 

 

Impact 

How much do the craftsmen earn? Hi!'s financial model is built around them, thus with orders coming the involved craftsmen are able to earn the national minimum wage in only a few days of work.

Regardless of the amount of sales, the training program continues, twice a week. 

 

Furthermore, Hi!'s management in STP is assured by the local partners MOVE; an NGO with the mission to fight poverty and create jobs through entrepreneurship. 

 

 

How can you help?

Check out our perks and see which one fits you better. But don't take too long because we've special treats for first movers!

Spread the word and help us reaching our goal! 

Have you thought of becoming a distributor in your country?

 

 

How we'll be applying the funds

It's very simple:

- Sourcing and acquiring the necessary technological components
- Packaging and handling
- Travel expenses 
- International communication & distribution identification
- Intensifying training & acquiring tools and materials
- Paying the craftsmen

 

Shipping costs - Our commitment 

Being that we're sending the products directly from São Tomé & Príncipe, shipping costs are quite high, thus during the campaign duration we'll also put efforts on finding other viable ways of getting the products to you at a lower cost. What are we looking at:

- partnerships with local businesses and logistics' companies. 

- the more successful the crowdfunding gets to be, the lower will be the shipment cost per unit, as we'll be able to negotiate with bigger bundles.

 

Risks & Challenges

We firstly need to fully understand that neither Hi! is a factory nor the craftsmen are machines, thus Woodies are not a standardised product. So the biggest risk of them all comes down to expectations:

- If you're keen to get hold of innovative crafts with technology built in, or you just want contribute to Hi!'s mission. Then this definitely for you.

- If you're expecting factory finished products, our advise would be for you to find a friend that fits the description above, tease him into contributing, and then pay him a visit in a couple of months to check the product before jumping in :)  

 

Having said this, you don't need to worry about quality because that is constantly being assessed. 

 

What is uttermost important to understand is that these are handcrafted products thus every car will be unique. The overall shape and finishing will never be factory perfect, which for us is also the richness of this product. But we want to make sure that it's crystal clear for everyone.

Shipping time: From when we ship the Woodies until they get to your hands it may take a bit longer than average international shipping, since it's coming from an Island in Africa.

 

Overall there are a few challenges to consider, but that is also why São Tomé and Príncipe needs more projects with international ambition, so that one step of the time the demand helps raising the bar of the needed services.

Finally, there's also the risk that you regret getting only one :)

 

 

Timeline

 

January - crowdfunding campaign launched - checked :)

February - sourcing.

March, April & May - importing and producing.

May & June  - shipping.

 

 

Partners and background

Hi!'s first steps were taken as the result of a joint effort by:

- Government of STP

- Portuguese Embassy in STP & Camões Institute for Cooperation and Language

- Torke+CC an internationally awarded creative consultancy agency with offices in Lisbon, São Paulo and Brussels.
- MOVE, an NGO with the mission to fight poverty and create jobs through entrepreneurship.  

Thanks to Benoît do Quang for the pictures (3 cars and set of USB keys), and to ZOF Creative Film Production for the video. 
 
And thanks to everyone whom, in one way or another, has joined this journey!

Being that we're sending the products directly from São Tomé & Príncipe, shipping costs are quite high, thus during the campaign duration we'll also put efforts on finding other viable ways of getting the products to you at a lower cost. What are we looking at:
- partnerships with local businesses and logistics' companies. 
- the more successful the crowdfunding gets to be, the lower will be the shipment cost per unit, as we'll be able to negotiate with bigger bundles.
 
Risks & Challenges
We firstly need to fully understand that neither Hi! is a factory nor the craftsmen are machines, thus Woodies are not a standardised product. So the biggest risk of them all comes down to expectations:
- If you're keen to get hold of innovative crafts with technology built in, or you just want contribute to Hi!'s mission. Then this definitely for you.
- If you're expecting factory finished products, our advise would be for you to find a friend that fits the description above, tease him into contributing, and then pay him a visit in a couple of months to check the product before jumping in :)  
 
Having said this, you don't need to worry about quality because that is constantly being assessed. 
 
What is uttermost important to understand is that these are handcrafted products thus every car will be unique. The overall shape and finishing will never be factory perfect, which for us is also the richness of this product. But we want to make sure that it's crystal clear for everyone.
Shipping time: From when we ship the Woodies until they get to your hands it may take a bit longer than average international shipping, since it's coming from an Island in Africa.
 
Overall there are a few challenges to consider, but that is also why São Tomé and Príncipe needs more projects with international ambition, so that one step of the time the demand helps raising the bar of the needed services.
Finally, there's also the risk that you regret getting only one :)
 
 
Timeline
 
January - crowdfunding campaign launched - checked :)
February - sourcing.
March, April & May - importing and producing.
May & June  - shipping.
 
 
Partners and background
Hi!'s first steps were taken as the result of a joint effort by:
- Government of STP
- Portuguese Embassy in STP & Camões Institute for Cooperation and Language
- Torke+CC an internationally awarded creative consultancy agency with offices in Lisbon, São Paulo and Brussels.- MOVE, an NGO with the mission to fight poverty and create jobs through entrepreneurship.  
Thanks to Benoît do Quang for the pictures (3 cars and set of USB keys), and to ZOF Creative Film Production for the video.   And thanks to everyone whom, in one way or another, has joined this journey!

story:
DriveON

Hi my name is Andrew, I am a car enthusiast and a well rounded mechanic. I have always wanted to have a career around cars although after starting a family my passion and hobby was put on pause to take up a more practical career. I took up a career in digital media and digital printing and I am very comfortable and have a good job but I have always wanted to start a business since I was a kid and really want it to involve CARS. 

"Liking what you have is not a good enough reason to not want something better"

  • I am starting this to raise money to get me started with the cars I need to start my business. It is a traveling rental car business, but not your typical traveling or rental car. I will be taking folks like me and folks that just want to drive a modified sports car on a traveling experience like you've never experienced before through the rocky mountains! We will travel in groups together and stop and see all the beauty that Colorado has to offer on a 3 day 2 night adventure for one of my packages. While also driving on some of the funnest and challenging roads there are all through the Rockies. 
  • There will also be track days, and I will offer a 1 day drives to some of the closest and best winding roads near Denver and after we can stop by a brewery or local restaurant and dinner is on me!

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down!

  • I am asking for $30,000! Whoa! That's a lot but I am going to be starting with 5 cars and expand and grow from there with my middle goal being to double that to 10 cars and end goal of 25 different cars in my "fleet" but cars are not cheap things to acquire but I can get them cheaper and fix them better than the average Joe to cut back on costs.
  • So with my knowledge and back round of cars I don't need to buy new cars but rather I can get myself cars with higher mileage for cheap while still retaining attractive and eye catching cars and repair them myself. I have a budget of $6500 per car now that is a maximum to buy and recondition each car. 
  • A huge PLUS about this is I will have no overhead to start and don't need any employees besides myself and asking friends for some huge favors to help me fix the cars quickly to get the business rolling. 

Impacting Wildlife and National Parks

So the impact of this whole thing will be awareness to the wildlife and national parks conservation. I will be donating a percent of proceeds from my trips to the national parks around Colorado to help conserve and maintain the true natural beauty of our wonderful state.

  • I also have a sickening work ethic. Since my best friend when I was younger pushed me to be better than I was I stopped feeling sorry for myself and began to become a hard working member of society. I am not one of the people to complain that something is too hard, I am the one when faced with more work rather then complain I go beast mode and work HARDER no pain no gain. That's what it's all about..believe in yourself and others will believe in you too.

Risks

So in this day and age that we all live in and especially in my booming state of Colorado everything is going up in cost. So if I can get my funding together I plan on devoting all of my time and  attention to detail and hard work into this business.

  • So that is very unnerving when having a family is going in 100% and hoping that I will succeed. But I will have to rely on myself and myself is someone I can gamble on. 
  • I am no stranger as I am sure very few are to social media to spread the word. I am already putting together a web page and will be using tools to get me advertised to the correct people through the internet as well as sales on the streets offering deals and incentives to fill up the cars every week. I will never stop working my tail off until I grow the business into what I want it to be and even then I have a ton more entrepreneurial ideas for when I have capitol to invest into other projects and I promise I will ALWAYS come back here to indiegogo and help people like me who just need someone to believe in them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now if you break down the math I need 1200 people to make small donations and I will be at my goal in no time! 

  • But if you guys out there took the time to watch my video and read about me and can't help me out with $$ that is okay I appreciate the time you spent with me!! But if you can share this to your social media and get me out there for hopefully more folks to see that is just as valuable!! 
  • There are Indiegogo share tools to use as well!

If you have any questions or concerns head to my website www.oemplusgarage.com and there are more videos and information there as well as a way to contact me but please also leave positive comments here on the page for others to see.

Again my name is Andrew and I am just trying to be the hero of my own movie thanks for you time and SUPPORT!

We would like to raise this just to let our services start up online, so that customer from far away can also reach us.

story: Getting dressed in the morning, you are trying to strike a certain image. There is a style for which you are known, a style to which you are loyal. people expect you to look a certain way; you expect yourself to look a certain way. Many days; that image and that style, they call for a do-rag. The do-rag is classic piece of headgear, fitting a broad spectrum of outfits. It tells the world who you are, and on top of that, it is functional, keeping you warm or keeping the sun off your scalp depending on the situation. The only downside is that do-rags tend to leave marks on your forehead, damage your hair, and cause headaches. All of that is about to change, with the Markless Do-Rag. This do-rag is a revolutionary step forward in the world of headgear. Finally, you can wear a do-rag in piece, comfortable in the knowledge that you will not leave any marks on your forehead or finish out the day with a blistering headache. Right now, we are turning to you, (kickstarter / indiegogo), for help raising $20,000. This start-up capital will cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing the Markless Do-Rag, bringing this innovative headwear to people all round the world.

story:
The Beginning

Earthen Haven was created with the vision of a mother and her kin thriving in their very own home surrounded by rich earth and lush vegetation to meet all of their basic needs... But then I thought, why stop there? How rewarding would it be to donate what we grow to others in need, and ultimately teach them to provide for themselves as well?

Our Role

My sons (Titus, 7, and Maxxus, who is 4) and I --we don’t really need to mention my age-- are turning this vision into a reality! We have taken the area on a typical residential lot and structured it to provide fresh organic produce through the use of edible landscaping. Printed information and viral documentation of this project is accessible to individuals worldwide to assist in educating them about the benefits of  becoming less dependent upon commercialized farming for sustenance. Our project consists of four phases, with its final goal being to provide free, locally grown produce to the working poor. Phase I included purchasing the 12,828 sq feet of land, testing the soil, and finally getting all of the insurance and permitting. Done! Phase II comprised of excavating the land and building the infrastructure. Done! We are currently working on Phase III, the subsistence agriculture. Our fencing, trellising, and irrigation system have all been successfully installed. Thus far, we have planted nineteen fruit bearing trees; eight grape vines, and thirty-three berry bushes. We built eleven grow beds, six of which are filled with vegetables such as lettuce, spinach, beets, carrots and herbs. Best of all, we have grown all of these items in the absence of harmful herbicides and pesticides! To enable Earthen Haven to be as productive as possible, we have also purchased two brood boxes and a Flow Hive with bees to increase pollination; five beautiful Silkie chickens to provide eggs and natural fertilizer, and our composting bin and worms to recycle our organics and in turn, amend our soil. Now, our family has decided we need to branch out to other humanitarians to bring Earthen Haven to fruition by asking you to help us complete our third phase so we may begin the fourth phase of giving!

The Need

Lower income families often feel constrained by false perceptions about the cost of eating healthy fresh fruits and vegetables. The astounding number of homes with hard working individuals who still fall below the poverty line is heart breaking. These families should have access to fresh produce every day. Unfortunately, “more than 15 million U.S. children live in food-insecure households.” (stateofobesity.org, 9/16.)

Moreover, through countless years of working in the health and wellness industry, I’ve found that the mass majority of the general populous is uninformed about what kind of impact eating local clean produce has on their community, not to mention on their bodies. “Nationally, nearly 38% of adults are obese, and nearly 8 % are extremely obese.” (stateofobesity.org, 9/16)

Let's also consider that more than 1/10th of all commercially cultivated produce is just discarded because it simply doesn’t meet "grocery store standards". Then, after several thousand pounds of food are lost due to transport and storage, 31% of the remaining food that actually does make it into consumers' hands is wasted. Is this really a big deal when the qualitative loss in caloric and nutritional value of that retail food is shockingly insubstantial anyhow? YES! The loss in natural resources to grow that product and the negative impact on farmers' income directly affects YOU as a consumer. Earthen Haven is working to bring an awareness to peoples' actions and inactions when it comes to YOUR food.


 Up until the 1950s, when individuals produced a crop or livestock, they felt gratitude for what they were eating because they worked to get it to the phase of being edible. Because of the industrialized changes that have occurred, there now is a disconnect of origin and  lack of knowledge in "process" with our food production. Earthen Haven encourages families to save money and eat healthier by becoming producers, not just consumers. Buy or even trade with local farms, support our farmers' markets and gain a sense of community (even a viral one) by connecting with like minded people across the globe, starting HERE! There is so much to be gained from taking some initiative and LEARNING how to thrive in your own space.

The Plan

 For every $1,000 donated on Indiegogo, the Earthen Haven team will give 1,000 pounds of our orchard and gardens’ yield to the local, working-poor families of Southern Utah. Within each basket of vegetables handed out, we will include information describing what we have accomplished, and ideas that recipients can utilize to better their edible productivity. Every carton of fruit will be filled with inspiration to not deprive your body of nourishment because of your economic status. All of these yummy blessings from one single, hard-working parent will come with hope. I guarantee, pound for dollar, that these simple connections and the small changes that inspired people will make in their environment will have a huge impact in our tightly connected world.

How YOU can help:

  • Make a donation by choosing one of our freshly picked perks (located in the top right of this page) to help advance our cause.
  • Share our campaign with everyone and anyone by any means.
  • Grow your own garden/orchard -- micro or magnificent -- and share it in our comments section here on Indiegogo or on the Earthen Haven Facebook page. You don't have to be a permaculturist, horticulturist, botanist, homesteader, preper or even a farmer in order to do this. All it takes is someone willing to get dirty when the call arises and/or be aware of our actions and impact.

How WE are helping:

We will:

  • Plant 22 more fruit trees.
  • Plant 15 more berry bushes.
  • Plant 6 more grape vines.
  • Plant a wide array of different varieties of edible plants/tubers/fruits/flowers.
  • Install 6 more 3’x12’ cedar raised beds.
  • Construct a 6'x10' conservatory with shelves.
  • Erect an 8’x12’ retaining wall to protect the trees on the terrace.
  • Erect 10 1’ 6”x 6’ vine teepees.
  • Distribute 1 more ton of compost in the vine teepees and grow beds.
  • Spread 2 more loads of soil to level the back.
  • Weave 1 truck load of rock between the trees.
  • House more composting worms.
  • Create and print more informative cards to accompany our free produce.
  • Donate every single day to the fulfillment of this cause! And GIVE GIVE GIVE!

Aerial View of the "soon to be" Earthen Haven.

 It may seem that with the hundreds of thousands of dollars, the countless man-hours, and the unwavering tenacity that has already gone into this project, that the remaining final phases would be simple. But no man is an island; WE NEED YOUR HELP! Our original cost to finish the remaining part of phase III was $17,759.99 plus tax's/fees/shipping. Costs have been kept as low as possible through things such as volunteer labor or using seeds as opposed to plants, but the more we are able to raise the faster this process will go (ie mature trees/annuals/more crop rotations/better compost)! We here at Earthen Haven are overwhelmed with all of the local support from our very own community sponsors with donations of materials, lending equipment or even reduced retail of supplies to bring our overhead down to an attainable goal! And we are eternally grateful to YOU for backing us as well.

  All the blood, sweat and tears that this family has put into this food forest will long stand as an example to every family who falls between the helpless and the well off. We will continue to pour everything we have into completing this project and deeply appreciate your contribution.

Thank you so much!

~Cathleen, Titus, and Maxxus

story:
Cool Beans needs your help!! 

We have 90 days to relocate our stand! We are looking for your help with the costs associated with this! We want to continue bringing you the best coffee and service. We have worked so hard to bring our stand to where it is now and we don't want to lose that. We know our loyal following will stand by us and help us through this. You won't regret your donation, we will continue to offer you the best! Thank you all so much, we love and appreciate you!
story_txt: Cool Beans needs your help!! We have 90 days to relocate our stand! We are looking for your help with the costs associated with this! We want to continue bringing you the best coffee and service. We have worked so hard to bring our stand to where it is now and we don't want to lose that. We know our loyal following will stand by us and help us through this. You won't regret your donation, we will continue to offer you the best! Thank you all so much, we love and appreciate you!

story:
Hello! 

My name is Addison, and I am a homebrewer of 5 1/2 years. It all started with a 1 gallon kit my wife bought me on Christmas, and it has exploded from there. I have been doing all grain 5 gallon batches for a year. Before that it was extract with specialty grains.

I have built most every part of my homebrew setup, and all of it is 2nd hand. My mash tun is a cooler I found for $1, my hot liquor tank is a cooler I got form my in-laws for Christmas, my kettle and burner from a fellow brewer, and my most proud accomplishment is my brew stand I built out of pallets. It's not the prettiest set up, but by god it works!

What I am asking of you is to help me upgrade my equipment to become more efficient, more controlled and more reliable. I aspire to be a brewery owner one day in the not to distant future. Ask any brewer and they will tell you that the industry is ever evolving with lots of learning to be had. Friends, family, strangers and beer judges all like my beers, but there is room for improvement. I am my toughest critic, and I see a lot of potential in my beers.

To get down to it, the money raised will go to temperature controlled fermentation (my biggest issue), bigger brew kettle, counter flow wort chiller (my biggest waste of time and water), kegs and other bits and pieces.

While I currently have no rewards to offer, other than my scencerist gratitude, I will happily share pictures and information on my progress. If you are a local, you can even try some of the current homebrew.

I thank you for taking the time out of your busy day to read my proposal.

Cheers!

It's not the prettiest set up, but by god it works!
What I am asking of you is to help me upgrade my equipment to become more efficient, more controlled and more reliable. I aspire to be a brewery owner one day in the not to distant future. Ask any brewer and they will tell you that the industry is ever evolving with lots of learning to be had. Friends, family, strangers and beer judges all like my beers, but there is room for improvement. I am my toughest critic, and I see a lot of potential in my beers.
To get down to it, the money raised will go to temperature controlled fermentation (my biggest issue), bigger brew kettle, counter flow wort chiller (my biggest waste of time and water), kegs and other bits and pieces.
While I currently have no rewards to offer, other than my scencerist gratitude, I will happily share pictures and information on my progress. If you are a local, you can even try some of the current homebrew.
I thank you for taking the time out of your busy day to read my proposal.
Cheers!

story:
A New Kind of Bookstore

For more than 40 years, Narrow Gauge Newsstand served the San Luis Valley from its historic brick building in downtown Alamosa, CO. An impressive variety of magazines, lines of well-curated bookshelves, and the smell of freshly popped popcorn invited generations of valley folk to engage in the magical power of literature.

 

The store closed in March, 2018.

 

Currently, A band of community-spirited literature lovers are working diligently to bring an indie bookstore back to the heart of downtown Alamosa. The revived bookstore will follow the cooperative model, fostering a curated place for readers to convene run by community readers themselves. In order to start a new chapter, investors are needed.

 

It will be called the Narrow Gauge Book Co-op.

In order to open our doors, we need to raise $54,1000 ($30,000 on this platform) to curate inventory, support a volunteer coordinator, and make some infrastructure updates. There are three ways that you can invest in order to meet this goal. 

Here are the ways that you can invest:

 

A.) Become a donor

    Donate here so we can see this project through!  

B.) Become a member   

Claim Member perks at four different levels, and we will apply your donation toward your membership fees. 

C.) Become an owner

    One-time $100 investment = Cooperative voting rights

    One-time $500 investment = Dividends up to 6% per year

Claim the Kick-off Owner perk and we will apply your donation toward your ownership fees.

D.) All of the above

Donate here because you believe in books!

Be a member because you believe in the longevity of the Narrow Gauge Book Co-op!

Be an owner because you believe in the cooperative spirit!

Invest at all three levels to set the stage for an indie bookstore come back!

All donors will be invited to a Narrow Gauge potluck meal, celebrating your efforts with local food, live music, and good company! 

The Impact

Your investment will do so much more than open our doors. The Narrow Gauge Book Co-op will foster a sense of place centered on collaboration, volunteerism, and the power of words! We will use books to build bridges in the community. With your help we will grow a culture of readers!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The Narrow Gauge Book Co-op will be run by volunteer staff. If you are interested in investing human power please email Marlena Antonucci at volunteers.rgfp@gmail.com with the subject line “Prospective Narrow Gauge Volunteer.”

 

 

Help us draft another 40 years!

To learn more and get updates, visit our website:

Narrowgaugebooks.com

story:
The Alternate Route Story

My name is Christopher Zigmont and I am launching The Alternate Route™, a new regional bicycle business that caters to the emerging trends in both cycling and community. I started during the pandemic as a small home based business serving local riders. I am here asking for your help with our Indiegogo fundraiser to grow into a new community space.

 

While 2020 proved cruel, millions of people discovered peace aboard a bike. For many this simple bike ride made the unbearable, bearable. As local bike shops became overwhelmed, I started helping friends and neighbors. Then their friends. Then their neighbors. We were saving summer.

 

The entire bike industry is and was overwhelmed, eight week wait times for service became normal. Finding a bike proved impossible. Our side hustle got busy and morphed into a mission to get folks back out on the bike and fill that demand. 

 

I’ve been in cycling for 40 years and have supported riders and their bikes at a professional level from the Olympics to the Tour de France to the World Championships and every place in between. Now I’m bringing that experience and service home to my community. 

 

Our approach offers riders a different way to go. Our studio is to be a gathering place that offers cycling gear, service, and provisions for adventurers. Eventually we’ll offer coffee and local beer to refresh before and after the ride. We’ll build community as folks gather for rides, to share stories, and prepare for their next outing. 

 

The world is changing rapidly. The pandemic has driven a resurgence in all forms of cycling that experts suggest will continue for several years to come. The Alternate Route was created to fulfill those needs. We will fix and sell, rent and guide, serve and suggest, curate and deliver.

 

Finally, we are about doing. You don't buy a bike to own a bike, you buy it to have an experience. The Alternate Route will provide curated routes, our Alternate Route Field Trips™, with guided experiences, and even rental gear for exploring. Hire us out to support your own adventure as well. We'll keep everyone up and running.

 

Using the Funding 

To get there, we need your investment and support. We don’t have access to typical startup capital. The funding will go to:

  • Establish our new bike studio space (location to be announced soon!)
  • Build out our ride support apparatus 
  • Complete our fleet of demo bikes

Our new space will serve as our Field Trips support center as well as our service and sales space, all based here in South Eastern NH.

 

Our Mission

We measure our success by fulfilling our triple sustainability objectives; Environmental Sustainability, Economic Sustainability, and Social Sustainability. For us this means using and promoting brands and suppliers that offer sustainable products, local products and craftspeople, and giving back to the community we live in. For 2021 we will do this with donations to the South Eastern Land Trust (selt.org) who saves and protects local lands (2% of our net profit or $250 which ever is more), and Bikes Not Bombs (bikesnotbombs.org) who uses bicycles for social change, with a donation of bikes and components for their different programs. 

 

About Chris

Christopher is a marketing executive leader with 40 years of cycling and outdoor industry experience. More than a desk jockey, Chris has decades of supporting professional and amateur cyclists through their competitive endeavors in nearly every discipline of cycling. Leadership roles at SHIFT Active Media, Global Cycling Network, adidas, Mavic, SRAM, and others were part of his journey. From startups to global brands, Chris has been breaking new ground for brands in consumer engagement, experiential marketing, PR, and digital media strategy. Chris will bring this cumulative experience home to serve riders in his area. Chris is a husband and father of four, lifelong cyclist, and cancer survivor, who works to raise awareness for several cancer causes.

story:
We realized that on-demand delivery was broken so, we decided to fix it.

 

On-demand delivery and mobile shopping experiences are the future of retail & BeauDASH (bō-daSH) is at the vanguard with an on-demand distribution platform for small local businesses. That allows retailers to engage with and understand customers to sell more goods; all this while providing convenience for consumers and jobs for locals.

 

Reasons to Invest

  • Small businesses deserve to have their products distributed and displayed without paying OUTRAGEOUS slotting fees.

  • The market for beauty, hygiene, and cleaning prdoucts continues to grow each year, and so does the demand for on-demand delivery.

  • Our goal is to become the largest distribution platform for small local businesses by scaling out our existing software through partnerships and acquisitions.

 

 

“The one profiting off of your brands should be you"

 

 

80% to 90% of new products fail. Placing an untested product puts retailers at immense financial risk — slotting fees arose to mitigate sales losses. Slotting allowances became common in the 1980s, when new products were proliferating across the marketplace, and have remained a standard practice among retailers.

For many vendors, slotting fees are just a price of doing business.

The good news is that BeauDASH is the solution. At BeauDASH , we help businesses generate the most effective sales and reduce these costs.

We empower businesses to get distribution and understand the value of their own products and participate in the resulting profit. What’s more, our data visualization can optimize sales strategies to help manufacturers target the most cost-effective strategies on the market.

We do this by allowing you to upload your products to our mobile application (for a small monthly fee). We then curate a strategic marketing campaigns to help promote our partnership and your products. Lastly, we deliver your goods directly to your consumers in less than an hour for a super small delivery fee (the consumer pays for this). 

Since launch, we’ve focused on partnering with local business owners in South Florida  like L'amour Maternel & Gawdess Galore. We collected 1K in revenue for our Partners in our first week of operation, but our vision is much larger than than the sunshine state. We want all small businesses globally to have access to our distribution platform for their consumers. 

While automation and self-service is booming, 3 valuable segments of the retail economy are being left out!

Beauty

Personal Care

House Cleaning

Why is it that we can shop for alcohol or a burger and have it delivered in two-hours or less, not toilet paper, cleaning products, or beauty essentials?!

We live in a pandemic age where on-demand delivery has become a norm. In other words, the concept, which was in a nascent stage a few years ago, is now in limelight. And why not? People prefer to stay at home and order necessary items to get delivery at their doorstep in this quarantine period. Though movement restrictions and lockdown-like situations are eased gradually across the world, it seems that on-demand delivery is mainstreamed in the retail segment.

On-demand delivery is at the heart of a colossal shift in the retail paradigm, and in the midst of this phenomenon deemed “CoVid-19”, the on-demand retail industry is EXPLODING. In fact, a recent reports of retail customers showed that the over 23 million users spend $57.6 billion annually and now prefer on-demand delivery experiences, as per Harvard Business.

  • Around 7.6 million Americans will act as providers in the on-demand economy by 2020
  • On-demand food delivery market will reach $161.74 billion by the year 2023
  • Instacart and Walmart Grocery have recorded a surge of 218% and 160% in the number of daily downloads in this corona age

 

 

We deliver beauty, house cleaning, and personal care products from small businesses established in your local community, including major retailers you love, in under 1-hour.

BeauDASH has created a distribution platform that flips the script and allows small businesses (our Partners) to grow exponentially without having to pitch to big box retailers or leave the comfort of their homes. We put the power back in the hands of the creators!

By using our applications to sell their own products, our Partners can now get access to a broader market of consumers and marketing, dedicated to driving results. Concurrently, consumers gain access to their favorite products without having to drive to the store or wait in line. 

 

We see ourselves becoming the future of product distribution between small local businesses and their consumers. As the on-demand economy grows, we plan to be there with our proprietary technology as the flagship option from B2C sales transactions.

 

 

We charge our Partners a monthly or annual annual subscription for access to our ecosystem. This costs businesses anywhere from $300 to $500 per year and gives growing companies an opportunity to enhance their existing sales, marketing strategies or supplement the very expensive shelving costs currently on availble. We also offer Service Level Agreements in exchange for more platform support from our team.

We charge an monthly or annual subscription from our BeauDASH customers to receive access to FREE delivery with BeauDASH Boundless on every order over $12 for only $9.99 a month or $99.99 annually, get and receive FREE delivery.

*Pricing disclosed above is subject to change depending on the customer and products outlined in each relationship. The pricing proved above is an estimate.

We’re founded by Shakyra Chrysostome, founder of LOUD District Marketing (acquired) and a leader in the tech publicity, leading to over $100M in venture investment.

Shakyra is a serial entrepreneur with over 16 years in cosmetology and over 8 in public relations and business development. Shakyra has received numerous awards and regularly speaks on panels and workshops around the country. Her work has been featured in countless media outlets including Forbes, Inc Magazine, Blavity, Huffington Post, Essence Magazine, Ebony.com, Women’s World Daily, CNBC/Yahoo, MSNBC and on the cover of Black Enterprise.

Shakyra's background as a tech publicist coupled with her experience as cosmetologist helped to brainstorm the BeauDASH mobile application and BeauDASH Beauty enterprise.

 

 

Surrounding her is an experienced team with rich experience in app development, marketing, and tech.

 

Participate in the future of the small-business economy, now.

We are a highly experienced and connected team with an excellent product that is perfectly positioned to take advantage of the recent market shifts and help businesses grow. 

This is an opportunity to join us on a journey to transfer the value of complete ownership back to the people before it’s too late.

 

In Novemeber of 2019, after design the concept for BeauDASH, Shakyra spent 4 weeks developing a survey style shopping app with typeform that launched on October 17, 2020 and ran for a week. She found that consumers loved the concept of having their personal care and cleaning products deliver but, wanted a functioning  mobile app. So she went into overdriver researching a testing softwares that can help her create an adroid and apple compatible mobile application. Simultaneously, the team went on to survey roughly 500 men and women of diverse backgrounds on their needs, behaviors, and top product choices.

This research helped to develop the MVP version of BeauDASH with the Shopify x Tapcart platform. With our MVP on the market we have had the privilege of partnering with 7 local small businesses and 2 retail chains in the Miami-Dade and Broward county markets (Gratitude).

The BeauDASH team is working diligently, everyday, to survey the needs of our customers and Partners, and gathr information that will help us to complete th development of our final product. To-date, BeauDASH has acquired mobile and web application developers, a creative direction team, marketing director, PR director, and company advisor. 

With your support, we compensate our hardworking team, acquire a sales force and street amrketing team, and we can now purchase the finals components that will allow for BeauDASH to grow from the Miami Market to 25 cities across the U.S.

 

What's Left

Investment in delivery infrastructure for complete our final product

Initial budget to fund product inventory and supply chain

Building out our small business data base

Some extra capital to keep the lights on

 

WE have MAJOR plans for BeauDASH and would love to discuss them with you! Although, we can not reveal all of our proprietary details, we absolutely want you to be aware of all of our upcoming surprises. Email us at Partner@BeauDASH.co.
