story:
Short Summary

KUTULU BOXES: Curated boxes for unique experiences!

KUTULU is a company that designs curated boxes with different themes that will provide unique individual experiences for curious minds.

OUR PROJECT

Support our dream project KUTULU! 

We are setting up a female-led art business that aims to support interdisciplinary works between arts, crafts, research and entertainment. KUTULU is a company that creates curated boxes for different themes. Each box is designed to provide a unique individual experience for curious minds. The boxes can provide personal as well as shared activities that you can participate with others. Through KUTULU you may learn new things, interact with other KUTULU followers and have a fun day/night curated specifically for you.  You may also participate in our private online events by which you will be supporting local artists, designers and business owners.  

 

How KUTULU was born?

 

Kutu means box in our mother tongue, kutulu (with a box) is a reference to the Kutulu (Also known as Cthulhu) which is a fictional cosmic entity created by one of our favourite writers H. P. Lovecraft in his 1928 short story "The Call of Cthulhu". Kutulu is a hybrid creature with tentacles and dragon-like wings which was very inspirational for our company's hybrid vision. 

The pandemic brought so many inconveniences and difficulties to our lives. But one of the things that we are so grateful for, is  that we found ourselves in a house of collaboration and creativity when most needed. We had endless nights where we created games and art projects for each other. We organised house exhibitions, screenings and movie nights, and while we tried to keep each other safe and entertained, we started sharing these ideas with our close friends and we have received incredible feedback. This creative environment helped us deal with the anxieties we had for  we felt our fields in arts & education are becoming less accessible to the public. This awareness helped us become more grounded and productive in creating  our own business idea which would be helpful  for our community as well.

We are not only good friends but we are also excellent collaborators. We worked in related fields for more than eight years, and we are fully trained as researchers, curators and event organisers.

 

Let us introduce you with some of the KUTULU boxes and ideas; 

 

Nail Art Box: 

We were always fascinated with the idea of using body parts as exhibition spaces. A couple of years ago, artist Funa Ye organised an open call for an exhibition in Nottingham where she asked participants to create an exhibition on nails. Since then, we are  thinking about how the nail art community expanded as a beauty trend. We are fascinated by how nail art can be an activity where you can express yourself, your art, your mood and even your dreams by using different mediums. With our nail art box, we are not aiming to give you a final cut manicure, but more of a DIY experience where you can use different materials to create your own art while having a great time with your friends. And yes, nail art is for all ages, all genders! We will support our nail art box with workshops and commissioned designs by incredible nail artists.

 

Cabinet of Curiosity Box:

Cabinets of curiosities, also known as 'wonder rooms', were small collections of extraordinary objects which inspired today’s museums. Historically, they were known to be places where people showcased their personal collections of natural findings, artworks, and curious objects with personal, scientific and mythical stories behind them. As a small replica of this unique collecting practice, which dates back to the 16th century, this box intends to revive similar interests by evoking your inner collector. With this box of wonders, you can be part of the stories that we have already started writing for you or you can also use it as a guide to create your own cabinet of curiosity.

 

Artist' Box:

With the Artists' Box, we aim to introduce individual artists or art collectives by commissioning a box-based limited edition work. This box is just another way for us to show that we can use any platform to create and share art. Think this box as a portable art “space” where especially underrepresented artists could use to share their work. Each box owner will have a private link where they can reach artists' personal stories. Through this link they can also have online studio visits and access detailed information about the artists’ practice and upcoming/ongoing projects. Each year, we hope to work with at least four artists.

*Some of the artists that we are collaborating with have already started preparing their own boxes and we can't wait to share them.

 

Hex Box: 

Hex Box is a very daring box for us! Initially focusing on the traditions of occult sciences, offerings, and charms, this box is curated for you to channel whatever memory, feeling, concern you have into a custom-made doll made by a local artisan, and partake a ritual following the instructions that you will find in the box. 

*As an extension to the Hex Box, you will have the chance to reach artists, researchers, and historians who are experts on the subject and will help you to explore the secret sides of occult sciences, practices and stories.

 

Play Box:

Well, we are kinky individuals, but awareness around sex and sex education came into discourse way later in our life; now, thanks to incredibly well connected online communities , this awareness could reach a wider audience. With play box you can experience an exciting erotic night where you can discover the history of sex and pleasure from different cultures and eras. You will have access to uniquely curated games which will offer you either a fun solo night or a kinky group activity ;)  It could also make a thoughtful gift for your loved ones or an open invite for exploration!  

*Each box will have a QR code that will lead you to a private video curated and prepared for you. This extended experience will range from instruction videos to artist studio visits and conversations with experts.

 

Our project KUTULU is based on:

 

Eda: I am a PhD researcher and a photographer who loves working with different materials, locations, archives and people. I consider the research process as a creative and collaborative experience. With KUTULU, we will not only provide a personal experience but connect people through collaborative projects where we share our research process and create together through online talks, workshops and events. Mine: I'm an independent curator and worked in arts for more than seven years; having organised various art events and projects in different countries; I tend to see where accessibility and transdisciplinarity is still an issue in our current system. With KUTULU, we hope to share our personal experiences while supporting artists, artisans and local businesses by promoting and selling their work and products.

Knowledge production & research: We are library and archive freaks! We love learning from each other, from our communities and sharing them with broader audiences. We treat our boxes as unique art projects that can be experienced collectively as well as privately. With your support, we  hope to continue our research to develop and produce our other box ideas.  

Imagination: We are not afraid of expressing ourselves or think differently, and being willing to explore new perspectives.

Financial independence: We aim to raise awareness on inequalities of creative industries, including arts and education. We will, however, need to build our supporting financial structures so that we can help others as well.

Fun: Humour is a big turn on! So hopefully, KUTULU's core function will be just making people laugh while creating and learning something new!

Resilience: Staying faithful to our mission and values is essential, but we will have the flexibility to adapt what the future will bring.

At the moment, we have the prototypes and supporting events for our first five boxes. Thanks to your generous help and support, we are hoping to produce the rest of our box ideas, improve our  design and find alternative ecological solutions for our packaging. With your support we will finalise our website and social media accounts where we can start launching our events with artists that will accompany our boxes at the end of this summer. Any support is highly appreciated, and we are so excited to share our journey with you all!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Project Budget:  5,000 Pounds for our initial expenses

  • We will use the funds to start our project by commissioning works from our art community, launching our website and building our inventory as well as finding the best eco-friendly printing and packaging solutions for our box prototypes. To create our own working space, we will need to hire a small storage for our company’s materials where we can also launch our events. 
  • During these financially tough times, the arts & culture industries have been impacted, so we aim to start our own project in East London to help support local artists and small businesses.
  • Our uniquely selected rewards are chosen to represent our projects. The rewards range from tote bags, selected boxes to  limited edition artworks.
  • With your kind support and contribution, we will fund and start our own dream company this summer! We are committed to finishing our project. even if we don't reach our target fund in Indiegogo.

 

Our team: 

Mine Kaplangı (1987, Istanbul) is an independent curator and arts writer based in London. She is the co-founder of the curatorial collective Collective Çukurcuma. She is passionate about transdisciplinary art practices and has been working on the idea of how to expand the accessibility of art. She believes that arts should be experienced daily, not only within the walls of institutions. Mine helps artists to develop their archives, publications and public art projects and also works as a freelance editor for the Berlin-based contemporary art platform Artfridge. She is a community builder, a big fan of DIY & zine & nail art culture.

Eda Sancakdar (1985, Samsun) is a London based photographer and researcher. For her photographic practices she collaborates with various queer collectives, performance artists and movers. She is currently a PhD student at the Winchester School of Art, University of Southampton and holds an MFA in Visual Communication and Design. Her academic interests involve 19th century visual history, archive building and memory studies as well as histories of occult practices and their relation to visual arts. Eda herself is a collector and an avid fan of oddities; everything that blurs the lines between the real  and imaginary.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any dream project, there are risks and challenges that may arise over the course of the launch. We believe that with your generous support we can start our online events in the following weeks and launch our company at the end of this summer but we are aware that any unexpected delays might occur due to Covid-19 restrictions.

Also unexpected delays may occur for shipping our rewards due to Covid-19 but we will keep our international supporters fully updated regarding the situation and they will know well in advance if there is likely to be a delay. 

We can not wait to share KUTULU with you and also continue working on our additional ideas of how to turn this business idea into a sustainable community art project. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't contribute please do not worry! There are other ways you can help us:

- Spread the word! Share this campaign with your networks and friends

- Follow our Instagram account and share with others! : https://www.instagram.com/kutulu_boxes/

- And please please use the Indiegogo share tools, we have only a month to collect the support we seek!

 

Social Media Platforms:

 

Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@kutulu_boxes

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kutulu_boxes/

 

For all your questions & suggestions please contact us - hello@kutulu.co.uk

 

Thank you for supporting us!

Eda & Mine

Short Summary
KUTULU BOXES: Curated boxes for unique experiences!
KUTULU is a company that designs curated boxes with different themes that will provide unique individual experiences for curious minds.

OUR PROJECT
Support our dream project KUTULU! 
We are setting up a female-led art business that aims to support interdisciplinary works between arts, crafts, research and entertainment. KUTULU is a company that creates curated boxes for different themes. Each box is designed to provide a unique individual experience for curious minds. The boxes can provide personal as well as shared activities that you can participate with others. Through KUTULU you may learn new things, interact with other KUTULU followers and have a fun day/night curated specifically for you.  You may also participate in our private online events by which you will be supporting local artists, designers and business owners.  
 
How KUTULU was born?
 
Kutu means box in our mother tongue, kutulu (with a box) is a reference to the Kutulu (Also known as Cthulhu) which is a fictional cosmic entity created by one of our favourite writers H. P. Lovecraft in his 1928 short story "The Call of Cthulhu". Kutulu is a hybrid creature with tentacles and dragon-like wings which was very inspirational for our company's hybrid vision. 
The pandemic brought so many inconveniences and difficulties to our lives. But one of the things that we are so grateful for, is  that we found ourselves in a house of collaboration and creativity when most needed. We had endless nights where we created games and art projects for each other. We organised house exhibitions, screenings and movie nights, and while we tried to keep each other safe and entertained, we started sharing these ideas with our close friends and we have received incredible feedback. This creative environment helped us deal with the anxieties we had for  we felt our fields in arts & education are becoming less accessible to the public. This awareness helped us become more grounded and productive in creating  our own business idea which would be helpful  for our community as well.
We are not only good friends but we are also excellent collaborators. We worked in related fields for more than eight years, and we are fully trained as researchers, curators and event organisers.
 
Let us introduce you with some of the KUTULU boxes and ideas; 
 
Nail Art Box: 
We were always fascinated with the idea of using body parts as exhibition spaces. A couple of years ago, artist Funa Ye organised an open call for an exhibition in Nottingham where she asked participants to create an exhibition on nails. Since then, we are  thinking about how the nail art community expanded as a beauty trend. We are fascinated by how nail art can be an activity where you can express yourself, your art, your mood and even your dreams by using different mediums. With our nail art box, we are not aiming to give you a final cut manicure, but more of a DIY experience where you can use different materials to create your own art while having a great time with your friends. And yes, nail art is for all ages, all genders! We will support our nail art box with workshops and commissioned designs by incredible nail artists.

story:
Caffeine Culture Coffee is determined to become a daily necessity for local coffee connoisseurs and fine-brew fanatics. With the growing demand for high-quality gourmet coffee and great service, Caffeine Culture will capitalize on its knowledge of superior roasting and brewing techniques to build a core group of patrons. Caffeine Culture will offer its customers the best prepared coffee in the area at a reasonable price.

     The money raised during this campaign will go towards purchasing our first Coffee Roaster, which is the first step of advancing Caffeine Culture's business model of a high quality roast and brew. We will provide only the freshest roasts in a variety of styles, including light, medium dark and some specialty roasts.

     But why stop there? We live in a mobile world and that is why we will also be converting a box truck into the Caffeine Culture "Rolling Roaster". This mobile roastery/brewery/coffee shop all in one will canvas New England towns and neighborhoods in Boston to actually deliver fresh, quality coffee. Where in the world will they be? That's easy! Caffeine Culture loyals can track the Rolling Roaster via our mobile app or through our social media updates. 

     Because we believe the sky is the limit, from there Caffeine Culture will fixate on opening the Caffeine Culture Coffee Bar in the budding downtown location of Mansfield with close proximity to many upcoming properties and the commuter rail. Caffeine Culture Coffee Bar's hand crafted coffees will be complimented with freshly baked pastries, as well as an offering of free books that its patrons can read as they enjoy their coffee during their visit. Caffeine Culture Coffee Bar fills the void of quality coffee bars in the market area and stands out from its fast food style, commercialized peers. Caffeine Culture is the alternative to fast food/commercial/coffee shops and offers a much calmer and more civilized gourmet coffee experience. 

 At the forefront of our beliefs, we intend to use this opportunity to strengthen the local community in Mansfield. We will bring income and jobs to the local economy. Caffeine Culture will happily host fundraising nights for the local schools, sports teams, and 501(c)3 charities.


Check out our website at: www.CaffeineCultureMA.com 

_____________________________________________________________________________

Where exactly will the money we raise go? 

1. Coffee Roaster!  We are looking to purchase a 6KG Gas Coffee Roaster. There are many styles and brands available and they all go for about $15,000. 
2. Education! The entire company will be going to roasting school, to learn the ins and outs of roasting coffee. 
3. Beans! We will be purchasing around 100 pounds of green coffee beans to get our operation up and running. 
Thanks for your support!! 
Because specialty coffee is just starting to come around to Southeastern Massachusetts, we expect it to take a little time for the general public to catch on. We're a young company, so there is a lot of detail left to work through in order to be ready for roasting on a larger scale. We've tried to tailor our rewards in a way that makes easy fulfillment possible. There could be some delay in the opening of the new retail space, but we will use that time to prepare for the future of our company.

story:
Reader’s Legacy is a place for avid readers to connect in a social community, to browse for new titles, receive recommendations, and for aspiring writers and novelists to receive feedback and get discovered. It is a place where reading enthusiasts can not only preserve relationships with books, but build new ones with fellow book lovers.  https://ReadersLegacy.com

(Every single person who contributes, with a minimum contribution of $10, to our campaign will be entered into a random drawing for the following prizes:
Grand Prize:     Trip for 2 to Las Vegas  for the 2nd annual RCLA, June 4-6 2016 (flights in continental USA, Hotel for 3 days and tickets to the Readers Legacy Choice Awards), 2nd prize:  1 million Litcoins to buy books for a year, 3rd prize:  NYT Bestselling monthly book subscription for a year)

Reader’s Legacy is a high tech social media website, as well as a bookseller and author marketing support platform for the modern age. Authors will receive unprecedented help in promoting, exposing their books to potential readers and selling more books!

Avid readers, who: create a free account, build their virtual libraries, connect with other readers, follow their favorite authors & buy their books, will receive Litcoins(TM) for doing so.  They can use these litcoins(TM) like a virtual currency.  Litcoins(TM) can be used to buy books, buy merchandise and much more.

Authors can create book profile pages for their books & themselves.  Authors can enroll in the upcoming Author's Buzz program (launching Oct 1st).  Authors can also use their Litcoins(TM) to promote their books directly on the pages of readers who have already told us they like that specific genre & are looking to discover their next read.

Picture a combination of Facebook, Amazon, GoodReads & LuLu -- that's Reader’s Legacy.

We have built the platform to the same quality as Facebook, LinkedIn or Twitter.  We already have thousands of people using the site & buying books from us instead of Amazon.  We already have hundreds of authors that are adding their books, building their following and promoting their work. 

The publishing industry and authors, in general, believe we are the 1st real competitor to Amazon for book sales!

Now we need you to contribute!  Our campaign is designed to give you an incentive to contribute to our funds raising.  All funds raised will be used to continue to develop http://Readerslegacy.com and launch an international marketing campaign to promote the website.  We have already invested millions building and launching Reader's Legacy, now we need your help!  Our goal is to raise at least $100,000, but the more the better, to fully implement our marketing plan.  If you love reading, this is the ultimate offer for you!

Look over at the Perks to see the details of our offer to you.  We have special offers for both Authors and Avid Readers to contribute.   We really need your help in order to let readers, authors and publishers know that Reader's Legacy is there for them.  They will thank you, as they are all starving for more exposure for their books and an alternative to the status quo.

If you contribute you will be helping to build the world's largest community of readers & authors.  For contributors, your page will be marked with a special insignia to note your willingness to help.

ALL Indiegogo contributors will have a special recognition badge on their personal page that will say:  I love books & helped Reader's Legacy Through Indiegogo!

Books are cool & so are the people who read them!

People who love books, love to have books around them. We have created a community where people can create a digital legacy of their books. On ReadersLegacy.com, every book in the world has a page, every author has a page, every publisher has a page, and everyone who loves books has a page.

This is the first chance for an avid reader to create a virtual version of their home library!


(Every single person who contributes, with a minimum contribution of $10, to our campaign will be entered into a random drawing for the following prizes:
Grand Prize:  Trip for 2 to Las Vegas  for the 2nd annual RCLA, June 4-6 2016 (flights in continental USA, Hotel for 3 days and tickets to the Readers Legacy Choice Awards), 2nd prize:  1 million Litcoins to buy books for a year, 3rd prize:  NYT Bestselling monthly book subscription for a year)


A Virtual Home Library

Reader’s Legacy is a place where book lovers can preserve the intimate relationships they have built over the years with their books. The same books that taught them invaluable lessons, lifted them out of dark times, transported them to places they could only dream about -- those same books hold deep value, both tangible and sentimental.

We are an online community where people who love to read can come together -- the world’s largest bookclub, in a sense.

Independent authors will rely upon Reader’s Legacy to promote their books and make more sales. Reading enthusiasts will flock to our website for the chance to socialize with other readers and with their favorite authors, and to build up their Litcoin™ accounts.

All users love the familiarity of ReadersLegacy.com. We are built using the same technology as both Amazon and Facebook, creating an enjoyable experience discussing and discovering books on https://ReadersLegacy.com.


Our founder, Ken Dunn, recounts how it all started!


The team at Reader's Legacy are all authors and avid readers.  We have created the ultimate experience for those people who truly love books and those who write them.  The entire world of books is in the middle of the largest change in history - virtualization.  For many, the change has not been easy, for others it presents opportunity!

Now you can create a free account, build a virtual version of your home library and the books you love, connect with readers around the world and earn Litcoins to use on your next book purchase.  Here are some more details on what is waiting for you:

(after this, we will introduce you to our team and tell you how you can help)



Users of ReadersLegacy.com can create a free account and use our smartphone app to scan the barcodes of every book you’ve ever read. Those books then show up in your virtual bookshelf, preserving your legacy. We also built in a search feature on the website to find books and add them to your collection.

When books get added to your bookshelf on ReadersLegacy.com, they aren’t the actual books themselves, but advertorial pages of the books. These pages contain a picture of the book cover, the author’s name, other works by that author, a trailer video of the book, and thousands of comments by fellow lovers of that book, who are all registered users of Reader’s Legacy.

With all this information at your fingertips, you would come across a treasure trove of new book recommendations, either by the same author or another user saying, “If you love this book, I know you’ll also love ____.”

In turn, you could also add your own notes and help your fellow book lovers find new books, or even make sense of a specific passage or chapter in that book.

As part of the world’s largest book club, a mashup of Facebook, Amazon, GoodReads and Lulu, users also have the ability to follow their favorite authors, publishers, and of course, their friends and colleagues.

So, for example, you could be on Reader’s Legacy one day and see in your feed that a respected colleague, or maybe even just a friend who you know loves the same types of books as you, just added a new book to their library. You’ve never heard of this book but, trusting in this person’s tastes and judgement, decide to check it out knowing it must be a good read.

You then check out the advertorial page for that book and see all the other comments people have made about it. Within those comments, you see a comment by Bill Gates or Oprah that cements your interest. On Reader’s Legacy, you are naturally brought to the point where you want to buy that book.

Litcoin™ credits are our own virtual currency on ReadersLegacy.com. We created them to help you take your virtual bookshelf to the next level. What good is having a bookshelf unless you can keep adding to it after all?

Gamification is a powerful tool to build and sustain engagement and enjoyment with a website. Litcoin™ credits are earned through creating an account, adding books, engaging in the community, following authors and publishers, posting comments, sharing comments to other social media networks, etc.

Litcoin™ credits are easy to earn and make it so you may never have to buy another book again. The more you participate in this fun and social book club, the cheaper your new books become.

On Reader’s Legacy, independent authors -- all 50 million of them by some accounts -- can create an account for them and for their book, fill in all the metadata, and start selling their book straight from the website. By being part of this community, you also have the rare opportunity to connect with your potential readers on a personal level. You are simply book-loving peers on Reader’s Legacy. You can appeal to your readers’ interests because you know them on a deeper level.

Additionally, the big players in self-publishing are all huge companies who don’t care about the success of your book. Reader’s Legacy is different because we take an active interest in helping you market and sell your life’s work. We help make your legacy, and your reader’s legacy, one in the same.

Publishers now have an easy way to contact authors, market their packages, and keep in touch with future or potential readers. They can also create a complete list of all the authors they have published, allowing them to collect a fan base. A user will be naturally inclined to a publisher they see is responsible for all their favorite authors. How many publishers can say they have fans? This will, in turn, inspire other authors to use you as their publisher in the future.


(Every single person who contributes, with a minimum contribution of $10, to our campaign will be entered into a random drawing for the following prizes:
Grand Prize:  Trip for 2 to Las Vegas  for the 2nd annual RCLA, June 4-6 2016 (flights in continental USA, Hotel for 3 days and tickets to the Readers Legacy Choice Awards), 2nd prize:  1 million Litcoins to buy books for a year, 3rd prize:  NYT Bestselling monthly book subscription for a year)



The Official Launch of Reader's Legacy



The idea for Reader’s Legacy started in 2011. Behind the work of our 29 full-time staff, we successfully launched the website on June 7, 2015. In the first 10 days after launch, we had over 1,000 people join the community.

In fact, Cevin Bryenman, Publisher at Publishers Weekly and a go-to authority in the publishing industry, called us, “one of the fastest growing publishing companies in the U.S.” and Bryerman said, "ReadersLegacy.com is like adding gas to an already raging fire".

Infrastructure

https://ReadersLegacy.com is built on the Python platform. Our partnership with Ingram Content, the largest distributor in the world, gives us an embedded API where all our data is housed -- this is the same setup that Amazon has with Ingram for data feed and distribution.   

As many books as Amazon, better pricing then Amazon & you get points!

From the day we launched, on June 7th, we have been selling over 15,000,000 books.  On October 1st, 2015, we will be launching the ability for independent authors to load their books, and set their own retail price.  When a book sells, the independent author will ship the book and we will pay them the revenue.  For the reading enthusiast, this means a facebook like experience with better service, pricing and perks then Amazon.

The idea for Reader’s Legacy started in 2011. Behind the work of our 29 full-time staff, we successfully launched the website on June 7, 2015. In the first 10 days after launch, we had over 1,000 people join the community.



In fact, Cevin Bryenman, Publisher at Publishers Weekly and a go-to authority in the publishing industry, called us, “one of the fastest growing publishing companies in the U.S.” and Bryerman said, "ReadersLegacy.com is like adding gas to an already raging fire".

The more money we raise through Indigogo, the more PR and advertising we can do.


Annual Reader's Legacy Choice Awards & Writers Conference

Annually, on the first weekend of June, we will host the annual awards ceremony and writers conference.  We held the 1st annual conference from June 6-8th, 2015, where we launched the website.  We had over 300 attendees (all up and coming authors) and awarded 16 elite level authors with the Hermes Award (Hermes was the Greek God of Literature).  Attendees said it was the most elite level book awards and writers conference that they had ever attended.  By the end of the weekend, it was being called, "The Academy Awards of the Book Business".


Please make sure the check the perks.  Depending on which you contribution you choose to make, your perk could include a $599 VIP ticket to next year's event!


We wanted to take a minute to introduce you to our team.  We know that, if you are willing to contribute your hard earned money, it will be important to you to know who were are:

Kenneth J. Dunn, Founder & CEO
Ken has been an entrepreneur for 20 years and his success is dependable -- he has been a millionaire 3 times over in 3 different businesses. He is an independent author himself, having written 5 books and sold 250K copies. Prior to his entrepreneurial exploits, he was an investigative police officer for 14 years.


Rod Larrivee, President
Rod is Ken’s business partner as well as the source of the lightening rod that struck the idea of Reader’s Legacy. He runs all operations, production, and logistics. Rod also has been an entrepreneur for over two decades and is the former COO/Co-Founder of a $10 million chain of Dollar Stores.


Simon Presland, Editor In Chief
Simon is an elite level editor with 15 years of experience. He is responsible for all editing and book publishing.


Tiffany Magner, VP of Sales
With her 25 years of professional sales management experience, Tiffany oversees all sales and project management for Reader’s Legacy.


Colin Ellis, Director of IT
Colin is our IT Director and Chief Programmer. He previously built Audioboom.com.

Reader’s
Legacy is a place for avid readers to connect in a social community, to browse for
new titles, receive recommendations, and for aspiring writers and novelists to
receive feedback and get discovered. It is a place where reading enthusiasts
can not only preserve relationships with books, but build new ones with fellow
book lovers.  https://ReadersLegacy.com(Every single person who contributes, with a minimum contribution of $10, to our campaign will be entered into a random drawing for the following prizes:Grand Prize:     Trip for 2 to Las Vegas  for the 2nd annual RCLA, June 4-6 2016 (flights in continental USA, Hotel for 3 days and tickets to the Readers Legacy Choice Awards), 2nd prize:  1 million Litcoins to buy books for a year, 3rd prize:  NYT Bestselling monthly book subscription for a year)
Reader’s Legacy is a high tech social
media website, as well as a bookseller and author marketing support platform for the modern age. Authors will receive unprecedented help in promoting, exposing their books to potential readers and selling more books!
Avid readers, who: create a free account, build their virtual libraries, connect with other readers, follow their favorite authors & buy their books, will receive Litcoins(TM) for doing so.  They can use these litcoins(TM) like a virtual currency.  Litcoins(TM) can be used to buy books, buy merchandise and much more.
Authors can create book profile pages for their books & themselves.  Authors can enroll in the upcoming Author's Buzz program (launching Oct 1st).  Authors can also use their Litcoins(TM) to promote their books directly on the pages of readers who have already told us they like that specific genre & are looking to discover their next read.
Picture
a combination of Facebook, Amazon, GoodReads & LuLu -- that's Reader’s Legacy.
We have built the platform to the same quality as Facebook, LinkedIn or Twitter.  We already have thousands of people using the site & buying books from us instead of Amazon.  We already have hundreds of authors that are adding their books, building their following and promoting their work.  The publishing industry and authors, in general, believe we are the 1st real competitor to Amazon for book sales!Now we need you to contribute!  Our campaign is designed to give you an incentive to contribute to our funds raising.  All funds raised will be used to continue to develop http://Readerslegacy.com and launch an international marketing campaign to promote the website.  We have already invested millions building and launching Reader's Legacy, now we need your help!  Our goal is to raise at least $100,000, but the more the better, to fully implement our marketing plan.  If you love reading, this is the ultimate offer for you!Look over at the Perks to see the details of our offer to you.  We have special offers for both Authors and Avid Readers to contribute.   We really need your help in order to let readers, authors and publishers know that Reader's Legacy is there for them.  They will thank you, as they are all starving for more exposure for their books and an alternative to the status quo.If you contribute you will be helping to build the world's largest community of readers & authors.  For contributors, your page will be marked with a special insignia to note your willingness to help.


ALL Indiegogo contributors will have a special recognition badge on their personal page that will say:  I love books & helped Reader's Legacy Through Indiegogo!
Books are cool & so are the people who read them!
People who love books, love to have
books around them. We have created a community where people can create a digital legacy of their books. On
ReadersLegacy.com, every book in the world has a page, every author has a page,
every publisher has a page, and everyone who loves books has a page.
This is the first chance for an avid reader to create a virtual version of their home library!

(Every single person who contributes, with a minimum contribution of 
$10, to our campaign will be entered into a random drawing for the 
following prizes:Grand Prize:  Trip for 2 to Las Vegas  for the 
2nd annual RCLA, June 4-6 2016 (flights in continental USA, Hotel for 3 
days and tickets to the Readers Legacy Choice Awards), 2nd prize:  1 
million Litcoins to buy books for a year, 3rd prize:  NYT Bestselling 
monthly book subscription for a year)



A Virtual Home Library


Reader’s Legacy is a place where book lovers
can preserve the intimate relationships they have built over the years with
their books. The same books that taught them invaluable lessons, lifted them
out of dark times, transported them to places they could only dream about --
those same books hold deep value, both tangible and sentimental.
We are an online community where people who
love to read can come together -- the world’s largest bookclub, in a sense.
Independent authors will rely upon Reader’s
Legacy to promote their books and make more sales. Reading enthusiasts will
flock to our website for the chance to socialize with other readers and with
their favorite authors, and to build up their Litcoin™ accounts.
All users love the familiarity of
ReadersLegacy.com. We are built using the same technology as both Amazon and
Facebook, creating an enjoyable experience discussing and discovering books on
https://ReadersLegacy.com.
Our founder, Ken Dunn, recounts how it all started!



The team at Reader's Legacy are all authors and avid readers.  We have created the ultimate experience for those people who truly love books and those who write them.  The entire world of books is in the middle of the largest change in history - virtualization.  For many, the change has not been easy, for others it presents opportunity!
Now you can create a free account, build a virtual version of your home library and the books you love, connect with readers around the world and earn Litcoins to use on your next book purchase.  Here are some more details on what is waiting for you:
(after this, we will introduce you to our team and tell you how you can help)





Users of ReadersLegacy.com can
create a free account and use our smartphone app to scan the barcodes of every
book you’ve ever read. Those books then show up in your virtual bookshelf,
preserving your legacy. We also built in a search feature on the website
to find books and add them to your collection.



When books get added to your
bookshelf on ReadersLegacy.com, they aren’t the actual books themselves, but
advertorial pages of the books. These pages contain a picture of the book
cover, the author’s name, other works by that author, a trailer video of the
book, and thousands of comments by fellow lovers of that book, who are all
registered users of Reader’s Legacy.
With all this information at your fingertips, you would come across a
treasure trove of new book recommendations, either by the same author or
another user saying, “If you love this book, I know you’ll also love ____.”
In turn, you could also add your own notes and help your fellow book lovers
find new books, or even make sense of a specific passage or chapter in that
book.

As part of the world’s largest book
club, a mashup of Facebook, Amazon, GoodReads and Lulu, users also have the
ability to follow their favorite authors, publishers, and of course, their
friends and colleagues.
So, for example, you could be on Reader’s Legacy one day and see in your
feed that a respected colleague, or maybe even just a friend who you know loves
the same types of books as you, just added a new book to their library. You’ve
never heard of this book but, trusting in this person’s tastes and judgement,
decide to check it out knowing it must be a good read.

story:
background story.

Hello!  We are Texas Keeper Cider, made up of Nick Doughty, Brandon Wilde, and Lindsey Peebles, along with a slew of family and friends who help make things run.  We make small batch, artisanal ciders in Manchaca (far south Austin), Texas.  

All of our ciders are full strength and made from 100% pressed apples.  We believe in transparency, and letting you know exactly what you are drinking.  Our apples are sourced from small orchardists with whom we have a personal relationship and who share our values as a company.  

We've been slinging cider for a little over a year now.  You can find our ciders all over Austin and also now in Houston, San Antonio, and the Dallas-Fort Worth areas.  

the cidery's next adventure.

Check out this gem of land that our little cidery sits on.  Standing out here you wouldn't know it, but we're a mere 14 miles from the state capitol.  We want you to come out and see it!  

Just some of what you can look forward to when we open up to the public:

  • Right next to our cellar sits an old stone farmhouse that we've just started restoring.  It was once a schoolhouse, but for decades has sat vacant.  This will be our taproom.  Behind the bar we'll serve our own ciders, for the first time on draught, plus a handpicked selection of our favorite ciders from around the world.  We want the Cidery to be a place for you to explore the crazy, varied world of cider.  We'll also serve meads and wines, with special focus on the growing Texas wine industry.  
  • We personally think our ciders are at their best alongside a great meal, so we'll be offering snack plates made up of local craft foods (cheeses, charcuterie, jams, breads, etc.) AND we'll have a local chef out each weekend to prepare meals that pair great with cider.

  • Outside, lounge under the live oaks on the stone patio or out in the field, or wander around the grounds with a cold one.  In opening the land to the public, we're helping to preserve an old piece of undeveloped country amidst a part of Austin that's seen immense change in recent years.

  • Since we'll be selling ciders directly to the public, we'll have more flexibility to try out micro-batches exclusively available on-site ...and we have a lot of ideas fermenting 

  • In addition to normal taproom hours on the weekend, we'll regularly open up the Cidery for additional special events like food and cider dinners, agricultural and food preservation workshops, and movie nights.  


not just a place to drink cider. 

Since the start of Texas Keeper, we dove headfirst into the incredible Central Texas food and farming community.  As a wholesaler, we try to take advantage of every opportunity that comes our way to support local food artisans, farms, and agricultural nonprofits by donating our time and cider to fundraisers and other events.  We've worked with Antonelli's and Epicerie to pair cheese and cider, several chefs to host cider and food pairings out at the cidery, including a fundraiser for Greengate Farms due to damages they sustained from the May flooding.  We've supported events benefiting Slow Food Austin, Farmshare, East Austin Urban Farms, and the Austin Fermentation Festival benefiting Central Texas farmers and ranchers.  

Supporting local small businesses and helping people to connect with their food system are both integral parts of our mission.  With the Cidery open to the public, we can expand on this community support, as a great opportunity to host tons of events and fundraisers on-site.   

the challenges.

So far we have managed to rely on our own doggedness and the support of friends and family to get Texas Keeper off the ground.  We're pretty chuffed with ourselves for setting out goals in our initial business plan and sticking to them, and from learning from the past two years of startup and then sales.  

Now, the taproom is the next step.  While "DIYing" will continue to help us keep costs down, we'll need to raise funds for a few things out here that we can't do ourselves or that we have to purchase.
Such as:
  • We need a cool sign along the road so people know we're here! 
  • We need to build tables and chairs, a bar, and our draught system 
  • We need to rewire much of the old farmhouse
  • We need to do some roof repair 
  • We are putting in a brand-spanking-new septic system (woo hoo!) 
  • We're refurbishing the old market garden and chicken coop to supply produce to the Cidery 
  • We're getting bees!!!  This spring we'll add 6 hives, harvesting the honey ourselves to make our own cyser (a honey and cider fermented beverage). 

Plus a variety of other bits and bobs we'll need to purchase - glassware, furniture, lighting, paint, etc. - all the little things that'll make the place even cooler than it already is.

we don't just want your money.

Hey, some people just can't contribute in dollars, but that doesn't mean we couldn't use your help!  First, helping us get the word out about our taproom campaign would be hugely useful.  Like us, share our posts on Facebook, instagram, Twitter, etc.  Tell people about us.  If you have any great ideas for the Cidery, we're all ears.  Shoot, just buying our cider helps (not to mention the perk therein for you!).

Also, we'll be holding a couple of workdays out at the Cidery in the next couple of months so if you have a spare Saturday morning, give us a shout.   Specifically, we'll need any willing participants to help clean up the little family cemetery on the property, build tables and benches, and to clean out the vegetable garden to get ready for planting.  We promise to make it worth your while (read: we will pay you in cider and breakfast tacos)!

Check out the great perks on the side.  Thanks to everyone who has gotten us this far, and we thank you all in advance for your continued support.  Can't wait to see y'all out here!

story:
What is SITE: Students In Their Element™?

SITE™ is a web series which serves as a platform for students to showcase their work and innermost drive. It is too easy for student efforts to go unnoticed outside the classroom setting. They need a widely-accessible platform to share their work, and the SITE™ series provides that efficient space. SITE™ advocates personal growth and expression; not only does it capture the products of student drive, but it highlights their inspirations, their histories and their contributions to society. Bringing these values into focus gives students the exposure they need.

Plans for SITE™

My next step is to turn this project into a business. SITE™ is currently a trademark-pending brand which I will be implementing into schools across the country and internationally. I captured 15 remarkable students at Bennington College. Imagine the amount of work that will be recognized and the number of stories that will unfold when SITE™ expands!

Who Benefits from SITE™?

  • Admitted students
  • Perspective students
  • Parents
  • Guidance counselors
  • Grant/scholarship programs
  • Employers

Become a SITE™ Sponsor!

I need YOUR help to expand this brand! SITE™ needs money for:

  • The website and platform to host the series
  • Travel expenses
  • Company finances from music and graphics, to film equipment 
  • SITE™ intern

What is this internship? I will be giving back to the school that gave me the room to establish this series. Every year, Bennington College students are required to complete Field Work Term; a 7-week internship of their choosing. I have created a unique internship opportunity for one Bennington student this coming January, to work hands-on with SITE™. Your contributions would sponsor meals and city transportation for the student. 

When you invest in SITE™, I invest in YOU! I have a variety of perks available for your generous donations. Check ‘em out to your right!

Spread the Word!

If you are unable to contribute, you can still help! Please “like” the Facebook page, follow on Instagram and share this campaign with your friends. Together, we can put SITE™ on the map. Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
What is SITE: Students In Their Element™? 
SITE™ is a web series which serves as a platform for students to showcase their work and innermost drive. It is too easy for student efforts to go unnoticed outside the classroom setting. They need a widely-accessible platform to share their work, and the SITE™ series provides that efficient space. SITE™ advocates personal growth and expression; not only does it capture the products of student drive, but it highlights their inspirations, their histories and their contributions to society. Bringing these values into focus gives students the exposure they need.
   
Plans for SITE™
 
My next step is to turn this project into a business. SITE™ is currently a trademark-pending brand which I will be implementing into schools across the country and internationally. I captured 15 remarkable students at Bennington College. Imagine the amount of work that will be recognized and the number of stories that will unfold when SITE™ expands!   Who Benefits from SITE™?  Admitted students Perspective students Parents
Guidance counselors
Grant/scholarship programs

story:
Hi, my name is Diana Salvatierra Cedeño I'm 24 years old I am a very passionate woman with my ideas and give 100% of me when I want to succeed in something.

I come from a very humble family live in the countryside and from there I always supported to move forward with effort and hard work, my studies performed away from my parents, lived alone for 12 years and now I have a degree in physics and mathematics, always I dreamed of having my economic independence and so to support my parents and siblings (3 brothers).

Business, numbers, service and solidarity are my passions and I think it is the ideal place to come, with my decision, delivery and insurance support will be time well.

 

My business idea is based on providing a food service, specifically in sweet store (eggnog, delicacy, piononos, salprieta, cheese, and assorted sweets) and cafeteria, this is accepted in my country and I want to take this opportunity, also in my local I will have a good space where my clients will have the ability to meet with their loved ones and delight of the products.

 

With your help I can get one of my biggest dreams and unite my passions, my service to the most needy people and gain independence.

By becoming my support for will also be contributing indirectly to the people in my province who have lost everything after the earthquake that affected the Ecuador and with greater magnitude Manabi, because once you achieve accomplish my goal of having my business I will bring with 5% of my earnings and will only be able to achieve this with your help.

There is nothing better than feeling the satisfaction of helping the most needy is why I want to succeed and get ahead.

I will be deeply grateful to each of my collaborators. Thank you.

 

To start my business I need $ 15,000 now step detail each step that will be invested this amount. - Local (Adecuacion, lease and warranty) $ 8,000 - Products $ 4000 - Equipment to keep products in good condition (bitrinas, freezers) $ 2,000 - Contingencies (documentation for the operation of the premises without any legal problem) $ 1,000 All these values ​​and data were verified in the city of Guayaquil where will be located the business is worth mentioning that also work with social networks and web site where we also receive orders and our customers can buy online, offering home delivery, if you require it. For persons who want to support me in my dream brought to reality. The rewards we receive our patrocinadores will be chosen by themselves within four options that we will present:

 1. Straw hats clearly identifying our store is the Weaver Manabita. 2.- Shirts emblazoned with the logo of the store, this will be of high quality and very nice. 3. Consumer Cards valued at $ 50.00, will have the freedom to choose the product most attractive and taste for each contributor 4. In our mural highlighting tend have people that were and will be part of our progress and reality, there stand out each of the people who were part of the fulfillment of my dreams 5. Gifts Souvenirs (glasses keychains, pens , calendars , etc.) with our logo printed.

 

For the tranquility of each of the people who believe in my business and in my desire to get ahead I want to make clear that if alguan reason profit not get by this means my economic capital required will not stay with crossed arms, ie what here get what I 'll use to implement business and if I needed some balance buscare other options but never give me.

My project will be very beneficial both for me as a person, also for those who decide to support me because we will be contributing to a noble cause, boosting the economy in Ecuador after the earthquake, helping to professional growth and create jobs to those without.  Items will bid in my business are made in Manabi province where he was most affected by the earthquake thus help revive the economy and also will bring with 5% of the profit from the store fundadciones engaged in ayduar to children orphaned. This helps us a lot for our peace as people and our spirit of solidarity. There is nothing better than being part of the solution of the problems affecting the most vulnerable and débilies.


In a business there are always risks but it depends on our desire and decision to move forward victoriously; debilityes.- We are a new company and we have to work hard to earn our customers loyalty, informal vendors who are dedicated to sell some of our products lowering prices, but all these weaknesses can be conbatidas. Desire to undertake and commitment to achieve financial independence, unmatched product quality, national recognition of Manabi products Migration manabitas to Guayaquil where we will place the store, door-to-door, Web Presence applying innovative strategies, a local very nice and cozy where you could share beautiful moments with family and friends.  We have the opportunity to be the first recognized brand that bid manabitas products, competition has no presence on the web offering Manabi products and this will be our advantage field, Guayaquileños people are supporting greatly to Manabi, buying their products for what happened in 16A.

In the Ecuador, Guayaquil is the number one productive business, many people makes business grow fast , in our case the manabitas traditions are much loved throughout the country and in this city there are many Manabi .


The quality of our products is great and punctuality that characterizes us make a perfect combination  of success.

The tools for sharing Indiegogo , is very good , use it for my campaign share and you're coming up.

story:
We Have a Dream

My name is Minda. My partner is Mandi, and together we own a whimsical, creative shop, called Distorted Utopia. We started out by finding we were more creative than we ever realized, and putting together a small shop. Over time, we have met people on this road, and found out that a lot of people share the same dream. We've met people who create things and want to connect with the people who appreciate what they can do. It's not only about money. There is a sense of accomplishment and sometimes wonder, when you find someone who loves your work, not to mention a huge boost in confidence.  In Springfield, MO, there isn't a lot of opportunity, and often, people lack the confidence, the financial backing, or the willingness to venture out and start a small business. Having done it, we do know the pitfalls and frustrations that come with business ownership. We also know the sense of accomplishment with each small victory. 

We have had some events, attended others, and have met amazing artists, authors, makers, and creators. They are good at what they do, the people attending admire their work, and are happy to help them succeed, both with financial support, and a strong cheering section. I love their work too, and have found many times I wish I could do what they do, but lack time or money to learn how to do it, and hear other people say the same thing. But, I want what they made. I want to own it, to show it off, to take it home and be inspired by it. We have people tell us all the time, how much they love this artist, or that maker, or another creation they've seen.

We decided to grow our own business, hoping to have time to be more creative. That's a great goal, but it just didn't seem like enough. Knowing the people we do, the response we've seen, and feeling a strong desire to help other people reach their goals, we knew we were meant to do more. We can bring the artists together, under one roof, with a beautiful space, a snack area, fun, creative events, and grow our business, as well as help them. We can help them connect with the community, inspire others, and I would dare say, help the artistic community in Springfield gain even more of the attention it deserves. Heck, we'll even have a space for classes and table gaming, to bring even more people together. We just know we need some support from you.

What We Need & What You Get

This move will be what we need, in order to keep growing, and sharing opportunities with other creative people! 

  • Our goal is to raise $15,000, in order to fund our move. We will use the money as deposits on the new building, shelving and display cases for the other merchants, advertising, signs, tables and chairs for the snack area, and a security system. 

  • Our perks range from a downloadable poster of the original Creatopia, to an invitation to exclusive opening night party with the artists. There are cookies, naming a baked good, and even a cool steampunk lamp up for grabs. See our list of perks to find one that speaks to your inner Geek, steampunk, or even your heart.

  • If we don't raise the entire amount, we will use what we do get, to start small at the new place. We hope to not have to take out any loans, so we can stay debt free.

You can make such a huge impact, even with a small contribution. 

  • The more I read about artistic collectives, the more benefits I see to the community as a whole. Tourism is pretty good in this area, and this venue has potential to increase that even more. By having creative items for display and sale, people will become inspired, and can even learn how to do some of it, by taking the classes our makers will give. If you can inspire passion for the arts, you can change lives.
  • Our biggest event to date was called "Creatopia". We invited local artists, makers, authors, and creative types to set up a booth in our current shop. The event was short, just a few hours, but the shop was full. People were excited. Watching social media light it up was a huge thrill. The Springfield Newsleader and KOLR 10 showed up unexpectedly. We already have makers asking for more events, and more spaces. We had artists we couldn't fit into our shop. There is no doubt that this is a needed place for the artistic community, and the people who appreciate it.
  • We started out with just a small corner full of things at our shop last year. We have grown our inventory multiple times over. We're pretty proud of that, but it pales in comparison to the friends we have made. Since we attend local events, we meet people who support us, and are cheering for our success too. We've made some great connections, and love to bring those people together, so they can cheer for each other. We are not ready to stop.

We're Doing This

  • As I said, we started out small. I mean VERY small. We're still pretty small. But we have grown, by using experiences and setting goals. We listen to what our customers want, and work hard to make them happy. We have struggled with growing our business, due in part to our current location. We love where we are, and value our current neighborhood and its residents,  but feel that there just isn't enough traffic to the area to maintain the growth we need in order to stay in business. We're not going to throw in the towel because of this. We have monitored traffic at both the current and the new location, and see a huge difference. We study metrics, watch trends, and ask everyone we talk to about what they know that could help. Our goal is to not only make a living (finally taking a pay check), but to prosper, and develop this business into a hub of creative effort, for everyone involved.
  • We have a location chosen, and are ready to charge ahead. It's close to the square, on the route for First Friday Art Walk, and is absolutely stunning. There are large display windows, hardwood floors, tin ceilings, and so much character. It's large enough for everything we hope to do: our shop, our creative collective, a bakery and snack shop, classes, events, and table top gaming. We want people to walk in and be wowed. Someone compared what we are doing to Etsy, in person. We want the best of Etsy, mixed with Pinterest, and a lot of whimsy and eclectic handwork thrown in. And cake. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. You can help still help.

  • Tell everyone you know, and maybe those you don't about this idea. 
  • Share us on social media, and email, or use the tools Indegogo provides.

story:
TRIBE Z = Sustainable FREEDOM

Tribe Z is enabling and inspiring youths worldwide to connect with their community via creative solutions to connect, inspire and co-create. Youth will connect with their community via cultural understandings; a creative motif to encapsulate their shared vision. The inspiration of the community's shared vision will activate collaborations for sustainable development. Our co-creations will empower the community to regenerate with the youths towards sustainable living and wellbeing.

Currently, Tribe Z is empowering youths from around the world to be engaged in recognizing and preserving their cultural motif through jewelry designing & 3D printing. Each of the jewelry pieces will use these traditional motifs or patterns in the design. This will enable the youth’s creativity and ability to share their culture with other youths, while also funding their trips to environmental conferences worldwide and/or their sustainable projects in their community, thereby creating a sustainable freedom for the youth, which you can be a part of.

We want to inspire youth leaders from around the world by having them connect with their community to share their vision. Then they can leverage the community in being stakeholders of their sustainable vision to regenerate solutions for optimum outcomes—economic and social solutions, and environmental wellbeing.

In this process, they can share their cultural motifs through 3D Printing & jewelry design from their community (and/or country) with other youths around the world at our upcoming conference, see below for more information.


Our Mission:  

  • Connect to & empower the youths.
  • Inspire the youths with step by step process of Tribe Z for connecting with the community. 
  • Have the youths Co-Create a design (cultural motif) with Us, Tribe Z & their community based on their vision.
  • Fund youth trips worldwide to environmental youth conferences and/or sustainable projects in their community.
  • SUSTAINABLE FREEDOM!


Where does the Money go?

We are asking for $5,000 USD to go towards our project, Tribe Z, which will fund today's youths who want to make a difference, enabling them to go to international environmental conferences and begin their own sustainable projects in their community. Your donation will go towards; a new 3D Printer, our website, and to the children's 3D Design & Printing.


What do you Get? 

Besides the joy of helping todays children & their future, you can also choose one of our perks if you donate a certain amount. Below you can see our perks available that represents our mission;


Batik Kawung Bracelet - $50 Donation

Kawung is a kind of coconut tree & a cultural motif from Bali, Indonesia. All of the kawung’s materials are used, showing that everything/everyone is useful in it’s own way. It also represents connecting with nature, and it’s deep connection with us. That is why our ancestors made this into a cultural motif.




Batik Kawung Cuff - Silver - $100 Donation

Kawung is a kind of coconut tree & a cultural motif from Bali, Indonesia. All of the kawung’s materials are used, showing that everything/everyone is useful in it’s own way. It also represents connecting with nature, and it’s deep connection with us. That is why our ancestors made this into a cultural motif.


Batik Kawung Cuff - Gold - $180 Donation

Kawung is a kind of coconut tree & a cultural motif from Bali, Indonesia. All of the kawung’s materials are used, showing that everything/everyone is useful in it’s own way. It also represents connecting with nature, and it’s deep connection with us. That is why our ancestors made this into a cultural motif.


Our Upcoming Event: 

Our Upcoming event is with AYLA - Indonesia, "The ASEAN+ Childrens Festival". It will be held in Bali, Indonesia from the 15th-18th of December, 2016, for Children aged 14-17 years old. For more information you can go to www.aseanchildrenfestival.com 


Other Ways you can help:

You can share this fundraiser with all of your friends & family. You can also share our upcoming event with children aged 14-17 years old, along with their parents.

story:
WHO ARE WE?:

Capitol Guitars is a 100% independent guitar store in Saint Paul, Minnesota offering guitars, basses, amps, accessories, repairs, and lessons.

FIRST LOCATION

For those of you who don't already know us, we are just a couple of guys (Billy Bergeron and Eric Berg), bandmates who had a crazy idea to open a guitar store back in 2004. We scraped together every penny we could and opened our first tiny 600 square foot store on St. Peter street in downtown St. Paul. We managed to keep that going for 6 years until we were ready for something bigger....

SECOND (CURRENT) LOCATION

We love our current spot here on East 7th in booming Lowertown St. Paul. Since we moved here business has been great and we have even been able to hire several employees (thanks Tom, Tay, Brad, & Steve). The problem is that the area we helped grow and nurture is pricing us out! Rent has increased 20% a year for 3 years in a row and we don't see any sign of it stopping. As you locals know parking can be a bit of a pain too. Which brings us to....

THE NEW (AND FINAL!) CAPITOL GUITARS LOCATION

We have searched long and hard to find a suitable spot for our baby (this business is definitely that important to us!). We have finally found it. 644 Selby Avenue in the up and coming Cathedral Hill neighborhood still right here in St. Paul. This area is growing even faster than lowertown, but this time we will be the proud owners of the building and will actual be able to control our own rent and keep costs down.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's where you all come in. We have the downpayment and can afford the mortgage, but this place needs A LOT of work! $56,380 just to get it up to code. That doesn't even build a single wall or put a stitch of carpet on the floor. It will take about another $45k to turn it into guitar store.

We are offering you a number of very limited, very cool items and services to strum up some cash. Even a First Avenue style star laden wall-of -fame that will permanently showcase our most loyal supporters. Please keep in mind that we are paying for all these items from our vendors so the money we raise is far from all profit. Not a problem though - we didn't want to beg for the money. We want everyone to get something in return.

                    

 

You all know how much we love to offer great deals to our customers so please help us get this new improved store off the ground so we can do it for many many more years to come. 

We will also have enough space to do rock camp style group lessons and many other amazing new things.

Oh yeah and did we mention....TONS OF FREE PARKING!!!

The Impact

We want to help revitalize this long neglected area of Saint Paul. There are already tons of really cool restaurants and shops that have recently moved in the neighborhood and we want to be part of the excitement. Also - if we are able keep costs down by avoiding rent increases we will be able to pass the savings along to our customers (you know we like to make deals!) and hire more employees.

Risks & Challenges

We know that prepping and opening a new store is an incredible challenge.  We have done it twice already and have grown our business successfully with each move. With any move there is a great risk of losing some of your core customer base, but we sincerely hope you will all visit us at our new location. Remember it's only a couple miles away!

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that not everyone will be able to contribute financially. All we ask is that you PLEASE pass this along to anyone and everyone you know that might be interested. And if nothing else, just drop us a message or stop in and say hi. A little encouragement helps us immensely too!

Thanks so much for reading. We can't wait to see this latest chapter of Capitol Guitars unfold!

story:
Short Summary

We're called simply The Store due to a slip of the tongue to the newspaper.  Our full name is Nu-Beginning Farm: The Store, but we'll answer to many things!

  • Nu-Beginning Farm was born in 2003 at the Verona farmers' market with 2 card tables and a box of surplus vegetables in the trunk of the car.  Our first day sales were a staggering $26.25 and a business was born!  From vegetables we expanded to baked goods, jams, pickles and soaps, then to an intern program with James Madison University, to private interns, to homestead classes to the oldest CSA program in Augusta County.  We make it a habit of building on our past successes and helping others succeed along the way.  In high tide all boats float!
  • We opened our brick & mortar business December 1, 2012 and from day one have tried to give back to the community that has so strongly supported us and our mission. Over the last 4 years at our current location we've grown to the point of bursting at the seams. We've looked longingly across the alley at that nice big empty building behind us, that would allow us to have a real kitchen (rather than our current counter top appliances, hot plates and popping breakers). We finally decided to find the landlord, and did a LARGE amount of research, number crunching, praying, and stressing in a short amount of time. We signed a lease June 1 and started our journey! We'll be able to expand our grocery selection, seat more people in the cafe, and be a real home for local food, art, authors, musicians and actors.  Everything local under one roof...yeah, we can do that!  
  • It is said that it takes a village to raise a child, well, it takes a group of people wanting to make a difference in order to build that village.  That's the group we want to be in! 
  • Nu-Beginning lives by the Rule Trifecta of "Speak the Truth, Do the Right Thing, and Take Up for Yourself."  We have always kept our wonderful team and outstanding customers in the loop of knowledge of what's happening...good or bad.  We're doing the same thing now!  We want to move. We need to, in order to grow properly.  
  • We've got a great contractor heading up the build-out but all this takes money...and a lot of it. We've applied for and received a line of credit through F&M Bank here in Staunton and this is great to cover much of the construction and equipment, but not all of it.  We have a LOT of work to do, and NEED your help! The goals we've set will be tiered to accomplish various levels in case you don't love us as much as we think and we don't make our final goal. 
  • We hope you'll believe in our project as much as we do!  We think we have a really cool place that can make a difference in the world and provide a living for our team.  Lots of folks like what we do, check us out Tripadvisor and Yelp!  It hasn't been easy to get to this point and it certainly won't be easy to get to the next level, but we're not afraid of hard work, we do our research before we act and we can overcome any obstacle that falls in our path.  We ask you to take the journey with us!  Be a part of our success and the magic we create.  Be part of our family! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're moving to a great building but we can't do it without your support!

  • We want to raise $100,000 through crowd sourcing to help us move and get needed equipment, as well as some added stability!
  • Among the needed items are an upgraded register system with a multi-station touch screen POS (point of sale) system. This will allow us to run the grocery and restaurant smoother, let the servers fire tickets directly to the kitchen and monitor inventory, bookkeeping, schedules and operations more accurately. A large capacity ice maker and a commercial dishwasher are next on the list. We'd like to install house lights and sound system to help our artists and performers. Any money left over after that will be used to beautify the garden area, pay down some of the debt, and put some away in a rainy day fund to help cover payroll. The move will take our staffing levels from 15 to about 40! 
  • Our perks are set up to be both practical and fun! We have a unique team, with an interesting view of the world, and we'd love you to be a part of it! (Check out the application to join our Zombie Apocalypse team!) It's what makes people love us!  It's what make people describe The Store as "magical"!

The Impact

  • By helping our campaign you're helping the community, not just a single business. We're embedded in our community and they're emotionally invested in us! When's the last time a store offered to hold a tab because you forgot you wallet? We do! When's the last time you felt like you were on Cheers! because everyone knows your name? We do! When's the last time you heard of a store telling a husband to call his wife before making a certain purchase because she was in this morning buying the same thing?  We do! Do we sound normal to you? Imagine the impact we can have in a larger building! Imagine the stories you'll have to tell by being a part of the zany group that treats people like...well...people! We feed people. We have fun. We respect each other.   
  • We ask you to join our campaign and share the fun, the smiles and the ungodly amount of puns that run rampant daily!  

Risks & Challenges

What we're doing is a HUGE risk!  We're moving from 850 sq ft to 4000!!  We're keeping our current space until at least the end of the lease in December 2017 so we're massively increasing our monthly expenses.  So, what's the good news?  We're increasing our seating capacity from 15 to 75 inside and from 8 to 30 outside.  We're nearly tripling our retail space.  We're adding venues from the arts that will grow our customer base.  We're adding a garden to allow us to be the city's first in house farm to table!  These are challenging endeavors, but we have the people to get it done, especially if you join us!

  • Nu-Beginning is headed up by some super hard working people.  John and Stella started the company with John having a background in restaurants for nearly 37 years and restaurant management for nearly 25 years.  Stella has a background in accounting for better than 25 years.  Gillian brings over 20 years food service experience and a dedication to success that's unmatched.  The team we've assembled seems like a motley crew from the outside but collectively is a force to be reckoned with!  The combined talents and skills cover nearly all aspects of the working world.  Together we don't think anything other than positive and successful thoughts.
  • Collectively we don't give up or give in, we don't settle for second best or second place and that applies to customer service, quality of product and intregrity of our vendors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Every customer counts, no matter what you spend or if you spend. We absolutely do not want you to put you or your family in a financial bind by donating! If you can afford something we'll spend it and be grateful for it!  If you can't afford something we'll be grateful that you familiarized yourself with our project and shared the campaign with someone else...and we'll spend their money! 

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  Tell your Facebook friends, church members, family...you can even tell that guy on the corner!  He probably comes in for coffee anyway!
  • Check our Facebook page (look for Nu-Beginning Farm) for upcoming Sweat-Equity Events, like helping to get the garden going, painting or moving equipment in!
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Let's make this campaign a success with the 3 Ms...money, mouths and momentum!  Now who's with us?

And that's all we've got to say about that.
