story:
In 2012, Detroit was labeled a "food desert." For years, residents throughout the city had little to no options to turn to for fresh, healthy food.  Prices were high, quality was exceptionally low.  Many looked towards their nearest gas stations and convenience stores to meet their daily dietary needs, and the fact of the matter is, many of them still do. 

Unfortunately, for grocers like us that want to provide better food options, access to quality refrigeration often stands in our way. Without refrigeration, there can be no produce, no dairy or eggs, and certainly no meat!  Refrigeration is one, if not our single biggest necessity.  

But it is also our greatest cost...

We are Rohani Foulkes and Kiki Louya—two women who share a passion for food, farming and community.  Together, we own The Farmer’s Hand, an artisanal Pantry, Market and Kitchen, and with you support, we hope to open our doors in Detroit, Michigan this fall!

As you probably know, Detroit is the automotive capital of the world, the birthplace of Motown, and we, at The Farmer’s Hand, feel very fortunate to consider our home to be historic Corktown, the city’s oldest neighborhood. 

But did you also know that Detroit is a national leader in urban farming? 

In fact, the State of Michigan ranks #2 in the country for agricultural diversity!  So, why is it that our groceries travel an average of 1500 miles before reaching our plates?

At The Farmer’s Hand, we believe a healthy food system starts at home, and we are committed to providing a dedicated neighborhood platform for the purchase of 100% locally grown and produced goods every day and all year-round.  But we cannot do it without your help!  

A breakdown of our refrigeration needs are below:

2-Door Cooler $3,037.20
Multi-Deck Cooler $5,467.68
Deli Service Case $7,190.45
Glass Door Freezer $4,424.95
Undercounter Freezer $1,997.63
Freight Cost: $50.00
Delivery & Installation: $3,500
Tax:  $1,330.07
TOTAL: $26,997.98

Why We Need Your Help

Ask any grocery what they cannot live without, and the answer would be the same: refrigeration.  

Without refrigeration, there can be no produce, no dairy or eggs, and certainly no meat!  Refrigeration is one, if not our single biggest necessity.  But it is also our greatest cost. 

Helping Your Dollars Make a Difference

On average, when selling their products at large retailers like Krogers, Meijers and Whole Foods, farmers and other food producers only receive 17 cents for every dollar sold.  To further compound this issue, chain buyers look for volume and small-scale food businesses have a hard time meeting demand. 

We, at The Farmer’s Hand, recognize these roadblocks and, as a result, we have adopted a business model that has not only proven successful for Argus Farm Stop (Ann Arbor, MI) and Local Roots (Wooster, OH), but that levels the playing field. 

Like Argus and Local Roots, we will provide an accessible and convenient venue for Michigan growers and producers to sell their products, retain their identity and earn a living wage with 70 cents of every dollar sold going directly back to their pockets!  This model has worked so well in the last year that Argus Farm Stop was able to return nearly $1 million back to farms throughout Michigan in 2015 alone!

So, a donation to The Farmer’s Hand goes far beyond the refrigeration in our store. 

It is a donation towards the livelihood of our food partners, which include over 100 small-to-mid-sized Michigan farms and food operations, many of which are family-owned and located in the City of Detroit. 

In return, we have a few cool items we would like to offer you as a token of our appreciation.  You can check out our donation options at the right of this page.  Also, if you can’t contribute, we definitely understand and hope you will share this with your friends, family and colleagues! 

Thank you for your support, and please come visit us soon! 

1701 Trumbull, Detroit, MI 48216.

Locally yours,

Rohani and Kiki

story:
About Me

I work at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in NYC as a part of an incredible administrative team supporting some world class scientists. I hope to get my Masters in Public Health to continue advancing my career, but unfortunately money is not in my favor. Between student loans and living expenses, I am in a bind. By signing up as an independent fashion consultant with LuLaRoe, I will be able to:

  • Pay off my student loans from undergrad
  • Go back to school for my Masters degree
  • Help support my partner in getting him the necessary surgery and treatment he needs for a recently diagnosed condition that causes infertility 
  • Support myself and my family living in NYC
And if I'm extra lucky, I may be able to help my partner get back to school to finish his Bachelors degree since he will be helping me behind the scenes on this venture.

Why LuLaRoe

LuLaRoe provides real clothing for real people. Their styles are versatile, comfortable, and appropriate for work or play as they are both modest and fun. LuLaRoe is unique and fosters an environment conducive to growth between all consultants worldwide harboring customers of all bodytypes! Best of all, LuLaRoe was started by a woman and her family and the importance of family and community is stressed every step of the way. 

Some reasons I have chosen to support LuLaRoe in my personal life and now professional life:

  • Clothing is designed for people of all bodies- from 00 - 22 (with wiggle room in either direction, and in between!)
  • Patterns are unique with only approximately 2000 articles of clothing made from any one material. Ever. This means that if you see something, you may be the only one in your area to wear it nonetheless know it exists! 
  • Necklines on shirts and dresses and lengths on skirts and dresses are modest enough for work but not frumpy, which means you can wear the same comfortable outfit to work and then out again at night!
  • LuLaRoe supports its consultants and has a community that is warm and inviting. Between giveaways and webinars, the company and its consultants are proud to be involved!

How This Campaign Works

This campaign is to help me afford the initial startup package of inventory (~  500 pieces of clothing) , accessories such as lighting supplies, mannequins, backdrops, etc., packaging supplies, and printed supplies like business cards.

Instead of asking for money without offering rewards, I have chosen to use this IndieGoGo campaign as a means of pre-selling my initial inventory. Should you choose to donate to my campaign, once I get my initial inventory you will:

  • ...be added to a private Facebook group accessible ONLY to those who donate - a VIP group!
  • ...have first choice at any of the items I receive at the price point you donated for (eg: donate enough for a pair of leggings? you can choose whichever pair of leggings you would like!)
  • ...get free shipping on your pre-ordered purchase! Perk prices indicate the cost of the item with NYC sales tax, but shipping will be free for pre-orders. Normally, shipping is $3 for one item, $6 for 2 or more, and free for orders over $75.
  • ...get a random coupon for your purchases at my official launch party which will happen after my VIPs make their choices
Essentially, you are pre-buying inventory you would have chosen anyway so you loose nothing! If you don't like anything from my initial inventory, you can roll over your VIP privleges to the next shipment of inventory I receive.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that you may not be interested in shopping right now or money may be tight. Please, share my Facebook group or promote my campaign since any little bit helps! This is the first step to being able to afford my dreams.

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/LLRYessie
  • Periscope: @LLRYessie

Want to Earn Free Clothes?

I can host a pop-up party for you and your friends at home or online! The more friends you get to attend your party and the more purchases they make, the more free stuff YOU can earn. 

What Happens If I Don't Meet My Goal?

Should I not raise the money indicated in my IndieGoGo, don't fret! This simply means that I will need to take out a bigger loan or more money on a credit card. If for whatever reason I am unable to sign up to become a LuLaRoe Independent Fashion Consultant, I will return your money back to you in full. If you are still interested in purchasing clothing at this point, I can point you to some fabulous ladies to purchase from!

story:
Benefits of Computers for Older People

It’s a widely held view that older people are inclined to be technophobes, who don’t want to start learning how to use computers, but actually this view is not entirely true. Many older people are realising just how much they could benefit from having a computer at home. They may still need a little help and support to get up and running with choosing and using a computer, but the rewards will be worth it.

Older people can embrace new technology

Getting Started

The computer needs to suit the person. For some a desktop computer might be the best option, as the mouse is often easier to use than that on a laptop, but a laptop or tablet offer a mobile option. Anyone who is familiar with typewriters might prefer a traditional keyboard, while touch screens might work well for others. Shop around to get the most suitable broadband package, depending on the intended usage.

Everyone needs help with learning the basics. Younger people learn how to use computers at school, but older people won’t have had this opportunity. Older people who did not use a computer during their working life may have acquired little or no knowledge of how to use a computer. Friends or family may be able to get someone started and give them some training. Alternatively there are many beginners computer courses held at local adult education centres.

Benefits

The internet has so much to offer older people, from information about health and lifestyle to hobbies and recipes. There’s easy access to news and weather forecasts at any time, as well as telephone contact details online (who knows the number for directory enquiries these days?)

Shopping

Standing around in queues at checkouts and carrying heavy shopping is no pleasure particularly for older people with limited mobility. A computer gives people the option to order groceries and other shopping to be delivered to their door. Some of the big supermarket chains will even bring your shopping into your kitchen if you wish.

Social Contact

The fastest growing sector on Facebook currently is people aged over 65. Email, Skype and photo sharing are all ideal ways to avoid isolation among older people. Even if family live a long distance away, an older relative can still feel involved in their lives with video calls and regular email exchange.

Maintaining Mental Agility

Distance learning courses are a great way to keep the brain active. Some scientists are even starting to explore the benefits of some computer games in helping to stimulate the mind active for older people.

Forget the old adage about old dogs and new tricks – when it comes to computers older people are showing that they are perfectly capable of becoming computer literate if they want to. A little support from family or friends is all that’s needed to get started.

story:
Three years ago my husband and I had our first son. At first the whole "working mom" thing was working out for us, but after a year of being away from my son and having to decide between starting him in daycare over my grandparents keeping him or staying home with him, it wasn't in our financial interest to send him to daycare. So my Stay-At-Home-Mom journey began. I had to find something to pass my time and I've always been good at and loved crafting. I bought my first embroidery machine and vinyl machine and so the addiction began. I quickly found (at the time) a void in the industry in my area. In order to purchase custom items like I offer, chances are you had to order them online and sometimes wait up to a month to receive them! I started a super small, not really even a business, business and began selling to close friends. Over the last 3 years it's grown to over 500 customers in all parts of the US and even a few in Japan (on the military bases).

With the consistent and unexpected growth of my business, my husband have I decided it's time to take it to the next level and make it "The Real Deal" to allow me to continue staying home with our children; a 3 year old boy and a baby girl born prematurely in June 2016. By doing so, we've found a couple different store locations and we are hoping to be able to select one to turn into our official Carolina Designs Co. Store. We've made it this far with the support of all of our customers and family and now we are hoping to take this even further with the help of you all.

Any donations help, but our goal is at least $2500. With that $2500, we would be able to build an adequate inventory stock as well as revamp up the store space we've found available. Roughly $750 would go towards the painting, shelving and decorating of the store. Another $1000 would go towards building inventory ranging from handmade clothing to boutique style clothing and items and everything in between. It will also be put towards the cost of extra supplies to make the quality, handmade custom items we create to allow customers to be able to walk into the store, custom order an item and walk out with it within minutes. The other $750 and anything over the $2500 would be put used as a safety net for any unexpected fees as well as put into our "Festival Fund" to allow us to set up at different craft festivals and shows across NC (and eventually other states) to expand our business. If everyone could give at least $5 we would be able to reach this goal in no time and have the store up and running just in time for the Christmas season! Who doesn't love personalized, custom Christmas gifts!?

We can't thank you all enough for the constant support and we hope you all are as excited as we are for this bigger adventure!

story:
MOTIVATION AND VISION

Light is life – Sunlight hitting the Earth would be too harsh without the natural lens formed by our planet’s atmosphere. This filters the light and absorbs dangerous rays, turning the Sun into a dynamic source of pleasant light capable of creating infinite shades of colour from red to blue and making life on Earth possible in the first place.

Light is well-being – The discovery in 2002 of a third type of photoreceptor in the human eye proves that our level of well-being is influenced significantly by how much dynamic natural light we consume over the course of a day. On the other hand, artificial man-made light can have a detrimental effect on visual perception and create a “negative environment” in indoor areas that harms our sense of well-being.

Natural-like light – The FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD lighting series uses state-of-the-art technology and the latest scientific knowledge in a quest to create a healthy and pleasant “positive environment”—a major challenge.

 

PERFECT LIGHTING TECHNOLOGY

Thanks to the development of an aspheric lens system and the use of high-power LEDs it was possible to create a 70° beam of light. The operational efficiency of the luminaire is over 80%. These two factors provide the decisive advantage when comparing FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD with conventional LED lighting systems. A conscious decision was taken to avoid the use of diffusers or reflective light direction systems. The result is a lighting system that is extremely efficient thanks to its top-of-the-range electronic components and LEDs as well as its unique optimised lens system which transmits up to 15% more light. Mathematical and physical
calculations, accompanied by a variety of lighting simulations, have made it possible to create the perfect lens system for efficient glass production.

 

Light distribution curve of FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD
5x lenses basic module (5 x 3W LED)
with aspheric lenses shining downwards
1 x 3W LED shining upwards
(ceiling lighting)

 

NATURALLY SUSTAINABLE

Carefully chosen – It seems only logical that natural light demands natural materials. At the same time, we knew that the materials for our advanced lighting system had to be of the highest quality. The solution? Fine wood.

  • Five different types of wood with a neutral energy footprintoffer stylish design and a warm atmosphere
  • Aspheric glass lenses
  • Recyclable cooling element designed to combat heat generation, thereby preserving the LED operating life and keeping the light well below the overheating range at all times
  • Electronic ballast (three-year guarantee) compatible with all electricity networks worldwide
  • Low voltage from the ceiling housing downwards, eliminating danger of high-voltage shocks
  • An easily exchangeable LED circuit board is available if necessary

 

MAXIMUM DURABILITY

FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD has been developed in line with the following certification standards:

  • DIN EN ISO 14040 – Life cycle assessment
  • DIN EN ISO 14044 – Assessment and analysis of the environmental impact of products
  • DIN ISO 15226 – Technical product documentation related to life cycle

Unlike many lighting systems on the market, FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD is not a disposable product. The specially designed cooling system with the black cooling component ensures an operating life of more than 25,000 hours. The entire electric switching and plug system is also designed for maximum durability.

The lighting system is exceptionally efficient, resulting in low energy consumption and significantly reducing costs over the course of its lifetime.

The light can be recycled.

TIMELESS DESIGN

Timeless ideas, such as those formulated by Horatio Greenough on organic principles and those from Louis Henry Sullivan and Walter Gropius on architecture and design, lie at the heart of the modular construction and elegant forms found in FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD.

“Form follows function” as an expression of constructive logic was the driving principle behind this exceptional lighting system. The contours of the aspheric lenses used by FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD are precisely calculated and characterised by simple, natural lines. Their integration into a cellular wooden frame and the precise positioning to the LED light sources create elegant proof of the design rule to which this lighting system aspires: form follows function.

On request, the body made of fine solid wood can be adapted to match the existing interior design.

 

FAQ

Q: What will you do with the funded money?

The funding will be used to get the manufacturing process working in an efficient and streamlined way, ready for mass production.

Q: What does the FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD cost and how do we get one?

The FIFTH AVENUE IN WOOD lighting system is available as a pre-order with best discount through Indiegogo only. Check out the perks to your right!

The retail price will be EUR 799,-

Q. How much is shipping?

We offer free worldwide shipping. We will begin shipping in March 2017.

Q. What are your plans for the future?

We are planning to roll out more products for example a 10x lenses advanced module (10 x 3W LED) with aspheric lenses shining towards and a 1x lenses desk lamp with an integrated bluetooth speaker.

story:
We were chosen to take over the space that was the very successful Bayside Bakery for over thirty years. Bayside has been sorely missed and we are honored to have the opportunity to fill the gap left when the Morrills retired last year.

What We Need

  • Moving equipment and supplies from the Pearl Street kitchen to Malletts Bay will require plumbers, electricians, and carpenters.

  • The renovations will require permits to bring the space up to code.

  • We will need signage and other marketing efforts to appeal to the summer population.

  • We want to provide salaries for staff during the move.

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you find something on the list here that compels you to pitch in financially, but you can also help in other ways:

  • Spread the word on social media about the campaign and our move.
  • Come see us on Pearl Street before March 19.
  • Make plans to visit the Malletts Bay Diner in early April.

story:
Who is Brian Harig

I am an award-winning landscape and travel photographer who grew up in Nebraska. As a kid, I didn't get a chance to experience much outside of my surrounding community. When I was 28, I had the opportunity to travel to Russia. It changed my life forever. I caught the travel bug and haven't looked back since.

I want my two daughters to experience this wonderful planet. That's where you come in. I have most of the funds together to get this travel agency started, I just need that last push

What You Get

  • Each contribution will receive a unique perk.
  • Greeting cards and canvas prints are great for yourself, or will make a GREAT holiday gift.
  • All funds will go to starting this business!

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps. Even if you can't make a contribution, you can still help

  • You can get the word out and make some noise by posting this to social networks like Facebook and Twitter.
  • Just use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for checking this out!

story:
On Saturday, January 28, 2017 Casa Esperanza of Angels Foundation volunteers will visit Sitio Baybay, in Tanjay City, Philippines to distribute toys, food, and grocery items to the children and their families in this impoverished fishing village. The volunteers will also be leading the children through a few dance and song numbers to liven up the occasion and bring cheer to this community. We need your help to make this happen.

Sitio Baybay is a beautiful place. It lies close to the mouth of the Tanjay River, a waterway that springs from the foothills near the mountain ridge bisecting the island of Negros. In another time, this would have been a pristine mangrove forest, the silence punctuated only by the occasional bird call and the sound of the water passing through the shallows. These days, its natural beauty is dimmed by the very real human suffering close by.

 

Sitio Baybay is one of the poorest communities in the Philippines. The economic resurgence that many in the urban areas enjoy has never touched the people in this sleepy fishing village. Ignored for the most part by the government and by people from the outside, the inhabitants of Sitio Baybay make a living through small-scale shoreline fishing, selling of driftwood, harvesting nipa leaves (palm fronds used for thatching), and odd jobs in the nearby coconut and corn fields.

The people in this village suffer from grinding and debilitating poverty, hunger, and want. There’s limited electricity and no water service in Sitio Baybay. None of the houses have any working toilet, people defecate outside exposing the children to various diseases and contagions because of the unsanitary conditions.

The houses are made of very light materials (bamboo and palm fronds) making their occupants highly vulnerable to the tropical typhoons that batter the islands regularly. Tropical monsoon rains also bring flash flooding in the area often disrupting the lives and rhythm of Sitio Baybay. Children frolic around and play barefooted with all sorts of hazardous sharp objects strewn around.

 

Despite the poverty, you’ll never see someone sad, lonely, or depressed in Sitio Baybay. The conditions here are horrendous and unthinkable to Westerners but these people have somehow adapted and thrived to some extent. Some of the children go to school and have big ambitions. Some of the fishermen have fishing boats that allow them to go a bit farther from the shore and increase their catch.

Maybe it’s the natural human response when you’ve hit rock bottom and there’s nothing to go but up or maybe it’s a Filipino thing but there’s real hope and optimism in Sitio Baybay. Our small gesture of bringing them food and grocery items is our way to help them keep that hope in their hearts, make them feel that other people do care about them.

 

December 20, 2016: Launch of our crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo.com. Our goal is to raise $700+ in donations to fully finance this project for the benefit of Sitio Baybay’s children and their families.

January 20, 2017: Deadline of all fundraising activities for this project. We will use whatever amount is collected by then to purchase grocery items and pay for food orders for the beneficiaries.

January 28, 2017: Community Outreach Activity: grocery, food, and gift distribution at Sitio Baybay. We hope to livestream some parts of the event and most of the footage and photos will be posted on our website immediately after the event. A full accounting of our donations received and expenses incurred will also be posted. Any excess amount will be set aside to be exclusively used for future community outreach projects.

 


Photo: Mike Gonzales (The Coffee)

Sitio Baybay is located in Barangay San Isidro in Tanjay City,  a fourth class component city in the province of Negros Oriental in central Philippines. Tanjay is home to an upwardly mobile sector of young professionals and we hope to tap into this group to find volunteers among them who have the heart for service and helping the downtrodden.

 

Casa Esperanza of Angels Foundation Inc. – Philippine Mission is a nonprofit charity organization based in Tanjay City. It’s an institution duly incorporated and registered with the Philippine Securities and Exchange Commission as a nonprofit entity. The foundation is currently building an orphan care facility in Barrio Sta. Ines in Tanjay City that will care for orphans, abused or abandoned children, and those suffering from extreme hunger and poverty.

Our mission in the Philippines works with the Agape Asia Foundation, a 501(c)(3) registered nonprofit in the United States. All donations received from U.S. donors through Agape Asia Foundation and specified for the Philippine Mission - Casa Esperanza of Angels are tax-deductible.

As the foundation’s communications director, I suggested this activity to Ron Brown, Casa Esperanza of Angels’ Managing Director, not just to benefit the people from my hometown in Tanjay City but also to introduce our nonprofit to the community and gain some goodwill while we work to complete the construction of the orphanage facility.

 

We are a new nonprofit and this is basically our very first community relief project. We’re keeping this focused on a small location with limited number of people for us to be able to manage the event more efficiently and really deliver help where it’s most needed.

These are essentially baby steps for us – doing community outreach in our new home in Tanjay City (as a foundation) and doing our first crowdfunding campaign here on Indiegogo.com. We plan to keep going and help more people with bigger projects in the future

 

Our priority is to finish the construction of the Casa Esperanza of Angels Foundation orphan care facility but in the meantime, we’re also doing outreach activities in impoverished communities like Sitio Baybay because helping children in dire economic circumstances is part of our mission.

The people of Sitio Baybay are resilient and hopeful. We have faith that they can improve their lives with a little help from people like you who care enough to extend a helping hand. We hope that this activity will just be the first of many more visits in the future as we work with the people of Sitio Baybay to uplift their lives and rescue their children from poverty. Thank you so much for your help.
story_txt:
On Saturday, January 28, 2017 Casa Esperanza of Angels Foundation volunteers will visit Sitio Baybay, in Tanjay City, Philippines to distribute toys, food, and grocery items to the children and their families in this impoverished fishing village. The volunteers will also be leading the children through a few dance and song numbers to liven up the occasion and bring cheer to this community. We need your help to make this happen.



Sitio Baybay is a beautiful place. It lies close to the mouth of the Tanjay River, a waterway that springs from the foothills near the mountain ridge bisecting the island of Negros. In another time, this would have been a pristine mangrove forest, the silence punctuated only by the occasional bird call and the sound of the water passing through the shallows. These days, its natural beauty is dimmed by the very real human suffering close by.

story:
EZ System Repairs as Open Source

ADVsoft made popular Windows utility software suites. It has a history tracing back to the late 2000′s and millions of downloads under its belt.

ADVsoft Software, the company behind the software, carried out a user survey in May and June of 2009 and over 87% of the ADVsofts’ users rated it good, giving it a full 5 points rating! We also asked about going open source, and the majority of people who answered the survey agreed that it would be a good idea and said that they would be willing to participate financially to make it possible.

So, here we are!

 PC Optimizer To Make Your Computer 300% Faster

Fixes stubborn errors, cleans out clutters, optimizes Internet speed, ensures personal security and maintains maximum computer performance in a more secure, stable, smart, automatic and reliable way. Users can tweak their system information, personalization, user accounts and user account controls, system performance, security settings, network tweaks, Internet Explorer, and more. Change icons on drives, folder and much more. The control manager let you changes all the users from a admin account and do it with ease.EZ System Repairs also has a hotkey system for fast repairs and tweaks.  We added a Win Defender features to disable and enable with one click. 

It also optimizes your system for games by temporarily suspending unnecessary processes, individually or all at once, to focus resources on gaming performance. It analyzes your system and suggests courses of action for all processes and services & cleaning RAM, and intensifying CPU performance.

Up to 200% Quicker PC Startup

Many of our users told that they have been plagued by taking several minutes to boot the PC. With the expanded database and enhanced performance, Startup Manager in EZ System Repairs can intelligently speed up your boot time by disabling unnecessary programs & services and removing dangerous startup items with 1- click. 

Faster & SmootherBrowsing

To boost internet speed dramatically, EZ System Repairs will not only detect and remove the useless or malicious toolbars/plug-ins which will slow down your surfing speed, but also optimize browsers settings of the most mainstream browsers including the Windows 10 Edge, such as removing cookies & junk files and fixing other internet speed issues. In addition, you can easily set the default browser on Windows 10 by Default Program of EZ System Repairs.

Better Protection & Fully SupportWin 10

Malicious applications and browser add-ons will track your online activities and steal your personal information, such as bank accounts, emails or other social accounts. EZ System Repairs will keep your privacy confidential by detecting and removing spyware, adware and other malware. What’s more, System Reinforce of EZ System Repairs will help you stop all the privacy gathering behaviors by Win 10 itself, including your location, sound message, contacts, etc., to provide specialized privacy protection for all Windows 10 Users.

Repair List: Windows Store, Windows Defender, Cortana Add-ons, Network Repairs System Repairs, Total System Repairs.

Tweak List: System , Network, Stability, Game Booster, Total System Optimization.

What is Open Source Software?

Open source software means that the software is free to use, for personal and commercial use. In addition, the source code – the blueprint of how the software is built – is also made public and for everyone to see.

You do not have to be a developer or coder in order to use open source software or to benefit from it. In fact, you are using open source software right now. If you are using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox to read this page, you are using open source. Or if you are using some other web browser, don't worry, this website like majority of all websites, run with open source software such as the Apache web server and the PHP programming language.

As an end user, if EZ System Repairs goes open software, nothing changes for the users. Nothing except that the program would become free for everyone to use! Further, it would become a whole lot more powerful with new features, different editions and faster bug fixes. Open source would allow the best parts of the program to be used in other software as well!

 

 

All parts of the program’s user interface can be localized by editing a simple translation file. At the moment EZ System Repairs comes with the following translations, made by the user community:

story:
Short Summary:

I have been in the culinary industry professionally for the last 14 years, but I have had a passion for cooking since I was 5 years old. Over the last decade, I  have been in several culinary venues including Executive Chef at 21 years old at a wine and jazz bar, Executive Chef of a corporate catering company, garde manger chef at the Thunderbird School of Global Management, culinary arts teacher at a high school, and most recently chef for the Seattle Mariners baseball team for Spring Training. 

I have always had a passion for catering and teaching. I feel now is the time to jump head first into operating my own small business and take the leap into creating a budding entrepreneurship with my endeavor into Martial Chef Catering.

Recently I have registered myself on Thumbtack and have received quite a few requests for catering services and private in-home cooking lessons. Not only have I had some very successful events already such as a musical recital, graduation party, bridal shower, but I've had very successful private in-home cooking lessons, and that's just with only a little over 2 months on Thumbtack. 

What I'm Asking For:

Right now I'm asking for $1500 to help achieve some of my goals for the business. That includes: 

  • Supplies: The money that I raise would help in purchasing platters, chafing dishes, utensils, table decor, flatware, etc.... to help build up my inventory for my business.

 

  • Marketing:The money that I raise will help fund the credits that are required to be purchased for Thumbtack so that I can continue to respond to quotes and  would also help go to funding  various marketing supplies such as: business cards, Foursquare, ads, creating a website, boosting posts on Facebook, etc...

 

  • Community Kitchen: The money that I raise will also help go to finding and renting a community kitchen. That way I can offer a centrally located setting for customers and potential clients to take cooking lessons, or even have consulations with me for their catering needs. 

The Impact:

For those of you that don't know breaking into the restaurant business or even catering business is unbelievably hard and within the first year of launching doesn't have the best success rate. Those that do know me personally know how much passion and drive I have for creating something that's my own. You would not only be helping and donating to a small local business but you'd be helping in taking a small part in making my dreams come true. You can tell everyone that you were a part of helping make a super passionate, incredibly hard working chefs dreams come true. 

    Other Ways You Can Help:

    It's entirely understandable to me that not everyone can help monetarily in making my small business succeed, but if you can't there's other ways as well. Word of mouth is one of the best forms of marketing so I just ask to please share, get the word out and make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out on social media.

story:
About me and my company

BB Custom Instruments was founded in 2014 as a hobby to try and see if I could actually build some quality instruments at competitive prices, while using as high a percentage of USA made parts as possible. Here is a little information about me.

  • Live sound engineer for 20 years working with local and touring bands
  • Professional musician since age 16, playing bass, guitar, keyboards and singing
  • Woodworker and engraver for past 10 years.

What will I use your helpful contribution for?

  • Raw materials to build as many guitars as possible in the received budget
  • Finishing equipment (one airbrush system to create sunburst finishes)
  • Shipping materials to send instruments to soldiers
  • Helping to fund teaching staff

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are hoping for a minimum of $3500 in funding
  • We are offering a few perks, if you pledge $150 you will get a "body mistake" turned into a wall art clock.
  • If you pledge $1000 you will get a complete guitar from one of our production models that are forthcoming

Am I sure I can do this?

So if you have read this far you are probably asking if I can even accomplish this. Well I have built every instrument you see in the pictures for this campaign, they were all learning experiences and I feel that I am finally ready and able to produce these instruments in quantity, I just need a little help from some thoughtful people who share my desire to give back and invest in our vets.

Why am I doing this

My father was a navy vet, the guitarist in my band is a 20 yr army vet, I know of 3 other local vets that are musicians, and I didn't realize that most of them I talked to actually have PTSD either mild or some really bad. Some manage on their own, some have actually used music therapy as a source of relief and refocusing which has helped them to live a better quality of life.  There are a ton more applicants so far than there are instruments to go around and this is the only way I know of that I can help. This will DIRECTLY help Vets in the Delmarva area and will be hosted out of American Legion Post 28 in Oak Orchard DE

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, I get that,  but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Post to your musician friends on their facebook page
  • Create a stir about my idea in your local community

Thanks for even making it this far down my page, I sincerely thank you for the opportunity to try and bring some good Karma and love into the world by letting people make good music with instruments they can afford, and helping get the word out about treating PTSD with music therapy

story:
Soma Studio Wellness and Body Art is a family business, owned and operated by Chelsey and Mark Bradshaw.  The decision to create a business that focuses on Wellness came from a personal place for Chelsey and Mark. After trying to conceive unsuccessfully, they were diagnosed with unexplained infertility. It was alternative therapies and a mixture of eastern and western medicine that ultimately helped them conceive.  On April 4th, 2015 their daughter Olive Bradshaw was born.  

With a new found understanding and appreciation for the alternative therapies, the two decided to create a business model that brings different therapists together with Mark's background as a body piercer and unite them with a common focus on Wellness.

Soma Studio, as a unique space for Wellness, focuses on confident self-expression, physical and mental health.  The therapists and artists at the Studio are independent business owners, but who are also working together to build a better business culture for the industry.  Our business model is one of empowering entrepreneurs by acting as an incubator; providing them with coaching, advertising, front of house services and networking connections. Our goal is to create a safe space for them to establish and grow their business. 

Currently we're home to professionals who provide counselling(Psychologist and Social Worker), reiki, massage therapy, body piercing and tattoos.  We are looking to increase our capacity and attract additional therapists, artists and clients who will thrive in this environment, which is why we're here.

Soma is starting a new fundraising campaign to promote this culture in order to help more therapists and artists achieve their goals for independence and client service.  By contributing to this campaign, you will help raise the money we need to build this community-based business culture, where the relationship is most important, as well as have Soma Membership and In-Store Credit options that provide different benefits at our Studio.  

HEALTHY SELF-CARE AND SELF-EXPRESSION

Wellness represents a healthy mind, body and spirit.  Wellness is the guiding principle for the studio and for our individual practices.  Therapists contribute to the common brand through unique healing philosophies and methods.  Body artists contribute to wellness through safe and comfortable techniques for the meaningful self-expression of our clients.

The two unique features of the Studio are 1) common business services needed to help therapists and artists manage their business, and 2) a brand that fuses mind, body and art for personal wellness.

The identity of Soma Studio is represented in the logo – the Zen Buddhist Ensō.  The Ensō is a circle that is hand-drawn in one or two uninhibited brushstrokes to express a moment when the mind is free to let the body create.  This brand identity is reflected in the space, graphics and communications.

  • Clean
  • Simple
  • Whole

The brand reflects the vision:

Soma Studio will be a centre of diverse professionals and services that complement each other.  We will be an essential place for achieving wellness from the angle of health.  We will be known as a safe and desirable place to come for the respective services we provide by clients who are health conscious.

THE PLAN

We are looking to increase our capacity and attract additional therapists, artists and clients who will thrive in this environment.  New therapists may include naturopathy, chiropractic, physiotherapy and other wellness professionals.  Soma Studio is already a home for counsellors – psychology, social work and similar mental health services – registered massage therapy, Reiki, body piercing and tattoo artists. 

The Studio space is open to therapists and body artists on very flexible rental terms.  The space includes:

  • 7 therapy rooms
  • 3 artists rooms
  • clean room with autoclaves
  • laundry and kitchen facilities
  • common area serving as an Art Gallery for wellness and body-related art

Soma provides common business services to assist independent professionals’ business practices and in order to build the common brand.

  • Office coordinator
  • Online booking system
  • Payment processing and reports
  • 24/7 access
  • Marketing and market development

The community-based business culture is built on wellness.

THE CAMPAIGN AND THE PERK

Our funding goal is $7,000.  The funds are to be used for social and print media and other means to find and attract new therapists and artists.  Soma is a community-based business that will greatly benefit from a community-based funding campaign. 

The primary benefit is in helping Soma to build a community-based business culture.  This includes an expectation that all businesses work for the benefit, health and wellness of their clients.

BECOME A SOMA MEMBER! 

Since our campaign focuses on the benefits of community-based business, we think perks that offer you Soma Memberships and In-Store Credit options best reflects this.  All Memberships options grant perks, all of which include a permanent credit on our service.  As well, throughout each year, we will have special sales exclusively offered to Soma Members only.  Help us build a better business culture and become a Soma Member.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT

First off, thank you for your interest.  We appreciate everyone who believes in our cause and ask that you tell your family and friends about us.  You can also help by sharing our link to this page.  The more people we reach, the better chances we are to be successful in this campaign.
story_txt:
Soma Studio Wellness and Body Art is a family business, owned and operated by Chelsey and Mark Bradshaw.  The decision to create a business that focuses on Wellness came from a personal place for Chelsey and Mark. After trying to conceive unsuccessfully, they were diagnosed with unexplained infertility. It was alternative therapies and a mixture of eastern and western medicine that ultimately helped them conceive.  On April 4th, 2015 their daughter Olive Bradshaw was born.  With a new found understanding and appreciation for the alternative therapies, the two decided to create a business model that brings different therapists together with Mark's background as a body piercer and unite them with a common focus on Wellness.Soma Studio, as a unique space for Wellness, focuses on confident self-expression, physical and mental health.  The therapists and artists at the Studio are independent business owners, but who are also working together to build a better business culture for the industry.  Our business model is one of empowering entrepreneurs by acting as an incubator; providing them with coaching, advertising, front of house services and networking connections. Our goal is to create a safe space for them to establish and grow their business. Currently we're home to professionals who provide counselling(Psychologist and Social Worker), reiki, massage therapy, body piercing and tattoos.  We are looking to increase our capacity and attract additional therapists, artists and clients who will thrive in this environment, which is why we're here.Soma is starting a new fundraising campaign to promote this culture in order to help more therapists and artists achieve their goals for independence and client service.  By contributing to this campaign, you will help raise the money we need to build this community-based business culture, where the relationship is most important, as well as have Soma Membership and In-Store Credit options that provide different benefits at our Studio.  HEALTHY SELF-CARE AND SELF-EXPRESSIONWellness represents a healthy mind, body and spirit.  Wellness is the guiding principle for the studio and for our individual practices.  Therapists contribute to the common brand through unique healing philosophies and methods.  Body artists contribute to wellness through safe and comfortable techniques for the meaningful self-expression of our clients.The two unique features of the Studio are 1) common business services needed to help therapists and artists manage their business, and 2) a brand that fuses mind, body and art for personal wellness.The identity of Soma Studio is represented in the logo – the Zen Buddhist Ensō.  The Ensō is a circle that is hand-drawn in one or two uninhibited brushstrokes to express a moment when the mind is free to let the body create.  This brand identity is reflected in the space, graphics and communications.
Clean
Simple
Whole
The brand reflects the vision:Soma Studio will be a centre of diverse professionals and services that complement each other.  We will be an essential place for achieving wellness from the angle of health.  We will be known as a safe and desirable place to come for the respective services we provide by clients who are health conscious.THE PLANWe are looking to increase our capacity and attract additional therapists, artists and clients who will thrive in this environment.  New therapists may include naturopathy, chiropractic, physiotherapy and other wellness professionals.  Soma Studio is already a home for counsellors – psychology, social work and similar mental health services – registered massage therapy, Reiki, body piercing and tattoo artists. The Studio space is open to therapists and body artists on very flexible rental terms.  The space includes:
7 therapy rooms
3 artists rooms
clean room with autoclaves
laundry and kitchen facilities
common area serving as an Art Gallery for wellness and body-related art

Office coordinator

Payment processing and reports
24/7 access

story:
Everybody needs a haircut, right? 

I always enjoyed getting my hair cut. I even liked going to the barbershop and experiencing its comradery and community. What I didn’t like, though, was the countless hours I’ve spent over the years waiting to be seen by my barber. Most barbers have the best of intentions, but even they can’t always control the unpredictable nature of their schedules. If one customer shows up 15 minutes late, it has a ripple effect that can throw everyone’s day off. I know that has happened to me countless times. Still, I kept on going because I didn’t have another option. 

That’s why I created Mobile Kutz. Mobile Kutz is a new mobile application that brings the barbershop to you, wherever you are. We provide high-quality on-demand grooming services from some of Chicago’s finest barbers. Mobile Kutz allows you to avoid unpredictable barbershop waits and take back your day all within a matter of minutes.

Mobile Kutz solves three problems

First, with our app, customers have complete control over the time they actually receive their haircuts. We guarantee that our barbers will arrive within a 10-minute scheduled window. And once there, they will provide you with quick and quality haircuts.

Second, Mobile Kutz allows customers to try out new barbers easily. We will pair our customers with talented and seasoned Chicago barbers. We’re already working with an experienced barber consultant to support us as we begin recruiting skilled pros.

Lastly, in this time of economic strain, Mobile Kutz will be a job-provider for hard-working folks within the Chicago community. Our goal isn’t to take business away from your local barbershop. Instead, we strive to help barbers maximize their earnings and build their clientele whenever they have time to do a cut.

This is where you come in

We are so close to finishing the Mobile Kutz app. We plan on launching in the spring of 2017, but in order to do so we need to raise $10,000 to finish the development of our app! Sounds like a lot, but if we all pitch in it’s truly a small feat. Honestly. We’re asking that you invest in our idea with whatever donation you can afford. Big or small, everything helps, and we mean it. If 500 people to donated $20 we'd reach our goal in no time. It’s that simple!

Do you believe in Mobile Kutz?

Are you willing to support a local business working to revolutionize the hair industry? Do you want to help barbers in our community increase their earnings and expand their clientele? If the answer is yes to either of these questions, then please give! Don’t forget to check out our awesome rewards. We thank you for your generosity. And spread the word!

 

In solidarity,
Leon Johnson

Founder and CEO, Mobile Kutz

 

About the Founder

Mobile Kutz is the brainchild of Chicago native, Leon Johnson, who grew tired of losing countless hours waiting at the barbershop, and decided to do something about it. Leon is an entrepreneur, youth baseball coach, and graduate of Northern Illinois University, holding a bachelor's degree in Psychology, and a master's degree in Adult and Higher Education.

story:
Special Perks for all Donors

ALL CONTRIBUTORS will get free additional items based on total raised. Once we reach:

  • $2,500 - a small print and digital download of Nevalia's Wonders song
  • $10,000 - digital download of Nevalia music video and a tour of the shop
  • $30,000 - receive a digital version of Nevalia's Wonders book and attend a meet and greet luncheon
  • $75,000 - you will be invited to a VIP grand opening celebration

Nevalia's

Nevalia's is a small business founded by Mary Neville. Nevalia's offers books, music, toys, and learning opportunities for children.

Check out our online shop where you can discover special children's gifts for any occasion. There you can also find Mary's original children's book, Nevalia's Wonders, for which our business is named.

Soon Nevalia's is opening a brick and mortar shop in Blaine, Minnesota. All donations, as well as purchases in our online store, go towards helping this dream come true.

Goals and Vision

Nevalia's will be a positive influence and will create experiences that lift up our core values:

Every child is to be celebrated.

We want your child to have the experience of feeling celebrated for who they are. That's why Nevalia's will treat your child like the prince or princess that they are from the moment they step into the door until the moment they leave.

At Nevalia's, your child can play dress up or do other imaginative play. They can celebrate their birthday, receive a sprinkling of fairy dust, and can attend other celebratory events.

We are also partnering with Kelly Jendro to launch the Kelly's Kids program that will work with local organizations and businesses to provide all-inclusive birthday parties and experiences for underprivileged children.

Reading and writing make up the foundation of all learning.

We will have books available for your child to read in the play area. We will also offer books in our gift shop and online.

Your child can attend story-time, create stories on the magnetic poetry/story board using picture and word magnets, and can participate in special events and contests that encourage your child to get excited about reading, writing, and using their imagination for storytelling.

Music and art greatly influence academic learning.

Nevalia's will have music playing in the Nevalia's store and will offer songs for purchase in our gift shop and online.

We will have a coloring table where your child can get creative with drawing and coloring. We will hold special events and contests that encourage your child to learn and share through music and art.

Nevalia's is also partnering with Music Together to offer music and creative movement classes for children and their families.

Balanced learning can prepare children for their future.

In addition to reading, writing, music, and art as mentioned above, we also will encourage STEM learning activities (STEM = science, technology, engineering, and math).

In the Nevalia's playroom, your child will have the option to play with toys that promote STEM learning and can participate in special events that promote STEM learning.

We have future plans to add a kitchen in our shop for creating mini baked confections. When this addition is added, we will offer baking classes that will teach your child the science behind baking where they can participate in experiments while having fun with baking.

The well-being of every child.

At Nevalia's, your child can participate in special events and contests that promote their overall well-being. We are also in discussions for a future partnership with a local yoga instructor to offer special kids yoga classes that will promote their spiritual and physical well-being.

Nevalia’s is committed to helping kids love to learn. This involves helping parents too! Subscribe and follow us on Facebook to receive tips and encouragement along the way.

About the Brick and Mortar Shop

Families in Blaine, Minnesota are craving more creative, fun, educational activities for their kids.

Nevalia's is a place where you can enjoy fun products and services inspired by the storybook character Nevalia. Kids will enjoy classes, a play room, a party room, music, story-time, and more!

Not local? We have an online store at nevalia.com where you and your children can take part in our special contests and order our baked treats, gifts, and books.

Whether you come for a class, a celebration, or an afternoon of play, kids will have an amazing experience when they visit Nevalia's.

Shop Interior

This is the current shop interior. A beautiful space to begin our journey.

Shop Exterior

This is a picture of the outside of the Nevalia's store. The sign is a concept rendering, but is complete and ready to be installed!

At Nevalia's, it will be an experience for your family. Celebrate in the private party room, take classes, have fun in the play area, and get excited for our special events. You will also be able to purchase books and unique gifts.

Where to Find Us

Nevalia's is located in Blaine, Minnesota at 4325 Pheasant Ridge Drive, Suite 502 in The Village of Blaine shopping center.

Products and Services

Nevalia's staff will pamper your kids the moment they walk in the door, treating your child as the prince or princess that they are. Children can attend story time, attend a fun class, and host a birthday party in our party room. They will be able to browse a selection of books from local children's authors. They will color, play dress up, and enjoy playing. Your child will have the option of being sprinkled with fairy dust before they leave, even if you don't purchase a thing. When your child leaves Nevalia's, they will beg you to come back.

Whether a parent, grandparent, or caretaker, you will enjoy socializing with others while watching your child have fun as they spend time at Nevalia's.

 

  • Party space rental.
  • Beverages.
  • Play area: Toys, soft climbing, dress up, activities, books, and more.
  • Gifts: Books, toys, gift cards, and more.
  • Story time.
  • Fairy dust: Get sprinkled with fairy dust on your way out.
  • Special events: Special guests, contests, additional classes, and more.
  • Website: Purchase gifts online, book a party, and sign up for a class.

Future plans:

  • Baking classes: kids learn the science behind baking!
  • Mini baked confections: Cupcakes, cookies, and more.
  • Cupcake and cookie decorating.

What We Need

Over the last year, I have self-funded the Nevalia's Wonders book, song, and book app, as well as the initial groundwork for the Nevalia's store. A retail lease is signed, architecture drawings are complete, and now I need your help in getting across the finish line. With your generous support, I will use the funds for the following:

About the Owner

Hi, I'm Mary Neville. I wear a lot of hats; I'm a project manager, a mom, a grandma, an author, and an entrepreneur all rolled up into one.

Being a parent and working in educational software, I've developed a strong passion for helping kids learn through inspiration. I’ve seen firsthand how children can be inspired in so many ways: through words, pictures, music, and play. That’s why I’m opening Nevalia’s—a place where children can be whisked away to a world of whimsy.

Over the past 20 years, I have been in property management and the software industry as a project manager, managing programs and projects. I hold a project management professional (PMP) certification. How does one  go from managing properties to managing software development projects? Technology was a hobby at first - something fun to research and learn and I loved managing in complex, fast-paced situations. I ended up gradually marrying the two passions and spent the last 11 years working at a tech company in Minnesota.

I also enjoy being creative. I have written short stories, written scripts, and collaborated with my sister to write many original songs. I've also been writing children's stories and songs since my daughter was very young. Recently, my granddaughter, Nora, inspired me to create the storybook character, Nevalia: a curious toddler who spends her days joyfully discovering the world around her. The book is written based on a song I wrote and sang to my daughter when she was very young. I recorded the song and am giving it away free with each book purchase.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for contributing and being a part of bringing this exciting new experience to kids.

In addition to donating to our campaign, you can help spread the word by letting your family, friends, neighbors, and colleagues all know about this campaign and asking them to donate.

Stretch Goals

While $75,000 will get our doors open, we appreciate any additional donations to help us on the next leg of our journey. This will include:

  • Additional needed staff.
  • Additional kitchen equipment.
  • A second point-of-sale machine.
  • Additional play room features.
  • Book 2 in the Nevalia Wonderment Series.
  • Helping Nevalia's grow! We have long-term plans for expansion that include even more learning for kids.

story:
HELP SAVE Game Haven!

My name is Brent Goren and this is my vision:

Game Haven is a video gaming, RPG, computer training, Smash bros and educational center located in Norwalk, Connecticut

I am passionate about working with kids and about providing them a safe place that is clean and fun and inclusive.  While Game Haven caters to all age groups we host more than just birthday parties, computer training and summer camp.  We are the premier venue for the competitive eSports community in Fairfield, New Haven and Westchester counties.  

I started this company to create a space where that community could grow and eventually flourish.  Game Haven is a place where that community spans all ages, ethnicities, and socio-economic demographics.  It's like "CHEERS" for gamers!  With the space carved out the community followed.  With the community established the experiences followed.  People spend their time with us and break bread with us and game with us.  They create lasting friendships and bond through mutuality and shared experience.  It's incredibly rewarding for me on multiple levels to hear how Game Haven has enriched people's lives.

**UPDATE: We are lowering the IndieGoGo to only $20,000 which will go to paying our rent for (4) months - that will buy us more time to get our new programs in place and hopefully survive until next summer.  We will also be adding BACKER REWARDS for your contributions AS WELL AS MONETARY GOAL REWARDS (in increments) @ $2,000, $5,000, $9,000, and $14,000.

 

**NOTE:  If we don't reach our goal the IndieGoGo funds will be applied to REACHING OUR GOAL.  I will do everything in my power to keep Game Haven alive.  As I said here in my FB post:

https://www.facebook.com/brent.goren/posts/1483...

I believe so strongly in Game Haven, the viability of the business model, and in the community that I have already put everything on the line.

I know this is a long-shot but if we EXCEED our goal by even a minuscule fraction of a percent of a teeny tiny eensy weensy bit...I'm investing in VR for the store.  I will apply every single PENNY over the amount we need to stay in business in PSVR / Oculus / Vive stations.  It's an area that I've felt Game Haven is lacking and I've been really chomping at the bit to add it to our repertoire.

Challenges:

Finding the right space is like Goldilocks.  This porridge is too hot!  This porridge is too cold!  Well Game Haven needs to find a space that's Juuuuuuust RIGHT!  I admit that I made a mistake in choosing the current location.  I admit that I made too many compromises and concessions.  I am lying in the bed that I made two years ago.  The right space makes all the difference and I give you my assurance and my solemn promise and oath that I will not make that same mistake again.  If we are patient and persistent we will find that Goldilocks space and Game Haven will thrive.

**NOTE: If you can contribute financially it's wholeheartedly appreciated.  If you can't contribute financially that doesn't mean you can't contribute at all and it certainly doesn't mean that your contribution is any less meaningful or impactful.  Please spread the word.  You can do this by sharing the IndieGoGo on social media, following us, re-posting, or make a video testimonial.  Heck!  You can come down to the store in the next two weeks and we'll film it WITH you!  Every little bit counts and no contribution will go unrecognized.

Guys, it isn't every day that you have an opportunity to make a really meaningful impact on someone's life or on the world.  Game Haven is that opportunity.  We need your help.  We will follow up over the next week with testimonials, video-feeds, and lots of updates to keep you apprised of our progress and to show you just how many lives your contribution will affect.  Thank you.  From the bottom of my heart - thank you.

Love, Brent

#SAVEGAMEHAVENCONNECTICUT #CTGAMEHAVEN #SUPPORTLOCALBUSINESS #GAMERSUNITE

facebook.com/ctgamehaven

www.ctgamehaven.com

10 Cross Street Norwalk, Connnecticut • (475) 355-1755
story_txt: HELP SAVE Game Haven!My name is Brent Goren and this is my vision:Game Haven is a video gaming, RPG, computer training, Smash bros and educational center located in Norwalk, ConnecticutI am passionate about working with kids and about providing them a safe place that is clean and fun and inclusive.  While Game Haven caters to all age groups we host more than just birthday parties, computer training and summer camp.  We are the premier venue for the competitive eSports community in Fairfield, New Haven and Westchester counties.  I started this company to create a space where that community could grow and eventually flourish.  Game Haven is a place where that community spans all ages, ethnicities, and socio-economic demographics.  It's like "CHEERS" for gamers!  With the space carved out the community followed.  With the community established the experiences followed.  People spend their time with us and break bread with us and game with us.  They create lasting friendships and bond through mutuality and shared experience.  It's incredibly rewarding for me on multiple levels to hear how Game Haven has enriched people's lives.**UPDATE: We are lowering the IndieGoGo to only $20,000 which will go to paying our rent for (4) months - that will buy us more time to get our new programs in place and hopefully survive until next summer.  We will also be adding BACKER REWARDS for your contributions AS WELL AS MONETARY GOAL REWARDS (in increments) @ $2,000, $5,000, $9,000, and $14,000. **NOTE:  If we don't reach our goal the IndieGoGo funds will be applied to REACHING OUR GOAL.  I will do everything in my power to keep Game Haven alive.  As I said here in my FB post:https://www.facebook.com/brent.goren/posts/1483...I believe so strongly in Game Haven, the viability of the business model, and in the community that I have already put everything on the line.I know this is a long-shot but if we EXCEED our goal by even a minuscule fraction of a percent of a teeny tiny eensy weensy bit...I'm investing in VR for the store.  I will apply every single PENNY over the amount we need to stay in business in PSVR / Oculus / Vive stations.  It's an area that I've felt Game Haven is lacking and I've been really chomping at the bit to add it to our repertoire.Challenges:Finding the right space is like Goldilocks.  This porridge is too hot! story:
Short Summary

Welcome to the Tour Cascadia Pre-Launch 

   Who are we?

  Tour Cascadia is a Wine and Adventure tourism company. Our goal is to create fully customizable and completely unique experiences for each of our guests.

 

  I'm Wesley and my wife's name is Jordan. Together we make up the entire team of Tour Cascadia. When we got married in 2014, we decided to stay in the area and create lives that were community and area focused. This valley has always been my home, I grew up 25 miles from where we live now. Jordan calls the South home, but has now been living in the Valley for over 10 years. The farmers, wine makers, tasting room staff, and chefs are our neighbors and our friends.  

  Jordan currently works as a host at a tasting room and I have been driving Wine Tours since 2013. We decided that this place is where we want to be, and that we wanted to share our experience with you. Between the two of us, we have our ear to the  ground and have access to special people and special wine experiences. We enjoy hiking immensely and thus, decided that building a business around our passions was the most logical and life giving thing to do. On our days off, you can find us in tasting rooms across the valley doing "homework". We are so excited to share our knowledge, experience and access with you.

  We need your help. When we decided to bootstrap the startup costs, we knew that we would still need the help and support of our community. We also decided that we wouldn't ask for anything without providing something in return for at least the amount contributed, but hoping to offer even more. 

What We Need & What You Get

  We are looking to raise $5,000. This money will go straight into the startup costs of getting Tour Cascadia up and running. 

  In exchange for your contributions we have put together perks and packages that will equal your contribution in value. Regardless of whether we reach the goal of 5K, the money raised will still go towards startup costs and you will still receive your package!

 

  Most of the hard work is done and we are so excited to hit the road! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know that there is a new tour company in town!

We know that it isn't possible for everyone that wants to contribute to do so monetarily. We would be just as grateful if you would go like the Facebook page, follow our Instagram and check out the website!

http://tourcascadia.com

http://www.facebook.com/tourcascadia/

Instagram @tourcascadia

 

Jordan and I can't begin to express how thankful we are for all the support we have received so far! 

Thank You

-Wesley
