story:
Why Persnickety Books?

In 2017, Shawna and Herb came to Burlington, NC. They, like any newcomer to a community, looked upon our historic Downtown with fresh eyes. They saw small business owners and entrepreneurs setting up shops and working to shape the future of our historic Downtown Main Street. That collection of businesses included a coffee shop, record store, consignment shops, photography studios, office spaces, co-working hangouts, the theater, bars, and restaurants, but they saw that something was missing. A used bookstore.

As serial entrepreneurs, they were no strangers to starting a business. They dove in headfirst, finding a place, crafting the name “Persnickety Books,” collecting shelves and stocking them with books. The shop took form organically. One box of books at a time. As the books filled the shelves, categories began to form. History here, poetry there, colorful kids books in the corner, fiction, fantasy, and mystery finding their way onto every shelf and surface available. People gradually discovered this new place, a comfortable, casual den of literary diversity. There are adventure stories, but the real adventure is skimming through along the shelves and chancing upon a book that you would have never thought to read before laying eyes on it.

Shawna and Herb loved every book, every customer, and every corner of their rapidly growing store. But sometimes life has other plans, and it became apparent that, due to some personal family challenges, Shawna and Herb were going to have to move back to Oregon. Persnickety was doing well, and they knew that downtown Burlington needed to keep a used bookstore, so they began the search to find new owners to take over their passion project. As entrepreneurs ourselves, with a number of successful businesses and products behind us, plus Ian’s role as Mayor of Burlington, this opportunity excited us. We loved the potential we saw in this little store, so we made the decision to step in and purchase the store from Shawna and Herb.

The books make their way to the shop from many sources. Some have owners who have long since passed and they come to us in dusty boxes out of dim basements and storage units. Others have been lovingly lifted from bright shelves, treasured by their owners, and they are traded in to make room for new volumes. Wherever their source, it is our mission to help find them a new person to inspire.

To make sure that books find their next chapter, it takes sorting, cleaning, un-dog-earing, and cataloging. They must be hauled box-by-box, cart-by-cart to their next destination. And that’s where we hit upon a truly wonderful partnership. In our community of Burlington, North Carolina, there are two outstanding organizations which have made it their mission to help men and women transition out of prison and back into public life. The process of regaining society’s trust is painfully slow, and the rent check is due every month in the meantime. Steady work is one of the largest hurdles faced by former-felons, as they are often denied jobs before they have a chance to prove themselves, simply because of the stigma of their backstory (or previous life chapters).

From that awareness of the community need, coupled with the fact that Persnickety Books was already giving books a second, third, or twentieth chance, we embarked upon this incredible partnership. We have combined efforts with Sustainable Alamance and Benevolence Farm to provide part-time and eventually full-time employment for the men and women in their programs. These are the people who will help us tote, prepare, and stock all your books, by the boxload, cartload, and truckload. As these people transition towards self-sufficiency, returning to their homes and families, their employment with Persnickety Books will help them stay on track and reduce recidivism. With these partnerships, we realized that our new mission statement was obvious, “Giving books and people a second chance”

What We Need & What You Get

We're seeking to raise at least $50,000. Those funds will help us make this transformation possible including the acceleration of our business expansion and creation of new jobs. Every dollar donated will help us expand the store, serve more people, and create more second chances for books and people. Plus, you'll get some great perks including:

Bookmark & 25% Off Coupon - Limited edition funder bookmark and a coupon for 25% off your next purchase (saves you up to $10).

The Best Thank You - Your name will be forever recognized on our website and in our store for your generosity in helping us pioneer this new mission-driven bookstore.

Tote Bag - Custom funder book tote bag perfect for loading up with books at your local bookstore.

Persnickety T-Shirt - Super-soft sapphire blue and white shirt with made in the USA with organic cotton. The most comfortable way to show your support. These will be available in men's sizes small to 3XL and women's small to XL.

Custom Bookends - These metal bookends are made just down the street from our shop and will feature the Persnickety logo. Perfect for displaying your support and your growing book collection.

Persnickety Book Club - This membership entitles you to one free book per week in our store. This includes all regularly priced books! Your book collection is about to become a whole lot more awesome. Especially if you choose the Free Books for Life level! (Yes, seriously, FREE books for the rest of your life!)

VIP Funder Party - You'll receive a ticket to our VIP party for funders which will be held in the Summer of 2019 as we kick off our expansion thanks to your support. 

Bookcase Sponsor - We'll name a bookcase after you complete with a beautiful plaque. You'll get to pick the category in the store where you want your bookcase to live. Categories will be selected after the campaign concludes based on order of donations received.

Special Sponsor Levels

We recognize the importance of creating a unique and creative atmosphere at our bookstore and you can help take that to the next level. By sponsoring us at any of these levels, you will help fund the creation of a unique space within the store.

Children's Sponsor - We want to create a special play area for kids and books to seamlessly blend together. In this comfortable child-sized space, kids will explore reading and play at their own pace while their parents browse the store.

Reading Lounge Sponsor - Sometimes all you want to do is find your peaceful escape in a book. This comfortable and quiet lounge space will include a variety of plush chairs and great lighting for when you find that perfect book and need a place to enjoy it.

Board Game Area Sponsor - Our customers love playing at our one chess board in the shop. We would love to include a little more space and a collection of unique games for them to explore while their friends or significant others browse the shelves.

Community Meeting Space Sponsor - Our community is filled with book clubs and local authors. Having a flexible space for book clubs to meet and for authors to host signings will add a wonderful extra dimension to the store. 

Cafe Sponsor - After a successful dive into the shelves, with your new stack of books to read, wouldn't it be nice to grab a fresh muffin, sandwich, or drink and take a quick break in the in-store cafe? We think so too and your support can help us make this happen.

Send us a message if you think of another space that you'd like for us to include!

The Impact

Combined with our new mission along with the bookstore that Shawna and Herb have created, we desire to be a place for people to discover the world and themselves. We desire to be a place where there are always new books popping up on the shelves. Where you can discover new genres that keep your imagination inspired. Where children can find their new favorite story and their parents can always afford to say yes to their child's selection.  And where books, ideas, people, and all of their stories come together in the heart of our community.

But like any small business, we face many challenges. To help more books find their next people and homes, we need more shelves, more reading spaces, and all the bits and pieces that go along with that. Persnickety Books is growing and new customers are discovering us every day. The need for employment opportunities by Sustainable Alamance and Benevolence Farm is only growing. That is why we are asking for your help. By contributing to our campaign, you are helping us accelerate the pace of our expansion and the scale of our community impact. If we hit our goal of $50,000 we will be able to expand our off-site book sorting to enable us to accept many more trade-ins and donations and find new homes for those books. We’ll also be able to create more employment opportunities that will pay a living wage and help more former felons become contributing citizens again.

If we exceed our goal, then we will begin our search for a larger store location. With that, we hope to partner with other downtown entrepreneurs to co-locate with a cafe, co-working space, or other complimentary business that will enhance the vibe of the bookstore and make it an even more inviting place to visit. Join us in redefining what a neighborhood used bookstore can be while also creating second chances across our community. Plus, we would love to share this business model with others around the country and the world. Your support helps it start right here.

Risks & Challenges

The bookstore market is filled with challenges. We recognize that this won't be easy. However, our research has shown us that community support for this store is strong. We have structured our business so that at a minimum we can continue to provide a great local bookstore for our community. The team that we have assembled has over a half-century business experience in creating efficient and successful operations like this. Our partnerships with Sustainable Alamance and Benevolence Farm have provided us with extensive guidance and support for the successful hiring of people with criminal records. Coupled with their wrap-around support services, our program represents one of the best opportunities for success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If there is just one thing you do today, please share our story. Opportunities to change the narrative and create a new mission-driven business like this don't come around every day. By sharing this through your social media or through IndieGoGo, you are helping to inspire others to look for creative ways to make a difference in their community.  Thanks for taking the time to learn more about what we are doing!

story:
(English version will follow)

Notre mission

Depuis 2013, l’organisme à but non lucratif Kina8at (prononcer Kinawat, signifie "ensemble" en algonquin ou anicinape) permet la guérison et la reconnexion culturelle des Premières Nations, en plus de favoriser la réconciliation et le partage des cultures autochtones avec tous, par le biais de programmes de formation, de sensibilisation et de ressourcement, inspirés de la philosophie et des traditions des Premières Nations. Le but est d’aider particulièrement la jeunesse, car il est important pour les jeunes autochtones de retrouver la philosophie de leurs ancêtres. 

Notre campagne

L’équipe et les cofondateurs de Kina8at, Dominique Rankin, chef héréditaire algonquin et Marie-Josée Tardif, sillonnent les routes du Québec comme à l’international afin de transmettre leurs enseignements. Nomades, nous caressions depuis longtemps le rêve de nous enraciner dans la forêt, près d'une belle étendue d'eau, et de construire un centre culturel et écotouristique regroupant nos activités. Nous y sommes presque ! Nous venons d’acheter un terrain à La Conception, dans la région des Laurentides, au Québec. Situé au cœur d’une forêt mature et mixte, avec un accès à l’eau, ce centre de tourisme autochtone durable sera le seul en son genre à l’Est du Canada.

Notre objectif est d’offrir d’ici 2020 une gamme complète d’activités avec un centre d’hébergement, un pavillon d’accueil, un centre culturel et un pavillon d’enseignement. Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour incarner notre vision dès cet hiver 2018. 

L’objectif de cette campagne est de financer l’achat d’équipements et de matériaux de qualité pour ériger trois tentes de prospecteurs et ainsi démarrer rapidement les activités sur le terrain. 

Grâce à vous, nous pourrons acheter :  

  • 3 toiles pour les tentes de prospecteurs
  • 3 planchers (bois, isolant, vis, corde, etc.)
  • 3 poêles à bois
  • des meubles (lits superposés, chaises, tablettes)
  • du bois de chauffage

Plus votre soutien sera conséquent, plus rapidement nous pourrons vous recevoir dans les prochains mois.  

Une fois l’objectif de cette campagne atteint, vos contributions supplémentaires permettront de construire un bloc sanitaire plus complet, d’acquérir d’autres tentes de prospecteurs et de bénéficier plus rapidement de l’aide technique pour débuter la construction des installations permanentes en 2019. Votre soutien est essentiel à la continuité de la réalisation de notre mission ! 

 

Notre impact

Les profits générés par les activités sur le site seront réinvestis et permettront notamment de faire rayonner davantage nos ateliers de sensibilisation aux cultures autochtones, de financer des stages de reconnexion culturelle pour les Autochtones, de former des passeurs de culture, d’impliquer les aînés et les jeunes autochtones dans nos projets. 

À plus long terme, nous souhaitons que le centre culturel soit au cœur du développement socio-économique de la région des Laurentides et soit un carrefour de transmission culturelle de plusieurs communautés autochtones. Dans un monde où l’urgence d’un rapprochement entre les peuples se fait indéniablement sentir, la réappropriation culturelle et la réconciliation avec les Autochtones se doit d’être mise de l’avant. Cette rencontre doit se faire dans un environnement sain, respectant les principes du développement durable. Lieu de ressourcement et de guérison, le centre culturel et touristique de Kina8at sera un lieu unique qui permettra d’offrir la possibilité de réconciliation pour les Autochtones avec leur culture, de créer un espace pour que les peuples se rencontrent, d’apprendre à se connaître et se comprendre. 

Encourager Kina8at c’est participer ensemble à la réconciliation avec les Premiers peuples, c'est contribuer à faire rayonner les cultures autochtones et permettre aux Autochtones de reconnecter avec leur culture.

 

Nos contreparties

En guise de remerciement, vous recevrez des produits authentiques confectionnés par des amis de Kina8at suivant les enseignements traditionnels autochtones. Nous vous tiendrons également régulièrement informés des avancées du projet et de nos activités. 

  • Azati (Tremble) : 25 $ CAD

Un grand merci! Vous recevrez l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur.

  • Akimag (Frêne) : 50 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une carte-prière algonquine de Dominique Rankin, l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur.

  • Minaig (Épinette blanche) : 100 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une prière algonquine de Dominique Rankin, et au choix : une paire de boucles d'oreilles OU un bracelet OU une amulette en perles, ainsi que l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur. Veuillez noter que les formes et couleurs des objets peuvent varier. 

  • Oukik (Pin) : 200 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une prière algonquine de Dominique Rankin, un châle en polar (modèle homme ou femme au choix), ainsi que l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur. Veuillez noter que le tissu des châles peut varier.

  • Kijikatig (Cèdre) : 500 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une prière algonquine de Dominique Rankin, le livre dédicacé "On nous appelait les sauvages" de Dominique Rankin et Marie-Josée Tardif, ainsi que l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur. Veuillez noter que les dédicaces auront lieu à partir du 15 novembre, date de leur retour au Québec.

  • Wigwasatig (Bouleau) : 650 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une prière algonquine de Dominique Rankin, une paire de mocassins (modèle homme, femme ou enfant au choix), l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur. Nous vous contacterons par courriel pour connaître votre taille de mocassins. 

  • Ininatig (Érable) : 1000 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une prière algonquine de Dominique Rankin et une paire de mocassins (modèle homme, femme ou enfant au choix). Votre nom sera gravé sur un mât protecteur du centre culturel. Vous recevrez également l'infolettre des membres de Kina8at et des invitations en primeur. Nous vous contacterons par courriel pour connaître votre taille de mocassins. 

  • Cigoubi (Sapin) : 2000 $ CAD

Vous recevrez une prière algonquine, une paire de mocassins (modèle homme, femme ou enfant au choix)et une invitation à participer à un souper de groupe avec Dominique Rankin et des représentants de Kina8at (dates et lieux à déterminer). Votre nom sera gravé sur un mât protecteur du centre culturel. Vous recevrez également l'infolettre des membres et des invitations en primeur. Nous vous contacterons par courriel pour connaître votre taille de mocassins. 

Veuillez noter qu’il est possible que les formes et couleurs des produits qui vous seront envoyés varient des images présentées, cela en fonction de l’unicité de chaque objet.

D'autres façons de nous aider

Vous souhaitez nous appuyer mais vous ne pouvez pas le faire financièrement ? 

SVP faites circuler cette campagne dans vos réseaux ! Nous pourrons ainsi atteindre nos objectifs financiers, faire connaître d’avantage Kina8at et la beauté des cultures autochtones.

Migwech ! Wliwni ! Tshinashkunitin ! Tiawenhk! Nia ‘: wen  !

                           

                              ***English version***

 

Our mission

Since 2013, the non-profit organization Kina8at (pronounced Kinawat) has been providing healing and cultural reappropriation to First Nations, as well as fostering reconciliation and sharing Aboriginal cultures with all, through Awareness and resourcing, inspired by the philosophy and traditions of First Nations. The goal is to help youth in particular, as it is important for Aboriginal youth to rediscover the philosophy of their ancestors.

 

Fund raising

The team and co-founders of Kina8at, Dominique Rankin, Hereditary Chief Algonquin and Marie-Josée Tardif, browse the roads of Quebec and internationally to transmit their teachings. Nomads, we have long had the dream of rooting ourselves on the anicinape territory and building a cultural and ecotourism center grouping our activities. We are almost there ! We have just bought a lot in La Conception, in the Laurentides region of Quebec. Located in a mature, mixed forest with access to water, this sustainable Aboriginal tourism center will be the only one of its kind in Eastern Canada. 

Our goal is to offer by 2020 a complete range of activities with a shelter, a reception pavilion, a cultural center and a teaching pavilion. We need your support to embody our vision as early as this winter of 2018. 

The objective of this campaign is to finance the purchase of equipment and quality materials to erect three prospector tents and thus quickly start the activities in the field. 

With your contribution, we will be able to buy:

- 3 canvases for prospectors' tents

- 3 floors (wood, insulation, screws, rope, etc.)

- 3 wood burning stoves

- furniture (bunk beds, chairs, tablets)

- firewood

 The more your support is consistent, the sooner we can receive you in the coming months on our new site. Once our objectives have been achieved, we will be able to build a more complete sanitary block with your additional contribution, acquire other prospector tents and benefit more quickly from technical assistance to start the construction of the permanent installations in 2019.

Your support is essential to the continuity of the achievement of our mission

        Expenses distribution of the crownfunding campaign

Our impact

A long time ago, the founding members of Kina8at, Marie-Josée Tardif and Dominique Rankin, had already begun to develop classes allowing customers to live a deep experience with anicinape culture. Wishing to pass on their knowledge to a greater number of people, while sharing the transmission of indigenous traditional knowledge, they opted in 2013 for a broader and sustainable formula, ie the creation of a non-profit organization.

Together, they reflect the soul of the organization. Recognizing the urgency of healing, reconciliation and rapprochement between Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal people, they are endowed with a rare charisma, energy and motivation to realize their dreams.

The profits generated by the activities on the site will, among other things, benefit a wider public, raise awareness of Aboriginal culture, fund cultural re-appropriation courses for aboriginals, find and train cultural teachers, involve aboriginal elders and youth in our projects. 

In the longer term, we hope that the cultural center will be at the heart of the socio-economic development of the Laurentides region and will be a crossroads for the cultural transmission of several Aboriginal communities. An aboriginal cultural and tourism center will be an innovative product for the Laurentians that will also allow new people to discover the region. 

Kina8at will be a unique place. In a world where the urgency of bringing people together is undeniably felt, cultural reappropriation and reconciliation with Aboriginal people must be put forward. This meeting must be done in a healthy environment, respecting the principles of sustainable development. It is a complementary and emerging project with the context of reconciliation. To offer the possibility of reconciliation for First Nations with their culture, to create a space for people to meet, to get to know each other and to understand each other. The center will receive other Aboriginal communities as a place for healing and healing.  

Encouraging Kina8at means participating in reconciliation with the First Peoples, helping to make Aboriginal culture shine and allowing Aboriginal people to reconnect with their culture.

 

Our counterparts 

As a thank you, you will receive authentic products made by friends of Kina8at following traditional indigenous teachings. We will also keep you regularly informed about the progress of the project and our activities.

  • Azati (Tremble) : 25 $ CAD

A big thank-you! You will receive the newsletter of Kina8at members and invitations en primeur.

  • Akimag (Frêne) : 50 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer card from Chomis Dominique Rankin, the newsletter of Kina8at members and invitations en primeur.

  • Minaig (Épinette blanche) : 100 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer from Chomis Dominique Rankin, and a choice of: a pair of earrings OR a beaded bracelet OR amulet, as well as Kina8at members' newsletter and  invitations en primeur. Please note that the shapes and colors of the objects may vary.

  • Oukik (Pin) : 200 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer by Chomis Dominique Rankin, a polar shawl (male or female model of your choice), as well as the newsletter of Kina8at members and invitations en primeur. Please note that the fabric of the shawls may vary.

  • Kijikatig (Cèdre) : 500 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer from Chomis Dominique Rankin, the autographed book "We were called the savages" by Chomis Dominique Rankin and Marie-Josée Tardif, as well as the newsletter of Kina8at members and invitations en primeur. Please note that the dedications will take place from November 15th, date of their return to Quebec.

  • Wigwasatig (Bouleau) : 650 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer from Chomis Dominique Rankin, a pair of moccasins (male, female or child models of your choice), Kina8at members' newsletter and invitations en primeur. We will contact you by email to know your moccasin size.

  • Ininatig (Érable) : 1000 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer from Chomis Dominique Rankin and a pair of moccasins (men's, women's or child's choice). Your name will be engraved on a protective pole of the cultural center. You will also receive the newsletter of Kina8at members and invitations en primeur. We will contact you by email to know your moccasin size.

  • Cigoubi (Sapin) : 2000 $ CAD

You will receive an Algonquin prayer, a pair of moccasins (male, female or child models of your choice) and an invitation to participate in a group dinner with Chomis Dominique Rankin and representatives of Kina8at (dates and places to be determined). Your name will be engraved on a protective pole of the cultural center. You will also receive the members' newsletter and the invitational invitations. We will contact you by email to know your moccasin size.

Please note that it is possible that the shapes and colors of the products that will be sent to you vary from the images presented, depending on the uniqueness of each object.

You want to support us but you can not do it financially?  Please circulate this campaign in your networks! This will help us achieve our financial goals, promote Kina8at and the beauty of Aboriginal culture. 

Migwech! Wliwni! Tshinashkunitin! Tiawenhk! Nia ': wen!

Remerciements pour cette campagne - Special thanks for this campaign

Gwenola, Pascale, Jocelyne, Suzanne, Anne, Rachel.

(English version will follow)
Notre mission
Depuis 2013, l’organisme à but non lucratif Kina8at (prononcer Kinawat, signifie "ensemble" en algonquin ou anicinape) permet la guérison et la reconnexion culturelle des Premières Nations, en plus de favoriser la réconciliation et le partage des cultures autochtones avec tous, par le biais de programmes de formation, de sensibilisation et de ressourcement, inspirés de la philosophie et des traditions des Premières Nations. Le but est d’aider particulièrement la jeunesse, car il est important pour les jeunes autochtones de retrouver la philosophie de leurs ancêtres. 
Notre campagne
L’équipe et les cofondateurs de Kina8at, Dominique Rankin, chef héréditaire algonquin et Marie-Josée Tardif, sillonnent les routes du Québec comme à l’international afin de transmettre leurs enseignements. Nomades, nous caressions depuis longtemps le rêve de nous enraciner dans la forêt, près d'une belle étendue d'eau, et de construire un centre culturel et écotouristique regroupant nos activités. Nous y sommes presque ! Nous venons d’acheter un terrain à La Conception, dans la région des Laurentides, au Québec. Situé au cœur d’une forêt mature et mixte, avec un accès à l’eau, ce centre de tourisme autochtone durable sera le seul en son genre à l’Est du Canada.
Notre objectif est d’offrir d’ici 2020 une gamme complète d’activités avec un centre d’hébergement, un pavillon d’accueil, un centre culturel et un pavillon d’enseignement. Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour incarner notre vision dès cet hiver 2018. 
L’objectif de cette campagne est de financer l’achat d’équipements et de matériaux de qualité pour ériger trois tentes de prospecteurs et ainsi démarrer rapidement les activités sur le terrain.

story:
Who we are

We are Autolab, a Colombian startup based in Bogota. We have dedicated the last two years building a technology platform for the auto repair industry with the mission of bringing more revenue and stability to small, independent auto repair shops and offering a high quality, affordable auto repair service to middle-class Colombians.

 

How you can help us limit Covid-19 transmission in Colombia

While our core business is shut down due to Colombia’s mandatory shelter-in-place policy, we have redirected our startup's financial and human capital toward a sterilization service for taxis and ride-hailing vehicles to help protect them, their families and their riders from constant exposure to Covid-19. We launched the service in one location and we are subsidizing it to the extent possible. We reduced the price from $5 to $2 and we launched a monthly subscription model that offers unlimited sterilizations for just $20. The driver can come for sterilizations as many times as he/she wants. We believe that we can have a huge impact on drivers and their passengers with this subscription model and by opening more locations. 

Even with these price subsidies, most taxi and ride-hailing drivers do not have the ability to pay. Even something as little as $20 represents 10% of their income. We are asking for your help to fund 1,500 monthly subscriptions, which will protect thousands of vulnerable drivers, their families and their customers. 100% of your contributions will go towards subscription donations. You can join our initiative by sponsoring from 1 to 50 monthly subscriptions. As a thank you, we will share a documentary video with you demonstrating the reach and impact of your contribution.

How do we protect drivers from the virus?

Our sterilization protocol, which is being used in China to reduce contagion in public transportation vehicles, uses a combination of shortwave ultraviolet light exposure and a deep cleaning with isopropyl alcohol to achieve up to 99.9% sterilization.

UVC is part of the UV light and consists of short, energetic wavelength of light. This is particularly good for destroying genetic material in humans and viral particles. UVC can thus destroy microorganisms. The WHO actually recommends to sterilize water with UVC by simply leaving the water in the sun for six hours. Hospitals, pharmaceutical companies and food manufacturers use UVC to sterilize equipment and products.

Even though there is no study about how UVC affects the Covid-19 specifically, there are studies that have shown that it can be used against very close relatives of the virus, such as Sars. One particular study of the Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research in the USA, found that from all three types of UV light, UVC with the shortest wavelength of 200 to 280 nm, has the best chances of killing the virus by stopping it to reproduce itself. The radiation warps the structure of their genetic material and prevents the viral particles from making more copies of themselves. When being exposed from a distance of 3 centimetres for 6 to 10 minutes, there was a 400-fold decrease in infectious virus. More interestingly, though, is that with an exposure of 15 minutes the virus stopped its reproduction completely!

UV light can cause cancer and destroy genetic material in humans. This is why we included a safety protocol in order to keep our staff and our clients save. We built boxes for cars which shields the rays from the outside world. Once the UV light is turned on, no one is allowed to go into that box until the UV light is turned off again.

 

The situation in Colombia

Covid-19 has changed all of our lives, most likely for a considerable time to come. For some of us, new standards such as social distancing and protective equipment are keeping us relatively safe. However, there is a large vulnerable population who continues to be exposed to the virus, including taxi drivers, cargo operators, healthcare workers, public transportation workers and delivery couriers. These people are the real heroes who are working behind the scenes to keep our cities running. Particularly in Colombia, these heroes are quite exposed because they lack the purchasing power needed to access effective protection. Without proper protection, these workers are putting themselves, their families and their clients at high risk of contracting Covid-19. 

For a city of almost 10 million people, transportation solutions in Bogota are very limited.  The only mass transit solution is a BRT (Bus Rapid Transit) system called Transmilenio. This system has limited reach, so it is complemented with taxis and ride-hailing which make 300K+ trips per day. Moreover, the current avoidance of  mass transportation is leading to a higher reliance on taxis and ride-hailing vehicles. We estimate that in 300 trips, which is approximately a month’s work for an average taxi driver, there is an 80% chance of transporting someone with Covid-19. To add insult to injury, the average taxi driver earns $200-$300 per month, so paying for a proper sterilization service is impossible. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles need an alternative solution.

 

How your donations will be used

100% of your contributions will go towards donating sterilization subscriptions for taxi and ride-hailing drivers, which have a cost of $20 per month. This will allow the driver to come in and get a sterilization as many times as they want for a month. Here is a breakdown of the subscription cost:

  • Labor: 61%
  • Materials: 29%
  • Rent: 9%

 

Other ways that you can help

We understand that not everyone has the resources to donate, especially during this difficult time. If you are unable to donate but still want to help, please feel free to share this campaign with your networks and on social media.

 

About the company & team

Autolab is a Polymath Ventures company, a venture studio building digital platforms to empower the middle-class of Latin America. With over 7 years of experience, Polymath  has designed and launched an additional five successful companies in the region; Aflore, Elenas, Nido, Vincu and Taximo; and was recognized by EY as the rising entrepreneur of the year in 2017.

Autolab Leadership Team

 

Salvador Zepada, Founder & CEO LinkedIn

 

David Quintero, VP of Operations Linkedin

 

Rafael Perez, VP of Technology LinkedIn
story_txt:
Who we are
We are Autolab, a Colombian startup based in Bogota. We have dedicated the last two years building a technology platform for the auto repair industry with the mission of bringing more revenue and stability to small, independent auto repair shops and offering a high quality, affordable auto repair service to middle-class Colombians.


 
How you can help us limit Covid-19 transmission in Colombia
While our core business is shut down due to Colombia’s mandatory shelter-in-place policy, we have redirected our startup's financial and human capital toward a sterilization service for taxis and ride-hailing vehicles to help protect them, their families and their riders from constant exposure to Covid-19. We launched the service in one location and we are subsidizing it to the extent possible. We reduced the price from $5 to $2 and we launched a monthly subscription model that offers unlimited sterilizations for just $20. The driver can come for sterilizations as many times as he/she wants. We believe that we can have a huge impact on drivers and their passengers with this subscription model and by opening more locations. 
Even with these price subsidies, most taxi and ride-hailing drivers do not have the ability to pay. Even something as little as $20 represents 10% of their income. We are asking for your help to fund 1,500 monthly subscriptions, which will protect thousands of vulnerable drivers, their families and their customers. 100% of your contributions will go towards subscription donations. You can join our initiative by sponsoring from 1 to 50 monthly subscriptions. As a thank you, we will share a documentary video with you demonstrating the reach and impact of your contribution.

Labor: 61%

story:
Encounters UFO Xperience Museum

"The Greatest Show Beyond Earth"

Support the opening of the Encounters UFO Xperience Museum. Help support the re-opening of our planet with a donation to the first immersive family fun museum of UFO legends, Alien Artifacts and the Paranormal.

As life on this planet changes - we will all need an 'out of this world' experience! Support an amazing project, create new jobs and help built an exciting new attraction that will be your destination for a close encounter with fun.

Donate today to open the Encounters UFO Xperience Museum. This is an exciting and fun attraction where UFO believers, researchers and the general public enter the world of alien encounters and perhaps confirm the possibility that “we are not alone”.  

Encounters UFO Xperience, the Touring Exhibit had several years of successful engagements across the nation. The incredible journey we have embarked on now takes us to the creation of the new Encounters UFO Xperience Museum in the San Francisco Bay Area with an opening date in October 2020.

The crowd funding campaign will be supporting the core mission to install the seven gallery exhibit into a permanent home with additional exhibits, alien technology, new hands on interactive displays and virtual reality experiences. 

 

 

A Project Ready To Help Economic Recovery

Encounters UFO Xperience Museum will be a leader as the entertainment industry emerges from the Covid crisis. The attraction will provide jobs, support local merchants and support the community. We recognize that this effort is a lot bigger than just our team. We are reaching out to you for empowerment. This crisis has changed the world as we know it, but we are not alone. We are all in this together.

 

A leader in new safety standards

The museum will also be a leader in combining safety, sanitization and community standards into a family fun attraction. Our leadership in venue safety can be an example for others and help roll out entertainment openings across the country.

 

Established in Pop Culture

Wow! Aliens!

The popularity of UFO sightings, aliens, and life on other planets is off the charts. Aliens are everywhere! The latest revelations about UFOs have created a frenzy of interest. The Storming of Area 51 went from a meme to a movement. The United States Navy confirmed that three videos showed unidentified aerial phenomena. The acceptance of extraterrestrial intelligent life is almost main stream. Alien research can be found on television, the internet and in your local bookstore. But where do you go for a real hands-on, up close and live alien encounter? 

 

Encounters UFO Xperience Museum is an immersive, interactive and intelligent attraction designed to transport audiences of all ages into the realms of aliens and the paranormal.

Visitors will discover classic UFO reports, ancient mysteries, military encounters, modern research on ETs and the mesmerizing connections with the paranormal. You will see life size reproductions of alien beings, have a virtual abduction experience, interact with exhibits and get a chance to enter an alien spacecraft. The galleries have special effects, video projection, sound scapes and interactive displays.  Alien encounters from the worlds of art, music, film and pop culture will be on display.  The museum hosts lectures by prominent UFO researchers, books signings, art exhibits along with a children's learning center and cafe area.

 

 

A Popular Touring Exhibit.

Encounters UFO Xperience On Tour was a popular tourist attraction in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina with thousands of visitors.  The Tour had almost 40,000 visitors during its three-week residency at the Arizona State Fair. The next stop was Anaheim Garden Walk near Disneyland, California. Visitors  asked, “Is this from a real alien museum?" For the fans who asked, the new Encounters UFO Xperience Museum is made for you!

 

Help us bring this fan inspired idea to reality!

Support the Encounters UFO Xperience Museum!

Your donation will help us install and open the Encounters UFO Xperience Museum, a permanent home for our amazing exhibits. The family-friendly interactive exhibition features 7 different galleries.﻿﻿ The exhibition content was gathered from the private collections of UFOlogists from around the world.

 

Exhibits are Already Built and Ready for Installation

The new Encounters UFO Xperience Museum will have all the exhibits that fans love all in one place, plus all new interactive, virtual reality and immersive experiences!

 

﻿The galleries are filled with original and replica artifacts, ﻿conceptual models, and exciting audio and visual displays.  

 

The adventure begins in the Gallery of Ancient Aliens where the mysterious Moai statues of Easter Island, the Nazca Lines in Peru, the Giza Pyramids, Aztec carvings and more are represented. Discover unexplained technology from the past. 

 

﻿The Area 51 Gallery brings viewers into the modern era of ufology. This is when the term “flying saucers” came into the general lexicon and government entities began paying attention to UFO sightings. The Roswell, New Mexico incident of 1947 is the launching point for a deep dive into modern UFO culture.

Explorers Gallery includes military documentation of UFO sightings and evidence of alien encounters. The Alien Technology gallery includes technology that seems 'not of this earth' plus alien artifacts. 

 

The Pop Culture Gallery is an impressive display of how UFOs and aliens have invaded books, movies, television, video gaming and pop culture. From the earliest mention of space travel in literature to the latest multi player alien games, this gallery includes movie props, film posters, photos and more.


 

The Abduction Gallery includes never before seen UFO photos including video of UFO eyewitness testimonies plus the Abduction Experience - a unique blend of virtual reality and special effects that bring the visitor closer to experiencing that other kind of visitor. The Paranormal Gallery explores the possible connections with our most loved legends, including Bigfoot, Atlantis, ghosts and more!

 

An Evolving Museum - based on input from the fans.

The galleries will be constantly evolving with new exhibits as more intriguing evidence is discovered. The lecture hall will host talks by UFO experts, screenings of film documentaries, book signings by noted authors and appearances by celebrities known for appearing in alien themed movies or television shows. In the bookstore, visitors can find the best selections of printed and video materials on the subjects of UFOs and the paranormal.  The children's learning center will have interactive play stations and the cafe will quench the thirst of even the most dedicated UFO investigator. This compelling collection will thrill you, chill you and just might turn those with a casual interest into a dedicated alien enthusiast!

 

Safety

In this new world, safety for the public is the highest concern. The Museum will have the latest in sanitation technology to insure a clean, safe environment for visitors. We are partnering with a major technology company who will provide us with the latest Nebulizer Sanitation Technology that eliminates Covid 19 and a host of other pathogens specifically to sanitize public spaces. We anticipate being one of the first public attractions to use this technology.

 

Installation, Integration, Opening

 

A New Home

The exhibits are already built and ready to go. Upgrades and plans for adding virtual reality, new video displays, new artifacts and special effects are in place. All we have to do is move the exhibit into the new location, perform the upgrades and get ready for the grand opening.

 

Location

The first step will be taking the exhibits and installing them into a location in The San Francisco Bay Area. Currently we are planning on a location in Vallejo, California (home to Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, Napa Valley and gateway to San Francisco and Silicon Valley). This is where we will set up the exhibits, perform the upgrades and open to the public. If successful we may continue at this location into 2021. We are also considering locations in Branson, Missouri (The premier Mid West tourist destination with over 10 million visitors per year), Nashville,  and Las Vegas.

 

Timeline

With the complete funding from all sources, we begin the installation at the Vallejo, California location in September 2020 and open the doors in October 2020 in time for the Halloween Season. 

 

Supporting the Community

We are working with other UFO organizations such as Roswell International Data and Research Center, MUFON, the International UFO Congress, The History Channel and the SY-FY Channel making the museum a touch stone for the ever expanding UFO sub culture. Encounters UFO Xperience Museum will be a welcome gathering place for all those who explore, study and believe in alien encounters.

 

Continued Growth

As the museum grows, we look to open satellite Encounters UFO Xperience installations in new locations. These satellite locations will include well known UFO information, with an emphasis on local sightings, encounters and legends.

 

Encounters UFO Xperience Website

 

Key Points

 

       Be part of the solution with your donation

Encounters UFO Xperience Museum is dedicated to doing our part to revive the arts and entertainment industry. By making your donation, you will be a leader as we emerge from the crisis. The museum will provide jobs, support local suppliers and support the community.

 

       New safety standards

As a leader in combining safety, sanitization and community standards into a family fun attraction we will be an example for others and help roll out entertainment openings across the country.

 

       How will my contributions be invested?

All contributions will be invested in full, earmarked to open the Encounters UFO Xperience Museum. Your donation will go towards rent, infrastructure, improvements, materials, and hiring staff.

 

       Perks

Your perks are hand picked from our Alien Depot Gift Shop. All perks include Membership Cards with (1) Free Year of Admission to Encounters UFO Xperience Museum with discounts at the gift shop and discounts on tickets to events. When the doors open,  be sure to bring your Membership Card for free admission !

Become a VIP (Very Intergalactic Person) Sponsor and have your name on our Sponsor Plaque that will hang at the entrance to the museum and  get perks and  invitations to our exclusive VIP events! Take me to your leader!

 

        Self Sustaining and Giving Back

Encounters UFO Xperience Museum will be a self sustaining business generating funds with entry ticket fees and merchandise. Most importantly, we will be creating jobs. When we open we will need people to work at the museum. We also look forward to contributing to the local community providing overflow opportunity to local businesses such as lodging, transportation, restaurants and other local attractions.

 

 

        The Team

We are different type of entertainment company. We value more than just making money; this means supporting community, developing educational programming, and doing our part to support the return of the entertainment industry by creating jobs and opportunity.

 

    

Michael Sawicky has three decades of experience in the entertainment marketing and production profession, including eight years as marketing director for Ringling Brothers Barnum & Bailey Circus and Disney on Ice.

He founded MS Marketing with a client list of national mass appeal family entertainment including Harlem Globetrotters, Sesame Street, Thomas the Train, Bob the Builder plus monster truck shows, professional wrestling, county/ state fairs, consumer shows, Broadway show tours, comedy tours, and music festivals.  He is also a proud US Air Force veteran

 

   

Hugh Kinniburgh devoted fifteen years as the world wide director of media for the artist Thomas Kinkade, supporting galleries, tours, marketing and product development. He founded RCTV Studio, a media company that produces the television/Youtube series Reality Check TV, independent films, music video and corporate marketing media.

Technology clients include Apple, Oracle, Stanford University, UC and USC colleges, and the US Air Force. Media and marketing associates include Walt Disney, Elvis Presley Enterprises, NASCAR, Comcast, CBS, NBC, E! Entertainment, Metal Blade Records and the White House. DIY culture links include Burning Man camps, Maker Fair and the Haight Ashbury Street Fair. He is co-founder of the band Sunz of Alien Technology and an alien enthusiast.

 

Our hands on production team includes entertainment veterans with talents across all disciplines including concert staging, architecture, science, photography, video production, virtual and augmented reality, music, audio engineering, special effects, narrative writing, and more. We are an amazing blend of the commercial and the conceptual.

We champion challenging norms, radical inclusion, weirdness and the power of knowledge to change the world. Our enthusiasm supports the innovative, community focused, DIY culture of UFO research and we want to bring that excitement to fans of all ages and backgrounds.

Encounters UFO Xperience Website

 

The Adventure Begins!

Donate Today! We hope you will join us in creating an exciting destination for alien enthusiast. Be part of the most influential, exciting and fun alien attraction in the universe.

Encounters UFO Xperience Museum!

"It's the Greatest Show Beyond Earth!"

He founded RCTV Studio, a media company that produces the television/Youtube series Reality Check TV, independent films, music video and corporate marketing media.Technology clients include Apple, Oracle, Stanford University, UC and USC colleges, and the US Air Force. Media and marketing associates include Walt Disney, Elvis Presley Enterprises, NASCAR, Comcast, CBS, NBC, E! Entertainment, Metal Blade Records and the White House. DIY culture links include Burning Man camps, Maker Fair and the Haight Ashbury Street Fair. He is co-founder of the band Sunz of Alien Technology and an alien enthusiast. Our hands on production team includes entertainment veterans with talents across all disciplines including concert staging, architecture, science, photography, video production, virtual and augmented reality, music, audio engineering, special effects, narrative writing, and more. We are an amazing blend of the commercial and the conceptual.We champion challenging norms, radical inclusion, weirdness and the power of knowledge to change the world. Our enthusiasm supports the innovative, community focused, DIY culture of UFO research and we want to bring that excitement to fans of all ages and backgrounds.Encounters UFO Xperience Website The Adventure Begins!Donate Today! We hope you will join us in creating an exciting destination for alien enthusiast. Be part of the most influential, exciting and fun alien attraction in the universe.Encounters UFO Xperience Museum! "It's the Greatest Show Beyond Earth!"

story:
Help us recharge the Electric Cycle Company

In our 10 years at our store on Granton Road, we have seen our turnover increase over 500% and our staff go from 2 to 10 at present with a bigger electric bike range than anyone else. This is something I could never have imagined when my family started the business from the back of my Dad's builder's office in 2006.

We've always been at the forefront of the eBike business since we started,  reinvesting all our profits back into the business to have the biggest selection of demo eBikes anywhere in Scotland to provide our customers at the forefront of the eBike revolution.

We have managed to secure a lease on a 4000 sq foot premises about half a mile from our current store (which we will be turning into an eBike centric social enterprise).  This will let us create the largest eBike showroom in the UK. As part of the development, we want to make this showroom, carbon-neutral, harvesting solar power and heating the premises using the waste we produce.

We want to save you money with your eBike and we want to leverage future services and sales to help us create this space.

With your help, we can turn this into an amazing space to begin or continue your eBike journey in a more comfortable, spacious and safer environment (our current store is a bit small for adequate social distancing for more than 2 or 3 customers at a time).

 

What's in it for you? (and us)

Let us tell you...

  • We have designed a range of perks that will save you money in the real world.
  • We're not looking for free handouts. These perks offer value for your much-appreciated contribution. 
  • With your help, we believe we will be able to make our store as close to carbon-neutral as possible while creating an amazing new retail experience.
  • We will have a bigger, more diverse range of eBikes than anyone else, giving you, our valued customer real choice. 
  • We will be free of manufacturers' input so able to give you our unbiased honest opinion.

 

The Impact

We don't want to be another faceless bike shop, we could have moved to bigger cheaper premises away from where we are now but we really like being part of our local community.

  • With your financial support, as well as the fantastic perks we will be able to afford to give all our customers added value with things like extended guarantees, free security marking and free updates.
  • We can keep up our work giving back to the North Edinburgh Community and supporting local charities.
  • We will be able to donate most of the workshop tools and non eBike specific tools to the social enterprise we have planned for our existing premises.
  • We will create a retail experience that is as carbon neutral as possible. 

 

Bike Marking with Police Scotland and Granton Youth

 

Risks & Challenges

This is going to be hard work but our team is committed and a few of us have construction experience and are a bit handy with a paintbrush! We also have a couple of customers lined up to help with plumbing, electrics and carpentry.

It should take us around 6 weeks to turn around and we should get keys in the next week so we need to hit the ground running.

Our only issue is our suppliers being able to keep up with the demand for eBikes that we're experiencing right now.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that some people just can't contribute given the current climate but that doesn't mean you can't help us (we'd really appreciate this).

  • Tell your friends and colleagues that might be considering an eBike about our campaign and make some noise about the Electric Cycle Companies plans.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools below to spread the word!

 

Thanks very much for taking the time to read this and consider giving us your hard-earned cash.

Hopefully we'll be able to welcome you all  to our new home soon (The kettle or coffee machine will always be on instore)

Neill Hope

Owner of the Electric Cycle Company

story:
About Me

I first picked up a golf club the week of the 1997 Masters. Tiger Woods was lapping the field, and I was hooked. I have had the pleasure of working in the game for the last 15 years, and still enjoy it as much as I did in 1997. The satisfaction of helping someone improve their game will never grow old. Golf has played a wonderful role in my life, and I want to help others share in that passion!

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $23,500 in startup costs to get this business off the ground. The funds will go exclusively to the purchase of simulators, and to securing a central location in Evergreen. 

All pledges will be considered pre-sales, and you will be receiving a discounted rate from when we open this fall. Purchase simulator time, or a membership now, and help make year round golf in Evergreen a reality!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Even if you can't contribute, I would be so grateful to anyone who shared this campaign on social media, or told a friend. I want Snow or Shine to be a family friendly staple in the Evergreen community for a long time to come!

story:
"Let food unite, empower, grow, and celebrate our local community"

The inspiration for the GastroPark has always been rooted in creating a community gathering place that thrives while featuring and supporting other local small businesses.  Food has been a powerful unifier throughout history, and we believe it to be the best way to bring people together. The GastroPark is a celebration of food, art, and culture which is fueled by the local entrepreneurial spirit.

What is GastroPark and why it's needed?

GastroPark is a well curated food experience for guests featuring an innovative approach that will deliver delicious mobile food concepts from local small business owners.   

Concepts like GastroPark currently exist within the “experiential dining” category and this segment is growing quickly across the country. These concepts allow entrepreneurs and small businesses the opportunity to test, launch, or scale a business in a way that is fiscally responsible and does not require someone to mortgage their future as they pursue their food business dreams.

The GastroPark will be a valuable venue for new and existing food trucks as well as other concepts.  We aim to provide both a launching pad for a new business as well as a proving ground for existing brick-and-mortar restaurants looking to expand their reach and revenue.

COVID-19 may have changed the landscape of how we “gather” at this time, but we believe our concept is positioned to thrive during these restrictive circumstances.  GastroPark has plenty of outdoor seating, streamlined staffing (that protects guests and staff), smart design, and will use cooperative strategies to mitigate overhead expenses.  These factors help create an adaptive environment for the current market needs; while allowing the business, and its local vendor partners, to operate efficiently and safely during difficult economic times.

Our story so far...

We approached the Town of West Hartford way back in the summer of 2016 regarding zoning changes that would allow food trucks and food truck parks. In 2017, zoning was passed for the Industrial District of West Hartford and later that year we purchased an old auto-body shop off New Park Avenue. Throughout 2018 we worked with our architect, engineer, and contractor to redesign the property, creating a unique indoor/outdoor venue unlike anything in Connecticut.  In the fall of 2019, following a public hearing, our special use permit application was approved.  This permit gave us the green light to apply for construction permits.

            Over the past year the property has undergone significant improvements; including tie-ins to the storm and sewer systems, a 15 foot retaining wall to relocate the parking from the front to the rear of our facility to comply with zoning regulations as well as significant site work to redesign the outdoor dining and driving areas.

            Throughout the process we have navigated several delays and zoning hurdles.  Recent economic and financial challenges associated with COVID-19 have only reinforced our belief that the GastroPark concept will be reliable, helpful, even important to empower and provide small and start-up businesses a safe platform during pandemic life.  

We need your help!

Our team (and friends, family, and believers) has invested an extensive amount of time and resources to bring this project to life. We are almost there, but access to necessary capital from traditional lenders isn’t.  Banks are currently not as likely to lend to start-ups during the pandemic.  We still need funds and are asking for your help to finish the buildout of the outdoor dining area and our indoor restrooms.   With your help the GastroPark will become a reality.

In exchange for your support, we are offering a number of perks that will provide a number of experiences and benefits to supporters looking for exclusive GastroPark opportunities. 

The Impact you will make

By supporting GastroPark, you are not only empowering one business, you are helping create a platform that will provide community value. A platform that will encourage economic growth to a network of other small local businesses.

Why now?

Let’s face it. The world isn’t easy for small businesses. This is even more true for restaurants and food related concepts. As profit margins shrink and expenses grow, entrepreneurs are constantly thrown new challenges.  Product overhead, payroll, rent hikes, and now COVID-19 are all serious factors in a business' success.  

Let’s do a quick review of what makes GastroPark so well designed to operate during the most challenging economic circumstances all while providing a platform of success for other small businesses:

  • Outdoor dining: Over 50% of seating is outside with plenty of room for social distancing.
  • Value: Food trucks are an affordable and delicious dining option.
  • Low overhead: Our food truck and vendor partnerships enable us to reduce volatile areas of overhead while empowering small business growth.
  • Streamlined staffing: We will be able to deliver exceptional experience while reducing potential for hands on contamination.
  • Opportunity: Our curated and rotating food truck lineup will provide vending and employment opportunity to many small businesses.
  • Variety: A constantly rotating line-up of food options means something for everyone and you don't need to compromise on what your family eats for dinner.
  • Empowerment: More people will be able to pursue their small business dreams without the reliance on costly loans, long-term leases and other fiscal variables that stifle creativity and economic growth.
