story:
Your donation will help finance a Firefly Charger business in an impoverished Ugandan village!

Ruth (not in the video above) will be our first Firefly Charger businesswoman!  She lives in the Sparrow Home of Hope at Divine Holistic Ministries in Buetma, Uganda.  She is a widow, has three children (all in school), and loves God in a big way.  We don't have a good picture of Ruth yet, but we will supply one later in a campaign update.

Ruth represents everything we're trying to do here.  Let's help her start her own Njeru lighting business!

Please note that the proceeds of this campaign will not go directly to Ruth, but will be used by Green Buck Labs (see "Who are we?" below) to pay for her Firefly Charger, shipping, and associated expenses.

Once we have this first business in place, we will have a repeatable process that we can use to launch on a global scale.  You will be helping entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient while lighting their own communities.  Our goal to help impoverished communities help themselves.
  

Scroll down to learn about the Firefly Charger project!

  • What's the BIG global problem?
  • What is a Firefly Charger?
  • Are Firefly Chargers different than other lighting solutions?
  • How will local entrepreneurs afford to buy Firefly Chargers?
  • What is our goal for this campaign?
  • Who are we?
  • What's in a Firefly Charger?
  • How far along are we?
  • What all can a Firefly Charger be used for?
  • What do we need your help with?
  • What will you get in return?
  • What will be the impact from this effort?
  • Are there other ways to help than money?


What's the BIG global problem?

About 1/5th of the world's population is still in the dark and more or less in a permanent electrical blackout.  Our answer to the problem is the Firefly Charger. 

Source:  International Energy Agency

What is a Firefly Charger?

A Firefly Charger is a portable kit containing all of the components needed to provide simple lighting for up to 20 homes at a time.  Each kit will include bright LED light strings, rechargeable batteries, and solar battery chargers. 

Are Firefly Chargers different than other lighting solutions?

Unlike other types of solar lighting, the Firefly Charger is a business in a box for local entrepreneurs in developing communities to profit from.  We will be helping these communities to help themselves.

       
The local entrepreneurs will lend light strings to residents and recharge their batteries for a fee.  Each market would determine its own price for the service depending upon what its residents could afford to pay -- just like any other business.

How will local entrepreneurs afford to buy Firefly Chargers?

Most of the local entrepreneurs we are talking about will not have the money to purchase Firefly Charger kits.  Initially, we will use the proceeds from this campaign to finance the kits for them.  The entrepreneurs will pay back these loans from the revenue they receive.  Then we will use the re-paid loans to make loans for additional kits -- and so on, and so forth.

Eventually, will be using an online micro-lending platform like Kiva.org to help them in finance the purchase of kits.  Kiva.org is a social lending site which allows people to loan as little as $25 to help people in developing communities to start businesses (and to do other things).

What is our goal for this campaign?

The goal of this campaign is to get the first such lighting rental service running!  Once we have this first business in place, we will have a system that we can repeat with other local entrepreneurs again and again.

Who are we?

Brian Martin is the inventor of the patent pending Firefly Charger.  He has spent a majority of his savings and spare time developing it over the last five years.  During this time, he pulled in 18 friends who have more money, contacts and resources than him.  This team is now organized as Green Buck Labs, Inc. (www.fireflycharger.com).

 

For most of those years, this was actually a wind energy project.  Since Brian and his wife live at a church, the congregation has gotten to witness (and often laugh at) eight unique prototypes whipping in the wind.  However, the project took a 180 degree turn one day when the latest wind turbine prototype was nearing completion.  The missionary on the team said that where this thing was going (i.e. equatorial countries), there was plenty of sun not much wind.  Not long after that, the Firefly Charger was born.

CFO Todd Dangel and Brian Martin

Green Buck Labs is a for-profit, Ohio "C" Corporation.  It is a social enterprise structured to develop and deliver humanitarian products as quickly as possible to those who need them most.

          

What's in a Firefly Charger?

The Firefly Charger is a portable kit containing all of the components needed to light up to 20 homes (or rooms).  It contains:
  • 2 solar battery chargers (charges AA, AAA, C, D, 9V)
  • 20 bright LED light strings w/ 20 LEDs each
  • Enough rechargeable batteries to run 20 light strings (approx. 1 week between charges)
  • 1 Battery charge tester
  • Containers for sorting batteries
  • Transparent Lid - Leave the entire kit outside to charge the batteries

How far along are we?

Since the original Firefly Charger "napkin sketch", we have done the following:
  • Produced production-quality prototypes
  • Our team's own missionary is currently testing a prototype in a dark community (Uganda - Africa)
  • Received U.S. Patent Pending status
  • Made deals with some component suppliers for wholesale discounts 

       

What all can a Firefly Charger be used for?

Developing Countries

  • Battery & light string exchange businesses run by entrepreneurs 
  • Battery & light string exchanges run by churches/missions

Everyone Else

  • Emergency backup lighting during blackouts and disasters

What do we need your help with?

We're looking to raise enough money from donors like you in order to get the first lighting business started overseas.

This will involve:

  • Finding several entrepreneur candidates (probably in Uganda - Africa)
  • Manufacturing a Firefly Charger kit
  • Lending money to the leading entrepreneur candidate
  • Sending the Firefly Charger to the entrepreneur -- this will be the biggest expense
  • Helping them to get going by offering help online when available or through local helpers

What will you get in return?

*** See the "Perks" to find out what you'll receive for donating different amounts.
Components included in the Perks like light strings, chargers, and rechargeable batteries are the same components that will be sent to entrepreneurs overseas.

Also, all of the physical Perks are listed as "U. S. only" because of high international shipping costs.   We wanted to be sure that a majority of your donation goes towards funding the project goal instead of the perk. 
Physical perks like light strings or firefly jars will be delivered shortly after the campaign has closed and the project funds are withdrawn.

What will be the impact from this effort?

On a personal level, we will be helping an impoverished entrepreneur in a developing country to become self-sufficient.  We will also be helping to light dark homes.

On a societal level, we will be helping to "Light the World" and boost ultra-poor regions economically. 

Pretty cool stuff!


More residents of Uganda who are testing the Firefly Charger!

Are there other ways to help than money?

If you're unable to contribute, but still want to help, please consider sharing this project with others.  There may be someone in your network who has the ability to make this happen!
story_txt:
Your donation will help finance a Firefly Charger business in an impoverished Ugandan village!


Ruth (not in the video above) will be our first Firefly Charger businesswoman!  She lives in the Sparrow Home of Hope at Divine Holistic Ministries in Buetma, Uganda.  She is a widow, has three children (all in school), and loves God in a big way.  We don't have a good picture of Ruth yet, but we will supply one later in a campaign update.
Ruth represents everything we're trying to do here.  Let's
help her start her own Njeru lighting business!
Please note that the proceeds of this campaign will not go directly to Ruth, but will be used by Green Buck Labs (see "Who are we?" below) to pay for her Firefly Charger, shipping, and associated expenses.


Once we have this first business in place, we will have a repeatable process that we can use to launch on a global scale.  You will be helping entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient while lighting their own communities.  Our goal to help impoverished communities help themselves.

  





Scroll down to learn about the Firefly Charger project!


What's the BIG global problem?


What is a Firefly Charger?


Are Firefly Chargers different than other lighting solutions?

How will local entrepreneurs afford to buy Firefly Chargers?
What is our goal for this campaign?
Who are we?

What's in a Firefly Charger?

How far along are we?

What all can a Firefly Charger be used for?

What do we need your help with?

What will you get in return?

What will be the impact from this effort?

Are there other ways to help than money?




What's the BIG global problem?



About 1/5th of the world's population is still in the dark and more or less in a permanent electrical blackout.  Our answer to the problem is the Firefly Charger. 



Source:  International Energy Agency




What is a Firefly Charger?
A Firefly Charger is a portable kit containing all of the components needed to provide simple lighting for up to 20 homes at a time.  Each kit will include bright LED light strings, rechargeable batteries, and solar battery chargers. 













Are Firefly Chargers different than other lighting solutions?

Unlike other types of solar lighting, the Firefly Charger is a business in a box for local entrepreneurs in developing communities to profit from.  We will be helping these communities to help themselves.




       

The local entrepreneurs will lend light strings to residents and recharge their batteries for a fee.  Each market would determine its own price for the service depending upon what its residents could afford to pay -- just like any other business.

How will local entrepreneurs afford to buy Firefly Chargers?

Most of the local entrepreneurs we are talking about will not have the money to purchase Firefly Charger kits.  Initially, we will use the proceeds from this campaign to finance the kits for them.  The entrepreneurs will pay back these loans from the revenue they receive.  Then we will use the re-paid loans to make loans for additional kits -- and so on, and so forth.




Eventually, will be using an online micro-lending platform like Kiva.org to help them in finance the purchase of kits.  Kiva.org is a social lending site which allows people to loan as little as $25 to help people in developing communities to start businesses (and to do other things).





What is our goal for this campaign?
The goal of this campaign is to get the first such lighting rental service running!  Once we have this first business in place, we will have a system that we can repeat with other local entrepreneurs again and again.






Who are we?


Brian Martin is the inventor of the patent pending Firefly Charger.  He has spent a majority of his savings and spare time developing it over the last five years.  During this time, he pulled in 18 friends who have more money, contacts and resources than him.  This team is now organized as Green Buck Labs, Inc. (www.fireflycharger.com).


 



For most of those years, this was actually a wind energy project.  Since Brian and his wife live at a church, the congregation has gotten to witness (and often laugh at) eight unique prototypes whipping in the wind.  However, the project took a 180 degree turn one day when the latest wind turbine prototype was nearing completion.  The missionary on the team said that where this thing was going (i.e. equatorial countries), there was plenty of sun not much wind.  Not long after that, the Firefly Charger was born.


CFO Todd Dangel and Brian Martin
Green Buck Labs is a for-profit, Ohio "C" Corporation.  It is a social enterprise structured to develop and deliver humanitarian products as quickly as possible to those who need them most.

          

What's in a Firefly Charger?
The Firefly Charger is a portable kit containing all of the components needed to light up to 20 homes (or rooms).  It contains:
2 solar battery chargers (charges AA, AAA, C, D, 9V)
20 bright LED light strings w/ 20 LEDs each
Enough rechargeable batteries to run 20 light strings (approx. 1 week between charges)
1 Battery charge tester
Containers for sorting batteries
Transparent Lid - Leave the entire kit outside to charge the batteries



How far along are we?
Since the original Firefly Charger "napkin sketch", we have done the following:


Produced production-quality prototypes


Our team's own missionary is currently testing a prototype in a dark community (Uganda - Africa)


Received U.S. Patent Pending status


Made deals with some component suppliers for wholesale discounts 



       

What all can a Firefly Charger be used for?


Developing Countries

Battery & light string exchange businesses run by entrepreneurs 
Battery & light string exchanges run by churches/missions

Everyone Else

Emergency backup lighting during blackouts and disasters


What do we need your help with?

We're looking to raise enough money from donors like you in order to get the first lighting business started overseas.
This will involve:


Finding several entrepreneur candidates (probably in Uganda - Africa)
Manufacturing a Firefly Charger kit
Lending money to the leading entrepreneur candidate
Sending the Firefly Charger to the entrepreneur -- this will be the biggest expense
Helping them to get going by offering help online when available or through local helpers



What will you get in return?


 
*** See the "Perks" to find out what you'll receive for donating different amounts.

Components included in the Perks like light strings, chargers, and rechargeable batteries are the same components that will be sent to entrepreneurs overseas.




Also, all of the physical Perks are listed as "U. S. only" because of high international shipping costs.   We wanted to be sure that a majority of your donation goes towards funding the project goal instead of the perk. 

Physical perks like light strings or firefly jars will be delivered shortly after the campaign has closed and the project funds are withdrawn.
  

What will be the impact from this effort?

On a personal level, we will be helping an impoverished entrepreneur in a developing country to become self-sufficient.  We will also be helping to light dark homes.
On a societal level, we will be helping to "Light the World" and boost ultra-poor regions economically. 
Pretty cool stuff!
More residents of Uganda who are testing the Firefly Charger!


Are there other ways to help than money?
 If you're unable to contribute, but still want to help, please consider sharing this project with others.  There may be someone in your network who has the ability to make this happen!

story:
28% OF OUR FIRST TARGET REACHED SO FAR, 5 DAYS LEFT! PLEASE PARTICIPATE AND SPREAD THE WORD, THESE INITIATIVES MATTER!



OUR ARTISTS HAVE BEEN FEATURED IN:






OUR DOCUMENTARY

We will release one chapter for every week of this crowdfunding campaign! :) ENJOY!

CHAPTER 1/5: Insight in Moroccan Contemporary Culture



CHAPTER 2/5: The Artists



Chapter 3/5: The Challenges



Chapter 4/5: The Community



Chapter 5/5: The Future

WHO WE ARE

Kahenas is a community of artists, artisans, and designers from Morocco. It is the first e-commerce platform for contemporary Moroccan culture. 

We launched a few months ago with the hope of representing this new wave of extremely talented voices that have something inspiring to offer and a progressive message to send from the Arab World. Every single artist we approached has agreed to be a part of this adventure, from powerhouse Hassan Hajjaj to young, emerging artists. We were also very touched to see that our customers hail from around the world, from Shanghai to NYC, and from Dakar to Lugano. In total, we now represent 25 artists & brands, carry over 300 products, and have shipped to more than 15 countries. 

BUT, for an e-commerce so centered around the community, we felt like something was missing. And that 'something' was an offline interaction with our public. We decided to start organizing and participating in offline events, first hosting a brunch at Fellah Hotel in Marrakech, and then traveling to (one of) Paris' temple of cool, La Gaite Lyrique, for a pop up shop. 

So, after Marrakech and Paris, we would like the next stop on Kahenas' Pop Up Tour to be NYC, capital of contemporary culture, where we hope to organize:

  • Meet & Greet with some of our artists.
  • A 5-day Pop Up Shop.
  • Launch of 2 Limited Edition surprise products!

WHO WE ARE IN A 2 MIN VIDEO REEL



TAKE KAHENAS TO NYC!


Our 3-Point Plan (Where your money goes)

We need $35k USD, which can be broken down into three as shown on the visual above:
  • The first $15k USD will go to organizing the Pop Up Shop in NYC and all associated costs including transport of goods, renting the space, preparing the space & inviting the artists for a very funky meet & greet. 
  • The next $10k USD will go to the design and production of two exclusive products for the Pop Up Shop. The first one from rockstar fashion designer Amine Bendriouich, and the second one from beauty queen (and equally talented) Sofia El Arabi!
  • The final $10k will allow us to begin our long-awaited effort to start branching out of Morocco in into the rest of Africa and the Middle East. We hope to eventually cover the Middle East and Africa, and bring you the most inspiring creative minds from this region. 
  • If we don't reach our first goal of $15k USD, we will look for sponsors or institutional partners to complete the difference and ONLY use the money once we reach $15K USD!

KAHENAS' IMPACT

In a world so divided and full of selective communication, we want to offer a refreshing voice of hope and emphasize a community that continues to create and be inspired. Starting in Morocco, but with the ambition to find, meet, and invite artists from other African and Arab countries to join as soon as we can. Supporting Kahenas is supporting a narrative of unity, diversity, and creativity from all regions of the world. It's saying that stigmatization and stereotyping are wrong always, and that it is by focusing on the commonalities rather than the differences that we can move forward together. 


THE TEAM

We are based in Casablanca, Morocco, more precisely in the industrial neighborhood of Ain Sebaa! 
  • ARTISTS AND BLOGGERS: The essence of Kahenas, the ones that make this community possible and for which we have created this platform.
  • SAKI: The all-powerful GM, Saki, raised in Bruxelles, joined the team in July 2014, and since then, has pushed us hard to make this happen. Her leadership has allowed us to pivot, and her will to succeed is only matched by her passion for Morocco's creative minds.
  • CHAFS: The founder, the creative spirit and the link that brought together the different talents Morocco has to offer. Chafs' determination to bring Kahenas to life created a solid community of people that share his vision and who contribute to keep the concept growing.
  • BLEND: Our consultants, the ones who listen to us and turn our ideas into beautiful visuals. We needed a company that not only understood where we were headed with this, but that believed in it. Blend is that and more, and we are so happy to have them with us.

FROM CASABLANCA TO NYC


(Inshallah Sweater by Sofia El Arabi, NYC, 2014)

A PIECE OF MOROCCO'S WARMTH WITH YOU ALWAYS.

story:
My name is Filver Ricardo Valdez. I live in Cusco, Peru. I own a small travel business in Cusco. I am an officially registered tour guide. My business provides guided tours to locations around Cusco, as well as spiritual tours to sacred sites such as Machu Picchu.
     I use my Toyota Corolla, but recently the transportation regulations in Cusco changed so that I also need a small SUV.
     I am seeking funds to buy a small SUV. Unlike in a other countries, car loans are difficult to obtain because of the banks´requirements. Also, the import duties on cars into Peru are very high.  I will sell my Toyota. However, the amount I will receive for the car will not be enough to cover the purchase price of a small SUV.
     I need a small SUV in order to meet the requirements of the transport regulations and to provide comfort to my passengers.
     Having a SUV will fulfill my dream of sharing as much of Cusco and its environs as possible with the many tourists arriving in Cusco who seek a driver/guide who provides well-researched information, has a passion for sharing his knowledge and is responsive to the needs of his clients.
     Having a small SUV will be another step toward realizing my goal of expanding my business into a tour agency. Another goal is to help tourists who feel helpless and need assistance because of lost or stolen possessions, medical emergencies or other catastrophic circumstances.
     If I don´t reach my goal of $17,600, I will use the donations to buy a secondhand small SUV.
     Please don´t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about my campaign.





































I

story:
Short Summary

Dr Prepper’s Gun, Knife & Survivalist Expo will be coming to the DeltaPlex on Grand Rapids North West side on or before the weekend of the 11th, 12th & 13th of Sept 2015. The first weekend after summer.

Our goal is to provide the best Expo experience possible including guest appearances by the likes of Duck Commander or other cast members of Duck Dynasty, Bear Grylls or other nationally recognized celebrities.

Find out how you can become a part of making this event happen!

*******************************************************************************

Dr Prepper’s Gun, Knife & Survivalists Expo’s are dedicated to producing the most professional, safest and ethical gun shows in the country. We strive to provide our patrons with the best available selection of firearms, ammo, knives and related merchandise, hunting, camping and survival gear and our dealers with the largest crowds of qualified buyers anywhere, while always doing all we can do to protect the Constitution of the United States of America.

What We Need & What You Get

$10 Thank you from the 2nd amendment

$10 1 General Admission Ticket

$25 2 General Admission Tickets and a pocket constitution

$50 2 VIP Tickets

$75 2 VIP Tickets & back stage pass and parking

$100 Family Pack (up to 6)Tickets & back stage pass  Plus 3D printable gun files

$250   2 Hr @ your local gun range w/200 rd ammo 9mm/45Plus 3D printable gun files

$500 a 10 table POD or Local CCW/Shooting instruction Class Plus 3D printable gun files

$1000 Guns80.com 805 AR-15 kit or 30 x 20 booth and a 10 table POD Plus 3D printable gun files


The money will be used to secure:

  • the event location ($4500 3 days)

  • utilities ($1000)

  • insurances ($1000)

  • Billboards - Event registration ($1500)

  • radio & TV advertising - Event registration($2000)

Money from the sale of Table and display space will go towards the cost of advertising the actual event and the purchase of several gun related items used for door prizes and drawings.

The Impact

This event will have a huge impact on the local community and send a message that gun ownership is on the rise.

Risks & Challenges

There is always the risk that laws could change and leave us in a rush trying to catch up.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
(Scroll down for English version)
Auta meitä auttamaan. Henkilökohtaisesti. Ei kasvottomia organisaatioita. Vaan me, avoimena ja vastuullisina. Tämä ei ole rahankeräys, vaan sinä ostat mainitut tuotteet ja ne toimitetaan Gambiaan
Kuljimme syksyllä 2014 pyhiinvaelluksen Sarriasta Santiago de Compostelaan Pohjois-Espanjassa. Se oli merkittävä matka meille niin yksilöinä kuin yhdessä. Janin vakava sairaus olisi voinut olla este koko matkalle ja erittäin hyvä syy sen keskeyttämiselle. Mutta me teimme sen, yhdessä toisiamme tukien. 
Ja matka jatkuu....
Me emme elä täällä itseksemme emmekä itsellemme. Me tarvitsemme toinen toisiamme. Yhteistyö on elinehto.
Olemme saaneet kokea niin paljon hyvää omassa elämässämme, että haluamme jakaa siitä muillekin. Aina maan ääriin saakka. Ja kutsumme sinua mukaan auttamaan. Täällä kertaa avustuskohteenamme on Gambia ja siellä olevien sairaaloiden varustaminen Hyöty&Työ -projektin kanssa yhteistyössä. Tarkoituksena on, että maaliskuussa 2015 saamme lähtemään kontillisen sairaalatarvikkeita meriteitse kohti Gambiaa ja menemme itse vastaanottamaan kontin huhtikuussa ja varmistamaan, että apu menee perille. 
Jani Karlsson alias Jansku on psykologi, jolla on pitkä työhistoria kansainvälisessä liiketoiminnassa ja on erikoistunut kumppanuuksien ja pitkäjänteisten strategioiden luomiseen. Hän on myös kirjailija sekä Kanttarelli Publishingin kustannusjohtaja.
Anumari Väistö alias Ansku on yleislääkäri, joka on koulutuksensa aikana perehtynyt kehitysyhteistyöprojekteihin. Hän on myös kirjailija.
Jos et pysty tukemaan hanketta taloudellisesti, voit auttaa meitä levittämällä tietoa projektista.

Pää-sponsori: Tommy Palm


Help us to help. In person. No faceless organizations. Just us, open and responsible. This is not fundraising! You are buying the products, and they will be shipped to Gambia by us and Hyöty & Työ ry
In Autumn 2014 we did a pilgrimage from Sarria to Santiago de Compostela in northern Spain. It was a very meaningful trip for both of us as individuals as well as us together. Jani's serious disease could have prevented the whole trip. It would also have been a perfectly good excuse to abort it. But we did it, helping each other along the way.
And the journey continues...
We don't live here just for ourselves. We need each-other. Co-operation is a necessity.
We have received so much good in our lives that we want to give something back. To the ends of the world, if needed. And we invite you to join us!
This time the target are hospitals in Gambia, bringing sorely needed medical equipment there. A container full of medical equipment will be sent to Gambia in March 2015. And moreover, we will go there in person in April to help and make sure that the contributions go to the right place. We work with Hyöty  & Työ -organisation who has a long history in this work.
Jani Karlsson alias Jansku is a psychologist with a long history in international trade. He has specialised in creating international partnerships and creating long term strategies and projects. He is also an author and the director of publishing in Kanttarelli Publishing.
Anumari Väistö alias Ansku is a doctor who has participated in development co-operation projects during her studies. She is also an author. 
If you can't help us financially we would really appreciate if you share the word about this project.
Main Sponsor: Tommy Palm
Kind regards/Terveisin,
Ansku ja Jansku

Täällä kertaa avustuskohteenamme on Gambia ja siellä olevien sairaaloiden varustaminen Hyöty&Työ -projektin kanssa yhteistyössä. Tarkoituksena on, että maaliskuussa 2015 saamme lähtemään kontillisen sairaalatarvikkeita meriteitse kohti Gambiaa ja menemme itse vastaanottamaan kontin huhtikuussa ja varmistamaan, että apu menee perille. 
Jani Karlsson alias Jansku on psykologi, jolla on pitkä työhistoria kansainvälisessä liiketoiminnassa ja on erikoistunut kumppanuuksien ja pitkäjänteisten strategioiden luomiseen. Hän on myös kirjailija sekä Kanttarelli Publishingin kustannusjohtaja.
Anumari Väistö alias Ansku on yleislääkäri, joka on koulutuksensa aikana perehtynyt kehitysyhteistyöprojekteihin. Hän on myös kirjailija.
Jos et pysty tukemaan hanketta taloudellisesti, voit auttaa meitä levittämällä tietoa projektista.

Pää-sponsori: Tommy Palm


Help us to help. In person. No faceless organizations. Just us, open and responsible. This is not fundraising! You are buying the products, and they will be shipped to Gambia by us and Hyöty & Työ ry
In Autumn 2014 we did a pilgrimage from Sarria to Santiago de Compostela in northern Spain. It was a very meaningful trip for both of us as individuals as well as us together. Jani's serious disease could have prevented the whole trip. It would also have been a perfectly good excuse to abort it. But we did it, helping each other along the way.
And the journey continues...
We don't live here just for ourselves. We need each-other. Co-operation is a necessity.
We have received so much good in our lives that we want to give something back. To the ends of the world, if needed. And we invite you to join us!
This time the target are hospitals in Gambia, bringing sorely needed medical equipment there. A container full of medical equipment will be sent to Gambia in March 2015. And moreover, we will go there in person in April to help and make sure that the contributions go to the right place. We work with Hyöty  & Työ -organisation who has a long history in this work.
Jani Karlsson alias Jansku is a psychologist with a long history in international trade. He has specialised in creating international partnerships and creating long term strategies and projects. He is also an author and the director of publishing in Kanttarelli Publishing.
Anumari Väistö alias Ansku is a doctor who has participated in development co-operation projects during her studies. She is also an author. 
If you can't help us financially we would really appreciate if you share the word about this project.
Main Sponsor: Tommy Palm
Kind regards/Terveisin,
Ansku ja Jansku

story:
What IS Hip, Slick & GEEK?

Hip, Slick, & GEEK is a dedicated retail center designed for the pop culture-loving GEEK, set to open in 2016 in Richardson, Texas.  An elaborate offering of pop-culture items will be on hand, related to particular brands or "fandoms" (the comic book, TV series, and movie properties that Geeks & Nerds love and follow with enthusiasm)-  apparel, collectibles, housewares, handmade items and unique wares that any GEEK could want. We will also have a section for our guests who are interested in Cosplay. Our inventory will be shown in custom-designed displays which are set up in specific sections depending on fandom. We will also have a Café where visitors can enjoy different flavored drinks, delicious treats, and play some classic video arcade games, along with a few other surprises.  Hip, Slick & GEEK is working to start this adventure literally from the ground up; from a retail space, empty save for ducts and dust, to a geek paradise, specially designed to mimic the art direction of a theme park, while providing the best aspects of boutique, arcade, and cafe. The vision is grand and in need of more than bookshelves and hangers to bring it to life. This will be an ever-changing, structurally entertaining establishment that brings life to your favorite fandoms and makes you a part of the fantasy.

Our mission is to create an enriching and epically exciting retail experience, to  entertain, enlighten, and inform all those who come through our doors. We are creating THE GEEK shop for the Dallas area.

Player One, START!

In creating the shop, our intention is to be hand-in-hand and shoulder-to-shoulder with fellow GEEKS. We're working to create a place where people who love fandoms (comic book characters, TV shows, movies, anime, etc.) will have a place to purchase the collectible items that represent them, while also offering exclusives and items that are "off the map" i.e. things you don't find in mainstream stores. 

In the Dallas area, there are plenty of comic book and toy stores that offer plenty for their fans.There are also different fan conventions that come through the city, but not everyone is able to go. We are NOT a comic book store! Instead we're doing something a bit different- a retail space with an inviting atmosphere, a place to see the friends you haven't met yet, full of various toys, clothing, and a relaxing cafe that you're sure to enjoy! We're GEEKS year-round, not once every few months. We breathe GEEK!

 Your level-up bonus is...

We're seeking to raise a minimum of $275,000 for start-up capital as well as initial operations. Now, what is all of that for, you ask- first there's the business, licensing and tax fees in order to legally operate in Texas and for brands that we'll be carrying in the store, plus managing our online sales. A significant portion is for the build-out and design of the store space, from the ground up, including all of the modern technology that we'll have on hand to meet your shopping needs (you'll definitely dig what we do there!). We will also need funds to be able to hire a minimum staff.  Last and by no means least, we'll need funds to purchase inventory including all of the cool stuff that you'll be able to get in the shop, plus the tasty treats to enjoy in our cafe as well as super-secret items for our planned monthly special promotions. Ideally, we could do this economically, but in the real world to make us EPIC, we need EPIC contributions from AWESOME people like YOU! 

We're going to have some stellar perks for our contributors. There will be a clear distinction for the different kinds of perks, for obvious reasons. We don't have our own rocketship to land in your area but we will offer rewards for your contributions. Our top incentives include some special parties that we'll throw Just For You! Whether you're an individual, a fan group, a group of friends, or a business, we welcome your generous contributions and we WANT you to be a part of this campaign to make the most EPIC Geek Centre in Dallas!

Link opens treasure chest and finds...

What we bring to the business world is passion and dedication. We want to show YOU the unique retail experience that we offer which gives GEEKS like you the items they want, need, and especially those they don't know exist yet. We are offering an experience- things like trivia nights, movie marathons,  and our sensational cafe with an abundance of treats and delights. We are creating a serious and dedicated business, with a dash or two of fun thrown in! 

Why should you fund with us? Because we're making YOUR dreams come true by making OUR vision a reality! We've listened to what other geeks like us love and we have sought out the rare and outstanding items that you will want to purchase from us, and why not just come and hang out with some fellow geeks?!

"I've got a bad feeling about this..."

It's understood that there's going to be challenges and hiccups to starting a fresh business out of the gate. We're sure to experience things like supplier issues, building delays, not having a full staff, issues with licensing rights, and availability of items. We've developed relationships with a number of different vendors, merchants, and enthusiasts which allows us a cornucopia of outstanding and Epictastic inventory available IN STORE for you to peruse and purchase. The more funds we raise, the better our flexibility will be to address whatever concerns may arise as well as give our visitors the experience they seek. Obviously, concerns can and will arise like gremlins, so we know to be flexible and with our vast array of business connections, there should be a minimum of hangups. 

An ally has joined your party...

We have several ways of keeping in contact with our loyal geek and nerd army. You'll be able to find us on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and other forms of social media that we have conquered. If you would like to enlist in our heroic adventure, please SHARE our campaign and SPREAD the love with your friends and fellow geeks. To those businesses who would be interested in working with us, we'll appreciate and encourage mutual support between businesses. As you're willing to support us, we will return the favor in kind. Cast your spell over your friends, family, colleagues, and other dwarves and elves you associate with and spread the word across the land about our journey. This is why our tagline is Epicness Awaits....

story:
At face value this is a story like any other BBQ restaurant startup. Three friends, David, Matt and Vlad come together to start a no frills restaurant with a focus on meat, slow smoked to perfection, and an atmosphere fit to enjoy it in. Where this story strays from the narrative of other BBQ startups is it’s setting, Chisinau, the capital of the former Soviet Republic of Moldova.

So how did we get here?


Many roads. David, an Electrical Engineer by schooling and Matt, a graduate of the Drucker School of Management both joined the Peace Corps and were assigned to work in the development sector in Moldova. Regularly referred to as the “poorest country in Europe” Moldova has struggled in the last 20 years to modernize its economy and find a future outside of the shadow of the Soviet Union. Through their time in the Peace Corps, David and Matt implemented community projects and advised on the development of small business. They were struck by the amount of untapped opportunity in the Moldovan market as well as the general reluctance of people to try and start a business against the backdrop of bureaucracy and corruption. The opportunities, as well as the desire to challenge some of the perceived "norms" that paralyze business in Moldova drove them to stay and start a venture of their own.

Vlad is Moldovan, born and bred, and hails from the future home of Smokehouse, Chisinau, Moldova. The trio met through contacts in the business development community where Vlad actively volunteered his time with entrepreneurial organizations like CEDA when not working as a manager at an IT company. Vlad met David and Matt in Spring of 2014 and the three instantly bonded over their passions for food, interesting beers, and bringing communities of people together.

With divergent backgrounds, common passions, a shared commitment to Moldova This trio embarked on a course to open the first American BBQ restaurant in the country.

So why BBQ?

Because it’s awesome. David and Matt have each loved pulled pork, perfect crunchy coleslaw and BBQ sauce with the right amount of vinegar and sweet for years. Through their time in Peace Corps they used their love of cooking and BBQ numerous times to run food booth fundraisers. Taking advantage of concerts, holidays and other events to support local causes and charities. Now, they want to use this product that they’ve tested and found to be an intersection of American and Moldovan tastes to bring a new kind of dining experience to Chisinau, Moldova.

Impact What We Need & What You Get

We have enough money to do the minimum needed to open the doors, but without getting the location up to the look, feel, and additional touches needed to call our place an authentic BBQ joint. In particular we are looking for funding to:

  • find creative ways using wood and artistic flare to cover up and/or alter some of the bizarre interior to feel like a true American BBQ joint

  • remodel to add a second bathroom. Currently there is only one unisex bathroom and that seems insufficient for a beer and BBQ joint

  • commission local furniture makers to build our chairs and tables (as opposed to patio furniture)

  • remodel the exterior (beyond basic signage) in order to put our brand out on the street for pedestrians to see and be drawn in

  • We also want to serve free filtered water to our guests (unheard of in Moldova and most of Europe) and would need to install a high quality filtration system

Lastly, we need additional funds to protect ourselves in case of delays and surprise expenses that typically wouldn't be quite problematic if we were doing this in America. One example of this is paying for laboratory tests and certifying our commercial smoker. Any additional funds we raise that don't go to these items will be put to use in buying idea paint to make some very cool sections for our customers to be able to have productive lunch meetings while enjoying tasty BBQ.

The Impact

Support for us not only helps us open our restaurant, but also supports the ideals of our business. In particular we have laid out the following as ways to implement our philosophy of business.

  1. Committing ourselves to business practices that are legal and follow international standards of conduct set out by Transparency International.

  2. In addition to our passion about BBQ we have a passion about Moldova. We commit ourselves to carefully select our suppliers with consideration to supporting local entrepreneurial efforts and to presenting customers with engaging stories of startup efforts in Moldova. The cafe will strive to serve products made locally which convey the message “Made With Pride In Moldova.”

To support our commitment to transparency we came up with our social side project called Open Source Entrepreneurship. In this we share our experiences (both the good and the bad) about getting a small business started in the Republic of Moldova. We want to encourage professionals to start their own business and to hopefully show a path forward through an admittedly difficult system.

Your support is going towards a BBQ restaurant in Chisinau and will additionally help us further the ideals and passions that brought us here in the first place. This time, fueled with BBQ.

Risks & Challenges

Opening a restaurant is risky. Starting a business in Moldova is risky. Doing both with little experience, may make us crazy. We believe that bit of crazy is going to serve us well as we overcome the challenges that get in our way. It is our belief and experience that being able to prevail over risks like these hinges almost entirely on the determination, flexibility and creativity of the team. We have great confidence in our team and are prepared to meet these challenges, and unforeseen others, head on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign, Check out our page on facebook, and tell your friends.

If you are in Moldova and are interested in helping paint/build/clean anything at all drop us a line on our facebook page.

Check out our remodel process which we are documenting on Instagram

Thanks for your support!

story:
Who is Trellis?

In the fall of 2014, we, Jackie Clifford and Marlene van Es, approached the Pittsburgh Food Policy Council in order to start a student group to provide policy and research assistance to those focusing on local food issues. After building the student organization, completing policy memos, and talking with Grow Pittsburgh, a local non-profit organization focusing on these issues, we began to realize that there is a huge need for business and legal support in the urban agriculture community. This gap in legal & business services, coupled with our passion for local foods and environmentalism have brought us here, as Trellis, to build brand awareness and raise funds so that we can begin our journey. We believe our business will facilitate the removal of the business and legal barriers that can inhibit businesses, non profits, and local citizens trying to pursue their dreams. With your help, we will begin to see Pittsburgh (and maybe beyond) become a haven for local food and sustainable development. Join us on this exciting journey - we'll keep you in the loop every step of the way! Check out our infographic on our launch timeline under the gallery tab!

How We'll do It

Trellis is reimagining legal and business services through a unique and affordable subscription based pricing model. To better serve organizations and individuals reliant on grants and small loans, we will charge monthly, subscription based rates or flat, project based rates. This pricing model will allow for more predictable legal and business fees for our clients instead of confusing hourly rates that come with traditional legal firms. Our pricing model will allow our clients to pay over longer periods time, while still allowing our firm to remain sustainable. As active members of the Pittsburgh Food Policy Council and of the urban agriculture & ecological development community, we want to be more than simply the "lawyers." We want to become "partners in the process."

We seek to offer the following legal & business services: 

  • Land and project zoning, permitting, and real estate transactions
  • Legal representation for urban agriculture and ecological projects/businesses
  • Business planning guidance & filing for urban agriculture and ecological projects
  • Build market and contract opportunities between local food and ecologically focused businesses
  • Policy work, food security, and urban agriculture advocacy in front of city government bodies 
  • White paper and decision analysis development 

What We Need & What You Get 

In order to move Trellis towards serving the Pittsburgh urban agriculture & ecological development community, we need your help! To keep our prices affordable, we intend to keep our overhead costs as low as possible. With that being said, we still need working capital to cover the following:

  • legal search engine
  • shared office space to meet clients
  • business filing fees
  • transportation to and from client meetings
  • liability insurance 
  • marketing collateral & website
  • initial employee salary costs - funds will not be used for this purpose before business operations begin

While the real reward comes with helping make Pittsburgh a sustainable and green economy, we wanted to make sure anyone who donates knows how much it means to us. Here are some perks! 

  • Donations from $5-$25 receive a hand-written thank you note 
  • Donations from $50-$100 receive an invitation to our formal launch event in the fall
  • Donations of $125+ receive a Trellis waterbottle
  • Anyone who donates can also request to receive a free copy of "A Non Profit's Guide to Legal Services," which breaks down the intricacies of obtaining affordable legal services as a non-profit and tips on how to get the service that best fits the need

If we do not meet our fundraising goal of $20,000, we will prioritize available funds across the following: purchasing a legal search engine, filing our business fees and liability insurance, office space, marketing, and salaries. 

The Impact

  • Help local farmers and ecologically-minded developers create profitable businesses using vacant and/or available lot space in/around the city of Pittsburgh.
  • Become a partner to urban agriculture & ecological development citizens, businesses, and non-profits in the Pittsburgh area - not simply act as the "lawyers." 
  • Abandon the traditional, billable hours profit model and charge project-based & subscription-based fees to help citizens, businesses, and non-profits better plan for their policy, legal, and business services expenditures. 
  • A greener, more profitable, and ecological Pittsburgh. 

Risks & Challenges

Trellis seeks to offer services to a very niche market, which naturally limits our customer base. However, we have been building our involvement in the community and engaging potential clients for over five months, which will lead to inflows of referrals from those we've communicated and worked with so far. We seek to offer a variety of services that will allow us to serve a larger number of ecologically minded clients.

We have experience in agriculture, environmental development and have developed our skills in law through environmental law clerkships.  So, while we will be newly minted attorneys, we have practical experience and are building a board of advisors and mentors to help guide us in our venture. 

While starting a new business always has risks, we have been working with business mentors and partners to make sure our model is sound and viable. 

Trellis also received third place in the Pitt Start Up Competition in January of 2015 and is currently in the final round of the Pitt Big Idea Competition (stay tuned!), making Trellis one of 30 teams who made the final cut out of over 100 original applicants - we're psyched. Trellis will also be entering the Uprize and Intersector start up competitions this spring.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate money today? That's okay! 

Here are a few ways you can help: 

  • Follow us on social media: Twitter (@TrellisPGH) & Facebook (Trellis)
  • Once you follow us, mention us to your friends and share our campaign with them using the share tools on our Indiegogo site! 
  • Don't forget to hashtag #TrellisIndieGoGo on all social media platforms!
  • Share our website with your friends and family and read our blogs to stay in the loop - www.trellispgh.com 
Disclaimer-Trellis will be filing its LLC status in the next few months. Donations currently go to a separate account for Trellis funds held under the principals' names. Trellis will begin offering policy services in August 2015. Trellis principals are not currently licensed attorneys but are taking the upcoming PA Bar exam to begin practicing law in November 2015. Donations do not establish an attorney-client privilege with either of the Trellis Principals or guarantee you legal representation by Trellis in the future. Additionally, your donation does not give you any capital, equity, or similar ownership interest in any entity formed using donations from Indiegogo.com.
story_txt:
Who is Trellis? 

In the
fall of 2014, we, Jackie Clifford and Marlene van Es, approached the Pittsburgh
Food Policy Council in order to start a student group to provide policy and
research assistance to those focusing on local food issues. After building the student organization, completing policy memos, and
talking with Grow Pittsburgh, a local non-profit organization focusing on these issues, we began to realize that there is a huge need for
business and legal support in the urban agriculture community. This gap in legal & business services, coupled with our passion for local foods and
environmentalism have brought us here, as Trellis, to build brand awareness and raise funds so that we can begin our journey. We believe our
business will facilitate the removal of the business and legal barriers that can inhibit businesses, non profits, and local citizens trying to pursue their dreams. With your help, we will begin to see Pittsburgh (and maybe beyond) become a haven for local food
and sustainable development. Join us on this exciting journey - we'll keep you in the loop every step of the way! Check out our infographic on our launch timeline under the gallery tab!
How We'll do It
Trellis is reimagining legal and business services through a unique and affordable subscription based pricing model. To better serve organizations and individuals reliant on grants and small loans, we will charge monthly, subscription based rates or flat, project based rates. This pricing model will allow for more predictable legal and business fees for our clients instead of confusing hourly rates that come with traditional legal firms. Our pricing model will allow our clients to pay over longer periods time, while still allowing our firm to remain sustainable. As active members of the Pittsburgh Food Policy Council and of the urban agriculture & ecological development community, we want to be more than simply the "lawyers." We want to become "partners in the process."

We seek to offer the following legal & business services: 

Land and project zoning, permitting, and real estate transactions
Legal representation for urban agriculture and ecological projects/businesses
Business planning guidance & filing for urban agriculture and ecological projects
Build market and contract opportunities between local food and ecologically focused businesses

Policy work, food security, and urban agriculture advocacy in front of city government bodies 


White paper and decision analysis development 



What We Need & What You Get 
In order to move Trellis towards serving the Pittsburgh urban agriculture & ecological development community, we need your help! To keep our prices affordable, we intend to keep our overhead costs as low as possible. With that being said, we still need working capital to cover the following:


legal search engine

shared office space to meet clients
business filing fees
transportation to and from client meetings
liability insurance 
marketing collateral & website
initial employee salary costs - funds will not be used for this purpose before business operations begin


While the real reward comes with helping make Pittsburgh a sustainable and green economy, we wanted to make sure anyone who donates knows how much it means to us. Here are some perks! 


Donations from $5-$25 receive a hand-written thank you note 
Donations from $50-$100 receive an invitation to our formal launch event in the fall
Donations of $125+ receive a Trellis waterbottle
Anyone who donates can also request to receive a free copy of "A Non Profit's Guide to Legal Services," which breaks down the intricacies of obtaining affordable legal services as a non-profit and tips on how to get the service that best fits the need


If we do not meet our fundraising goal of $20,000, we will prioritize available funds across the following: purchasing a legal search engine, filing our business fees and liability insurance, office space, marketing, and salaries. 
    The Impact 
Help local farmers and ecologically-minded developers create profitable businesses using vacant and/or available lot space in/around the city of Pittsburgh. Become a partner to urban agriculture & ecological development citizens, businesses, and non-profits in the Pittsburgh area - not simply act as the "lawyers."  Abandon the traditional, billable hours profit model and charge project-based & subscription-based fees to help citizens, businesses, and non-profits better plan for their policy, legal, and business services expenditures. 
A greener, more profitable, and ecological Pittsburgh.     Risks & Challenges  Trellis seeks to offer services to a very niche market, which naturally limits our customer base. However, we have been building our involvement in the community and engaging potential clients for over five months, which will lead to inflows of referrals from those we've communicated and worked with so far. We seek to offer a variety of services that will allow us to serve a larger number of ecologically minded clients.
We have experience in agriculture, environmental development and have developed our skills in law through environmental law clerkships.  So, while we will be newly minted attorneys, we have practical experience and are building a board of advisors and mentors to help guide us in our venture. 
While starting a new business always has risks, we have been working with business mentors and partners to make sure our model is sound and viable. 
Trellis also received third place in the Pitt Start Up Competition in January of 2015 and is currently in the final round of the Pitt Big Idea Competition (stay tuned!), making Trellis one of 30 teams who made the final cut out of over 100 original applicants - we're psyched. Trellis will also be entering the Uprize and Intersector start up competitions this spring.
    Other Ways You Can Help Can't donate money today? That's okay! 
Here are a few ways you can help:   Follow us on social media: Twitter (@TrellisPGH) & Facebook (Trellis)
Once you follow us, mention us to your friends and share our campaign with them using the share tools on our Indiegogo site! 
Don't forget to hashtag #TrellisIndieGoGo on all social media platforms! Share our website with your friends and family and read our blogs to stay in the loop - www.trellispgh.com 

Disclaimer-Trellis will be filing its LLC status in the next few months. Donations currently go to a separate account for Trellis funds held under the principals' names. Trellis will begin offering policy services in August 2015. Trellis principals are not currently licensed attorneys but are taking the upcoming PA Bar exam to begin practicing law in November 2015. Donations do not establish an attorney-client privilege with either of the Trellis Principals or guarantee you legal representation by Trellis in the future. Additionally, your donation does not give you any capital, equity, or similar ownership interest in any entity formed using donations from Indiegogo.com.

story:
Hi from CATLOGRAM

We help you design Beautiful Brochures / Flyers / Catalogs / Marketing Collateral - from templates designed by creative designers -All you have to do is add your logo, images and Text with our Drag N Drop Editor.

A BIG PROBLEM

At some point, we all are in need of to design a Brochures / Flyers / Catalogs / Marketing Collateral for our START UP, SMALL BUSINESSES, PERSONAL INITIATIVES, COMMUNITY or SCHOOL PROJECTS.

But chasing a designer to get the quotations, Explaining the concept, Getting a first draft and confirming a design - you end up paying anything $500 and Up and more than a week of precious time!

If not, you need to be a designer with proficiency in design software like adobe and born with some creativity genes.

THE CREATIVE SOLUTION

Catlogram is a collection of beautiful Brochures / Flyers / Catalogs / Marketing Collateral.

All you have to do is

  1. CHOOSE A TEMPLATE
  2. ADD YOUR LOGO / TEXT / IMAGES / COLORS
  3. DOWNLOAD AS PDF

Good news is ...CATLOGRAM is incubated at QBIC - The largest Business Incubation centre in the MENA region. Catlogram was born out of our 8 years of business experience in the Design and Marketing Communication experience.The pain the people go through when they need to put up a Brochure / Flyer / Catalog / Marketing Collateral in the last minute to show a client or for an event.

We have been funded to make an MVP. But we are raising more funds to cover costs for hiring more developers & designers for including the features like :

  • Multiple Page Brochures,
  • Upload Corporate Template and make corporate designs
  • Hire 2 Designers to create 500 brochure templates for various industries.
  • Add more images for users to use in their designs
  • Provide round the clock Customer Service

story:
It's time real foods stop feeling like a "have to" food and start feeling like a "gotta have it!" food.

We want to show that whole food can be just as cool, sexy and desirable as junk food if marketed the right way. Aka, let’s stop trying to educate people on why they should eat real food and instead make them want real food because of its inherent coolness!

The idea all started with a five-year-old who wanted a sports drink after soccer practice even though he didn't like the taste of it. Take a look:


We want YOUR help. We don't want an apple board as our client. We don't want a grocery store chain. We want YOU. 

We believe consumers are sick of being guilted into healthy foods. We believe YOU want to help send a message that real foods need to change the way they advertise and show they are just as sexy as their unhealthy counterparts.


Who The Heck Are We?!?

"We" are an ad agency in Southern California that wants to change the way food is advertised. "We" have done this type of thing for clients like Dell, Wells Fargo, will.i.am and a host of others. "We" want to change the conversation, show real foods as the exciting foods they are, and get your help in sending a message to the advertising industry as a whole.

"We" are The Buddy Group and have invested more than $75,000 of our own resources into building out the marketing strategy and advertising campaign for the humble apple.


Why Indiegogo?!?

We think Indiegogo is the perfect platform to fund the campaign. Rather than go to an apple board or grocery chain, going direct to you, the consumer, allows an opportunity for more risk in the campaign creative. It also lets you get involved in the campaign right from the beginning.

Plus, we've got some pretty cool perks! Autographed cookbooks from celebrity chefs, limited edition campaign t-shirts, custom artwork and more. We hope you want to help us send a message and we want to give you some great perks along the way!


The Funding Brings It All To Life

We believe in this campaign, but simply can't afford to fund the whole thing on our own. We've already invested $75,000 in agency resources to build out the marketing strategy and creative campaign. Here's what your funds help us do:

BiteTastefully.com website built out with shareable content and recipes. 

An online store with fun "Bite Me" swag so you can get all kinds of fun ways to say "Bite me," "Squeeze me," "Grab me," "Delicious," "Juicy" and more. We'll keep prices super low, but the small profits raised will also help fund the ongoing expenses of the campaign so it doesn't die off. 

Build-out of the campaign's social media accounts, including ongoing posting of content and interacting with the Bite Me fans.

Creation of print and digital ads that we'll make available for publishing partners to include in their publications.


To also create some amazing Bite Me videos, buy social media advertising to get the word out, and integrate with marketing partners to extend the Bite Me reach.



For the cost of celebrity influencers to incorporate into the campaign, and to do some event marketing in major cities.

So we can purchase outdoor billboards in major cities!

The more we raise and the more people involved, the more OTHER brands will want to get involved too and help spread the Bite Me message! So it truly helps whether you contribute $10 or $100 (But we really hope you contribute $100!).

No matter the amount raised, we'll be 100% transparent and always update you on how the campaign will be built out. When we need help making a decision, we'll post a survey so we can get the opinion of you — our client!

The Perks

First, Get Squeezed with a shout-out on the BiteTastefully.com website. You'll help make it possible to post recipes, fun images, sassy shareable content and more.


Or, Stick It to tell the world how you really feel with the Bite Me sticker suite.


To make a bigger statement, try on our T-shirt perks.


Help us go big with a Custom Artwork Tile from Shayne Tuthill's Bite Me mural. See a sample of Shayne's work below and visit his site at hereshaynewas.com.


Help write the story of the Bite Me campaign with an Autographed Book from some of the top chefs and restaurateurs in the country. Each chef is also contributing an apple recipe that will be added to your book.


Truly lend your hand in making the Bite Me campaign by being a Production Assistant on set while we shoot footage for the campaign.



Still Want More?!?

Learn everything about the Bite Me campaign by downloading:

  • The Strategy and Background Research
  • The Creative Brief
  • The Pitch Deck

Thank you and bite me!

Help write the story of the Bite Me campaign with an Autographed Book from some of the top chefs and restaurateurs in the country. Each chef is also contributing an apple recipe that will be added to your book.

The Creative Brief

   Thank you and bite me!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

  • We need about $6000 to buy a good reliable van to drive our tours.
  • Our goal is to ultimately pay back everything that is donated to our cause. 
  • We also are offering free Adventure Tours for anyone who makes a donation.

The Impact

Laie Adventure Tours isn't like the other tour companies on Oahu. We don't cram a bunch of strangers in a bus and rush them around the island. We take great care in providing our guests with quality, intimate Adventures of Oahu. By contributing to our van fund you are helping others experience the beauty of Hawaii and helping us provide for our families.

Risks & Challenges

Our company is still young but we were having success booking and driving tours until our van broke. We are 100% confident we will be successful when we are able to start driving again.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Pray for us.
